description: Good, though expensive, mechanic in Liberia. One of the managers speaks very good English and his mechanics seem to be very good. We had to order parts for our F250, which only took them 1 day. We were allowed to stay in our camper on the site of the garage. There's a guard at night and we even had electricity. Next morning they offered us to take a shower in their apartment, which is next to the office of the garage. Coffee and water is free and toilets are clean. Pricey but professional!

name: Flamingo Beach - Playa Flamingo
description:
Its a very quiet and safe place, no worries at night, few visitors at beach, no water, wifi, or electricity. Banks, supermarkets, ATM, restaurants, stores and hotels close. You can camp with tents or RVs next to beach and on the roadside. 
Un lugar tranquilo sin preocupaciones durante la noche, pocas personas en la playa, no hay wifi, agua o electricidad. Hay restaurantes, tiendas, bancos, hoteles y supermercados cerca, se puede acampar con tiendas o con campers a la orilla de la carretera y a la par de la playa

name: El Chontal
description: cabinas and camping: beautiful place with a big garden on the Golfo Dulce, camping area in shade near the water, common area very chill. price: 10$ per person. Definitely worth it.

name: ZGas (Fill bottles, not tanks)
description: One of the few places to fill propane tanks that we have found in the area. Can fill US portable 20lbs tanks. Can not fill fixed tanks.

name: Riverside Camping La Virgin
description: Quite spot next to the river just across and next to the bridge (on the eastern bank). Rocky but easy to get level, quite a few rafting companies use the area during the day but very quiet at night. Police stopped by in the evening and again drove past at night, felt very safe. Toucans in the area.

name: Gas Station TOTAL
description: Overnight place between San José and Puerto Limon. We could park in a parking lot and use the toilet of the gas station. Nearby there is a Taco Bell and an ATM. WiFi

name: TamaHostel & Glamping
description: Perfect place to camp with roof-top vans in the parking area, they don't accept tents, the place is newly renovated with hostel and glamping and pool, good vibe, super equipped kitchen, very clean bathroom, price is 10-15$ per person, very close to center and beach

name: Solis Motors
description: VW shop specializing in aircooled motors. stop by with any vw and they will either be able to help you or point you in the right direction for parts stores or other shops. They have a Facebook page.

name: Playa Linda
description: This gps location is for the road leading to Playa Linda. Look for the two cellphone/radio towers for the turn off. Park anywhere on the beach. Don't leave vehicle unattended-there were two rental vehicle break-ins while we were there in one day. Cops drove by a few times and were looking into it. Felt safe even with the petty theft. Watch out for the hordes of crabs if sleeping in a tent. Bautiful beach with lots of coconuts to be had.

name: Dry River (at least now)
description: Dry river. Lots of shade. Good campsite.

name: Isthmus Extraordinaire!
description:
great camping spot but not much shade. busy but nice bay, stunning sunset, ok for snorkeling. short walk to isthmus. expensive grocery store up the road. fishermen throughout the night

-locals said camping is allowed on he beach. Absolutely breathtaking beach. 
* paid toilets and showers during the day*

name: Big & cheap Pizza - Solo Bueno
description:
Well.. tomate sauce was too sweet but pizza was ok. Definitely price is the best. Family restaurant with loud tv sound. Is ok. I'm argentinian so know about good pizzeria.

la pizza tenía la salsa de tomate muy dulce pero la pizza es rica. Esta bien no esperen gran cosa. Lo que si el precio si es muy barato. pueden llevar bebidas especialmente cerveza ya que no venden

name: Playa Ocotal Carrilo
description:
On a parking lot 2 steps from the beach semi private estate behind the Picante restaurant, free of charge, no wifi, we were allowed to use the toilet and shower from the restaurant, beach shower. You have to pass 2 controls where you are just asked your name. Beware of the big DC road is narrow. 

Sur un parking à 2 pas de la plage lotissement semi privé derrière le restaurant Picante, gratuit, pas de wifi, nous avons eu l'autorisation d'utiliser les WC et douche du restaurant, douche de plage. Il faut passer 2 contrôles où on vous demande juste votre nom. Attention au gros CC la route est étroite.

name: Beach Near River
description: Loads of camping spots. Just a beach. Near a river.

name: El Caiman
description: they offer camping at this location for 3000 colones on the river, no electricidad but beautiful area as well as cabins available 12km further down the road.

name: Hostel Rio Danta
description: Hostel where they allowed us to stay and use toilet, hot shower, kitchen and wifi. Very friendly owners, who really took care about us. So we used the laundry service of the hostel and they gave us a key to get into the hostel at night. We payed 4$ per night/camper.

name: Public Beach Playa Hermosa
description: Good place to hang a couple of days. Just between the road and the beach, 10 meter away from high tide under several trees with good shade. No services, just a couple of stand selling coconuts or souvenirs... and several surfers around. You can see Ballena Marine Reserve from here or even walk the beach for a couple of hours to visit it avoiding the entry fee. Feel safe with beach watchers during the day and the police was patroling every hour during the night. FREE

name: Public Beach
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: WARNING! Thefts and vandalism reported in this location. Please use caution.

Free camping right on the beach, frequent police patrols at night and during the day. Can use shower and toilets from the campground on the other side of the road for 300 colones. Beautiful beach and some shade for your camper.

name: Parque Recreativo Los Manantiales
description: Large recreation area with pools, trails and other activities. Nice. Good cold showers and restrooms. Water, picnic tables and power at site. Weekend extremely busy. They would like call or email ahead. 2458-4535 or info.losmanantiales@gmail.com. We had no reservation and it was ok. Closed on Mondays

name: Parking Lot "La Pavona"
description: Parking lot where the boat leaves to the "Tortuguero National Park", $10/night, watchman, we didn't sleep there because we didn't know if its possible but we ask the guard, driving from Guápiles to "La Pavona" takes you around 1h 30min

name: Reserva Biologica Lomas Bardudal
description:
Park entrance. Rangers were agree for we
 park here overnight. They sleep in a house here. It was the first time a RV comes here ! :-) ( edit : toilet, shower, water, electricity) Only big and quiet place for sleeping with a lot of monkeys all around.  Super easy dirt road for 15 min. Don't miss this little road, between Liberia and Bagaces, just near Pijije (there isn't any sign). After few kms, at the cross, take left.
This area is only for people who like lost land in the world.

Entree du parc. Les rangers sont ok pour qu'on y dorme. C'était la première fois qu'un camping car venait jusqu'ici. Il y a un wifi sécurisé mais nous n'avons pas demandé le code. Les rangers dorment sur place. Les coatis et les singes congos aussi, à quelques mètres. L'accès au parc se fait depuis la panamericaine à partir d'un petit chemin vers Pijije. Attention, aucune signalisation. La route, c'est poussière et pierres. Si vous pouvez faire le premier km, dites-vous que les 6 suivants sont pareils. 
C'est un coin parfait pour ceux qui aiment les trous paumés !

name: Super La casona del cafe
description:
Petite superette. Les deux frères ont accepté qu'on dorme dans notre cc sur le terrain à l'arrière pour une nuit... puis pour 3 nuits de plus.
Little shop. Owners aggree we sleep in our camper behind the shop for 4 nigths.
Free. Quiet

name: Plaza Fortuna
description: A good place to Park and sleep. In morning we can heard a bird's song. Near a lot of restaurants, market, handcrafts. Toilets in pizzaria in front of Plaza. There is water on plaza. A bealtiful view of Volcan Arenal.

name: Lago de Cote
description: A nice view to lake in a plane area. We don't sleep here but I believe that is possible. 3 km of durty road but it is OK. Any car can get here.

name: Playa Tamales
description: ADMIN NOTE: as per Maritime Law wild camping is prohibited in maritime zones, fines will be enforced. NO Camping allowed.

name: Kitesurf and Windsurf Spot
description: Great place for kitesurfing, unpaved road to the spot, grassy field to set up, a lot of rental gear (Wind- and Kitesurfing)

name: Playa Tivives
description:
On the beach at the end of a track in a private black sandy subdivision no super quiet and secure service 

Sur la plage au bout d'une piste dans un lotissement privé sable noir aucun service super tranquille et sécurisé

name: Mirador Tinamú - Camping Laguna De Hule
description:
Grassy Spot with Toilets and Shower. Nice owners. Beautiful view of Lagunda de Hule. No road to go there on GMaps. Search for Laguna de Hule on Waze or Maps.me (OSM). One Hour to Volcano Poas.

Open on weekends and during the week upon scheduling. Super nice place and owners.
Nice hikes around the lake. A must see if around the region.
Camping and cabinas available.

Accessible in 4x2 if coming from Nueva Cinchona/Cariblanco.

Road coming from Rio Quarto is super bad and really good 4x4 is required.

Fernando +506 87239566
Gustavo (English) +506 86419203

name: Alajuela
description:
Parking next to the macd'o no convenience if not the quiet macd'o toilet until 5am 

Parking à côté du macd'o pas de commodité si ce n'est les WC du macd'o tranquille jusqu'à 5h00 du matin

name: Ballena Bistro
description: The best restaurant in Costa Rica!! Directly on the highway located, with effortable very delicious food (homemade beef burger for $7), and friendly owner.

name: Blue Dream Hotel
description: Great place at Bahia Salinas with a wonderful view for $10/night, we could park next to a cabin, very friendly owner (Nicolas) likes overlanders, toilet at the restaurant, cold shower outside, nice view, pizza at the restaurant $6-$10, beach (for kitesurfing) very close, rental gear and lessons available

name: Zgas
description: can send your tank out to refil 3-4 days

name: Jaco West Beach
description: located almost as far west as you can go on Jaco beach inbetween the hotel and the beach under almond & palm trees for plenty of shade.  Next to a small playground on beach.  Safe, hotel security out at night.  Quiet all night, few people out at night but was a beautiful calm quiet evening.  Room for big rigs.  2 buisness up there is a formal fenced in campground lot, blue wall, tons of shade- named Mango Grove I believe, they have baños and duchas for rent 500/1000. Tiki bar and rest close by, but quiet or to far to hear.   Did I mention Free :-) and open free Wifi.

name: Kitesurf Spot
description: Nice beach for kitesurfing, Blue Dream Hotel has a kiteschool

name: Camping los Mangos
description:
Beautiful campground fenced-in lot, showers, baños and electricity under huge mango trees, free mangos everywhere.  Beach is just down the street.  did not stay here but used showers and refilled water. Very nice lady, insisted we fill a bag full of mangos. free open wifi on beach nearby

Update: Open wifi the closer you get to the bathrooms. The entrance is not very wide. Big rig friendly if it's less than 8.5 ft wide (2.6m) The gate is locked at 6 pm and the owner gives you a key for access to come and go. There is a lot of road noise at night, especially big rigs using their Jake breaks. 

07/2023: 5000c pp

name: Los Cocodrilos
description: Tons of crocodiles under the bridge, 2 resturants on one side, amazing quick stop and great jugo naturales

name: Los Chiles Near The Boat Departure
description: Along the children park at the boat departure on rio frio, to cano negro réserve. Free. Bathroom at the restaurant called rio frio.

name: Bar Restarante Valle Encantado
description: Dirt parking lot of restaurant. Amazing view over the valley. A little truck noise from the road. Really friendly staff/owner. It was stinking hot on the coast and we just had to escape to the hills.

name: Mini Finca Permacultura La Pacaya
description: Permaculture mini farm close to natural reserve mountains. Homes made with earth and wood. Toilets, solar heated shower, spring water for drinking, space for picnic, available at site. Parking in front of gate, at quiet dead end street, or inside the property, must check for space beforehand (pauchapo@gmail.com). Great starting point for hiking to Pico Blanco, La Cruz or Cedral peaks, or to hike the main Río Agres trail to its hidden waterfall.

name: Fogon de Mami Resturant
description: friendly family buisnes, Stayed one night.  Very welcoming to Viajeros. Parked on side of building in grass, a little more quiet but totaly right next to road with loud trucks, but less trafic at night.  Great food, baños, shower and wifi.

name: Quiet street close to protected area
description: Parking along the gravel road La Pacaya, in barrio Los Filtros. For water, electricity, toilets and showers can ask at the house with a blue gate Minifinca Permacultura La Pacaya. Contact first to make sure someone is there when you reach the place, write to pauchapo@gmail.com. There might be space for a small mobile home inside the property, but check first with owner.  Ground camping is possible inside the Mini finca, property, sleeping under a secondary forest.

name: Miss Juni
description: Hotel super tranquille 45$ avec le petit déjeuner bonne wifi

name: San Clemente
description:
On the super quiet beach facing the sea 

Sur la plage super tranquille face à la mer

name: Paradero Nahomi
description:
Overnight parking near the Paradero Nahomi. Clear water for snorkel/fishing on the bay, toilet, cold shower, water supply, firepits, security all night and friendly personnel... the park itself closes at 18h, but the parking and security is 24/7.  Walking distance to Quepos. FREE.
--absolutely amazing safe campsite--

name: Verduleria feria del agricultor
description: Great vegetable and fruits stop at competitive prices. Sra Carmen Elizondo was very friendly and patience as we got aprovisioned with fresh vegetables, they use to serve all the restaurants and hotels around Playa del Coco.

name: Parking Iglesia  La Fortuna
description:
The police recomended us this spot for an overnight right by the Church, bear the park. 
No services, in the middle of the town, plenty of restaurants around and quiet during the night.
FREE

 Free (gratis), nos parqueamos a un costado de iglesia la Fortuna, bastante tranquilo, hay un wifi de la tienda de souvenirs El Mercadito, la contraseña es Hannsg8586

name: Small Place Near River
description: As it was not possible to sleep near the Monumento Guayabo, it is only for tents, we found this little spot next to the street at a river with some kind of natural swimmingpool surrounded by great vegetation. Maybe not for really big cars, but our landcruiser fitted well, almost hidden from the street. A little bit dirty, but good for one night.

name: Cahuita Park Hotel Parking
description: A very nice parking area sitting on the ocean overlooking the National Park Cahuita.  You cannot park any closer to the park.  A very nice relaxing town, quiet camp except for the crashing waves at our door step and all those noisy howler monkeys next door in the park-Love It!  Even better Cahuita is CR only donation entrance park, you choose what to pay.  we walk in the park everyday and see trees full of monos!   RR when Bar is open but it is not always open the park is very close and they open from 6am-5pm and are very welcoming to us using thier facilities-baños and duchas to rinse.  Beautiful beaches, snorkling the reef with guild in boat 20-25 hr.  We talked to the owners when we arrived and the lady was welcoming to us. On weekend they charge for parking as its the place to park for the park, a small vehicle may get away for free like us but not sure if they welcome in a big rig.   But not a problem  there is parking in small grass area next to the road in front of entrance that will hold any rig, giant school bus there 2 days ago, just a small parking lot from the water, same same everything else.

name: Tucurrique
description:
In the street behind the church no service but quiet 

Dans la rue derriere l'eglise pas de service mais tranquille

name: La Cristalina (in La Fortuna)
description:
Gas and auto propane station. They allowed us to park our rig in their lot while we took the bus, boat, bus to Monteverde. (We did not want to drive the RV on that road.) When we returned they allowed us to spend the night. Security cameras and night security guard. 

From La Fortuna centro, the station us about 1 km south, on the right.

name: River camping
description: Under a brigde right by the river. A bit noisy during the day because of the bridge but nice spot for a night.

name: Posada Real Cafe Restaurant
description:
Beautiful courtyard cafe with street parking in front and free wifi. We were allowed to sit in the courtyard with our dog. Very kind and accommodating staff. The cafe/restaurant is now called Posada Real. They serve an amazing pour over coffee. 
A supernice beautiful café with lovely staff and a french cook. Perfect coffees, frappucino's, very good lunches with the best sandwiches and salads, and yummie fresh juices! Good WiFi most of the time. Beautiful setting with wooden floors, tables, doors and a fresco on the ceiling.

name: Golfo Dulce (camping + cabanas)
description:
cabinas golfo dulce. not nicest campground in the world. grassfield by the ocean. bad toilets&showers, altough one is currently used as hen den.

nice shaded area in garden.

4000 for 2 people

name: luna lodge
description: i was already here 9 years before and asked lana if we can come for camping. she agreed if we have meals in the restaurant. you should at least have 2 meals a day,including dinner.breakfast is 12$, lunch is 18$ and dinner 35$ per person. food is very yummi, fresh and enough! you can use the pool, showers and restroom. wifi is working between 2 pm- 6pm. they have a great yoga platform, 90mins yoga is 15$. you can book several tours. corcovado daytour is 75$ pp. spa is avaiable to. very beautiful and special place, lots of wildlife, you can watch tucans, monkeys and aras from the pool. you have to keep in mind that the lodge usually costs between 270-500$ and up for 2 pax per night. she allows campers between march and october but would like you to send an e-mail before to lanawed@lunalodge.com . and you need 4x4 because thereare several streams to cross. just drive to the very end of the road ;) you shouldn't be much bigger than a truckcamper

name: Golfito
description: Dans la rue face a la capitainerie du port tranquille pas de service

name: Base of Waterfall Camp @ pull out
description: This is a nice size pull off right at the base of the waterfall.  Free.  High trafic for viewing the waterfall durring the day and especially weekend.  We arrived Friday afternoon, shared spaced with everyone coming and going but after dark was very quiet. Room for tour bus or two or a nice big rig :-).  Perfect spot for us in our VW Bus.  Used water from rio to wash.  Artisanos on other side of road, said no problem to stay here.

name: Orange Fenced Parking Lot Camp
description: Nice large fenced parking lot, friendly staff, banos & a ducha on the edge of the town center next to the stadium.  Clean, open, quiet at night.  Plenty of space for big rigs.  Happy to have other overlanders.  We stayed for 3 nights between a game at the stadium and picking a friend up at the airport.  Enjoyed dancing in the main plaza on the weekend to live music and finding everything else we needed and wanted in town.  Would recomend.  Hours 6am - 11pm gate.  We paid 10,000 colones on the big game night and only 5,000 on the other 2 nights.  Game night the lot was full by 4pm Saturday, packed like sardines!  would recomend for that safe airport layover :-)

name: Cafetería y Panadería Suiza
description: This Swiss Bakery has a variety of fresh and crusty baked goods (e.g. Butter-Braid, whole grain bread, croissants, puff-pastries) and much more. The bakery is open from Tuesday from 6am till 5pm and Sundays till 3pm. Closed on Monday.

name: 3R - Tres Erres Bodyshop
description:
Big and highly professional bodyshop. We had a leak in our roof As the roofrack had fallen into the roof. We got it fixed in Managua but this was a bad job so we had to get it done again. 3R has three locations in town this one in Uruca being the most suitable for bigger vehicles. The owner and managers were super friendly, letting us camp in the shop with WiFi, showers and they even brought us sandwiches cookies and drinks in the evening. The next day they offered us a Free breakfast buffet at the staff cafetaria. The job was fast and really well done but ofcourse this comes with a price. Make sure you get a quote before they start to work and watch out for gringo prices. Remember everything is negotiable in central America so stand your ground. That said, I've not often seen bodyshops this big and pro, even compared to US and EU standards. 


Open 7am-5pm

name: Almacen Fiscal El Coco
description: We are storing our truck and camper here, indoors for $4.50/day. Phone number 2432-4648.

name: Children's Museum And Art Gallery
description: If you wanna do something inexpensive and cool in the city while it rains come enjoy the museum Free wifi and parking 2,200 colones or person

name: Samara Streer
description:
In the street in Samara. Quiet night. Not far from El Coco campsite for free! 

Dans la rue à Samara. Nuit tranquille. Pas loin du camping El coco gratuit!

name: Soccer Field
description: Camped next to soccer field. Not much room for bigger rigs to turn around.

name: Soda Sabor Tico
description: Very reasonable priced breakfast in this expensive tourist town! We paid 2800 for breakfast (5/6 pieces of bacon, scrambled eggs, 2 toast, coffee and orange juice). No forced tip or service charge but we gladly gave a tip. They serve lunch and dinner as well for very reasonable prices compared to what we had seen at the other restaurants in town. Pretty sure they offer free wifi as well and have sockets to charge your devices at.

name: By The River
description: Nice camping spot by the river. Great little swimming hole just up the river on the right. Also had a local tell us there is a waterfall about 15 minutes walk upstream. Small rocky road on the north side of the bridge. Very little room to turn around but was doable with a mini van. I would suggest walking the road before driving it as it is fairly short. Limited parking. Temperature at night was great!! We marked the coordinates at the wrong side of the bridge, sorry, maybe someone can change it at some point 😉

name: Volcano Poas
description:
You must buy tickets online from sumac.go.cr. Or from a fiends down the hill.

$15 usd/person + $6  parking. The visit to the viewpoint is limited to 20 minutes. After that you have to leave. 

Dogs are not permitted into the park.

name: Territorio De Zaguates
description: Dog shelter with roughly 700 dogs at the moment. Most are let run free during the days on the property. The owner said she would be open to people camping at the place for a donation to the organization. Gate (it's red) is closed majority of the time so it is best to contact them on their Facebook page before arriving. Territorio zaguates official. When we got there people left and opened the gate so we just drove thru.

name: Soccer Field
description: The guy at the little store next to the soccer field said it's ok to camp here for a night. Lots of flat parking here. There is also an outside tap at the building by the soccer field but the water was yellowish.

name: Boat From La Pavona to Tortuguero
description: Here the boat leaves to tortuguero. One way 3,20$/1600C. No extra charge for dogs. The time of the boat ride depends on the water level. It took us about 1 hour in June. It's a nice boat trip and if you are lucky you see some wildlife. The boat from La Pavona leaves at 7:30am, 11am, 1 pm, 4:30pm. The boat going back from tortuguero leaves at 5:30am, 9am, 11am, 3pm. Parking at the parking lot 10$/night, we paid 6$ for half a day (the time we were in tortuguero). The green turtles are at the coast in July. The leatherback turtles around March.

name: Parking spot  at gas station
description: Big parking space by Total Liberia gastation, quiet, safe, under mango trees which you can have for breakfast, free.

name: parking on the beach
description:
The village next to the park is full of pushy people and parking scams. we left.
The parking is free, but some guys in 'official' park uniforms make you think that you have to pay. not a relaxed atmosphere.

name: Playa Blanca
description:
Beautiful spot! After 1 km of easy trail, by the beach and in the shade. Very quiet place. Accessible by motorhome. No wifi. Perfect place for wild camping, nothing more to hope for! There are here by dozens, the parakeets too! A few small restaurants nearby plus a guesthouse that rents kayaks. About 500m stretch of beach with multiple areas to park and camp.
.....
Après 1 km de piste facile, en bord de plage et à l'ombre. Endroit très calme. Accessible en camping-car. Pas de wifi. Endroit parfait pour le camping sauvage, Rien à espérer de plus ! Les Ara sont ici par dizaines, les perruches aussi !

name: Restaurante y cabinas Ellisa
description: Our van had a mechanical problem so we have to stop, the owner of the restaurant charge us 10 US $ por using the parking at the back, they have security, wifi, electricity and bathrooms

name: Beside restaurant Villa Ellisa
description: Ask for Willima, very friendly, they accept credit card, for a 3hs job they charge me $30

name: school parking lot
description:
Quiet and flat gravel spot by the bridge over the Rio Grande de Terraba. Little  traffic noise. No facilities. Free. Ok for a night. Restaurant 200m away.

Disclaimer: I stayed from a Saturday to a Sunday. During the week you'll probably get woken up by the sound of kids. So maybe not so great during the week. But then they might also let you use the school toilet. 

Alternatively there are multiple spots at the river.

name: El Turista/Sol y Arena
description:
10$ for night. this hostel is pretty neutral, nothing happens but feels a little shady. staff is not really talking a lot but they do nothing bad. 
basic things like shower and toilet of course, haven't seen a kitchen (wasn't looking for one). 
it's ok for one night.
wifi name is different than the place name. restaurant is few meters from the place, just like bus terminal.

name: Bekuo Hostel
description: Friendly hostel from +\-15 walk distance of downtown San José. Dormbed for 11,- us dollar. Parking in front of the hostal for a car. After moving some stuff, possible to park in the secure parkinggarage for one, maybe two motorbikes. Clean bathrooms, kitchen to cook, supermarked close by, restaurants and bars, pool table, steady WiFi and a friendly staff for information.

name: roadside parking bay
description: Level parking bay next to bus stop right by the highway. A little busy during the day, quiet and well lit at night. Opposite gringo restaurant Santa Marta (toilets). The only level spot around. Nice views, weather permitting. Free.

name: Que Tuanis
description: Very friendly and helpful staff. Amazing dinner. Can camp on property for $6 per person

name: Cascada Las Lomas
description:
Small & quiet waterfall. No electricity, no nothing but waterfall (can drink water) and nature. It's usd 2 per person, its 'owner' is a really nice farmer called Michael.
We spent a night there with our camper.
A fall just for us. Better not to go on weekends. Theres another fall (free) a few kms away, but parking's far from fall.

name: georgi hotel
description: The nice guy here let us camp out front , power and water , nice beach good waves just short walk , wanted 20-25 USD a night , managed to get it down to 16 a night , not sure if they really want overlanders here though , worth a try if the waves a good

name: huge flat lot by the road
description: Large open lot beside the road. Level, a little bumpy, pretty quiet. Enough space to park an aircraft carrier or two. Owner of the lot is the construction company next door. They and the other neighbour (little shed in the back) were ok with me camping for a night. Free.

name: restaurant parking
description:
Open lot next to restaurant (it's their parking) two blocks from the bus terminal to Tortuguero. Check with restaurant before staying. They were ok with me sleeping and leaving the van there the next day while I went to Tortuguero.
Next to the restaurant there is also a bar which was open until midnight (music playing). Not super quiet during the day (some traffic noise) but seemed safe to park. Free.
To Tortuguero: walk to terminal viejo (400m), take bus to La Pavona (1100 C one way, buy ticket in bus). There, take boat to Tortuguero (1600 C one way, buy ticket at jetty/hotel/parking). First bus to La Pavona 5:30, last boat from Tortuguero 15:00.

name: Roadside on very quiet side road
description:
Level roadside spot 300m from police station. Very quiet road, maybe one car every two hours. Nice surroundings, very quiet, cool, free. OK with police. 
You might be able to pop your tent here, too, but I'd check with the police first.

name: Los 3 hermanas
description:
After eating well, we were able to stay in the closed car park with guard for the night. The place is quite noisy as we are at a big intersection. Wi-Fi correct pin: toroymono. 

Après avoir bien mangé, on a pu rester sur la parking fermé avec gardien pour la nuit. L'endroit est assez bruyant car nous sommes à une grosse intersection. Wi-Fi correct pin : toroymono.

name: Toyota Mechanics
description: Engine body everything work by qualified mechanics. Super friendly and super trustworthy.

name: Quiet flat area off the road
description:
This spot is just 100m from the other marked spot which seems no longer suitable (you'd have to park right on the road and get the direct noise, dust and stones from passing traffic).
Follow the concrete track a little uphill instead and you will reach a widening of the road, wide enough to get a bit away from passing cars and to park even larger trucks. Quiet, level, free.

name: Hotel Plimio
description:
Correction: $13-14 pp is the price of dorms.
Very clean hostel/hotel. Knew the owner, who plays live music at the restaurant every Friday. Dorms run $12 pp. huge, clean, wifi, lots of common areas with full kitchen and pool. Secure off street parking, huge lot but a tight driveway - big rigs possible. Restaurant has the most bomb ceviche in town, and the first pizza we've had all trip (which did not disappoint at all). Plus, they have a great view of the ocean.

name: Police Checkpoint
description: They were stopping north bound traffic and it was very backed up. South bound there was no traffic and we were not stopped.

name: Finca La Nacha
description: $5 usd per person to camp in a gorgeous finca near the River La Muerte. There's restrooms, electricity, and showers next to the palapa. Ther river is super nice and clean and you can swim in it. You can also buy fresh cheese and cream from the owners. One of the best places we've camped at in a while. We'll definitely be back. Ask for the owners Vainica (Victor) or Cesar. — DIRECTIONS: Drive 1mi  km after tue small bridge up the gravel road until you see a gate to your right without a name but the entrance/gate has two carved tree trunks with green figures and a roof with orange tiles. Drive down the gravel road  for 50m or so and then turn right (difficult to see) down to the camping area. It's muddy in the rainy season and 4x4 is recommended especially to make it out up the hill.

name: Restaurante Turin - Camping & Jardines
description:
GORGEOUS flat, grassy camping areas nested in the mountains. Short walks to the river. Clean restrooms and showers at the restaurant. You can fish your our Tilapia and there's typical food and home grown coffee. $10 per person. Hot showers are an additional $3 hot showers per person. Super friendly staff.

+506 83197994  WhatsApp Business / Stefy
+506 8631 3065 Kristhel
+506 8866 6787 Jennifer 
turincostarica@gmail.com

Redes sociales:  Facebook 
https://www.facebook.com/restauranteturincr/ 
Instagram: https://instagram.com/turincostarica 
Google Maps: https://maps.google.com/?cid=4534700202205826728&entry=gps 
Reservations via WhatsApp:
https://wa.me/message/3VUWNUHJJA5VL1

name: Playa Junquillal spot surf
description:
Nice corner, very very quiet, in the shade, the surf spot is 200 m on the right. Swimming accessible to children, huge beach of fine gray sand. In the evening we witnessed a baby green turtle dropping to 200 m left. In the morning, dozens of peckers play with the waves. Wifi possible by moving away a little. Pin: lifeisgood 

Coin sympa, très très calme, a l'ombre, le spot de surf est à 200 m a droite. Baignade accessible aux enfants, immense plage de sable gris fin. Le soir nous avons assisté à un lâché de bébé tortues vertes à 200 m à gauche. Les matin, les péliquants par dizaines jouent avec les vagues. Wifi possible en s'éloignant un peu. Pin : lifeisgood

name: Playa Zapotal
description: Technically a public beach but I'll call it private based on our experience. (You need 4x4!!) With the exception of a few cars that drove in around 10am to take a picture and then left essentially 30 seconds later, we've been totally alone since we got here yesterday around 4pm. Unfortunately, you can't drive all the way up onto the beach and it kind of smells like dead animal near where you leave your car because of some crab carcasses that are around. But we loved it here. We pitched our ground tent a bit closer to the water than where we left our car and felt totally safe. No surfing because it's in a cove and the water is too calm, but it made for some amazing swimming in super clear water (not cold at all!) No facilities.

name: Playa Mina / playa Zapotillal
description: Free wild camping in gorgeous Playa Minas; a tucked in gem of a beach. Not many people during the day and we had it all to ourselves at night except for the howler monkeys, raccoons, turtles and hundreds of hermit crabs. Please keep it low profile and remember that most likely you'd be alone at night. Some nearby beaches have reported robberies. It's close to Playa Conchal and Tamarindo. 4x4 recommended for a short stretch of loose sand.

name: Hotel Los Angeles
description: Very very basic hotel but about the only one that is affordable in the city. We were waiting to onload the container with our car so location close to aduana office was a plus. All accomodation in town is very expensive (starting from 70 dollar for a double) so this is an ok alternative. We paid 12.000 for a double with private bathroom. Clean but very old.

name: TCBY Treats
description: Ok snack restaurant that also have breakfast formulas. Airco and wifi so ok place to hang out waiting for our car to arrive in the port.

name: Hotel Miami
description: Rooms without airco are a good deal, we paid 15.600. Rooms with airco are really expensive. No breakfast but there is a private parking. Clean hotel but unfortunately staff is very unfriendly. Otherwise probably your best choice in town!

name: Posada Rio Celeste
description: Really lovely place only a few minutes from the entrance to Volcan Tenorio where the famous Rio Celeste lives. $5 per person with bathrooms, shower, wifi, and probably electricity if you need it. The tent camping area is ~50 ft from the parking area but it was fine for us. Super quiet at night and tons of wildlife!

name: Playa Barco Quebrado
description: Beautiful small secluded beach bay between playa Guiones and Samara. Camped next to private home. Aside from the fishermans's house there's nothing else around. Pretty, safe and free. The road is a little deteriorated with some rutted sections. No restrooms but we asked if we could use the one in the house and they say yes, no problem.

name: Boat To Tortuguero
description: Here you can take the boat to tortuguero. Parking available. Price is 35$ pp one way. Boat leaves at 10am each day, both ways and takes about 3 to 4 hours dependin on the wildlife you see.

name: Casa Mariposa
description: This is a hostel/hotel on the street to Chirripo. Its just before the street splits to the mountain. We just asked if we could stay there for the night and the friendly girl said that it would be no problem to stay in the parking lot. The parking lot is a few meters down the street and is grassy but even. Just camping there would be free. If you want to use their showers and toilets is 2$ per person. We did not stay there but it looked really nice and the people were super friendly.

name: ISEAMI
description:
Shaded grassy field next to a hostel. Big enough for several campers and many tents. Clean kitchen and eating pavilion with bunks for sleeping in a large mosquito netted tent. Lovely new bathrooms and showers. There is outdoor lighting that you can turn on and off around the kitchen pavilion and bathrooms. The owner and on site workers were incredibly friendly, knowledgeable and helpful about the space and area. 
We watched the beautiful sunset on the beach, which was about 1 kilometer walk from the camp through palms and hibiscus. The many green parrots sang and talked quite a bit, but we weren't bothered and could also hear the surf from the site. They have a large, friendly dog on site named Oso, who barked once at something and investigated it in the night, which made us feel even safer. 
About 2 kilometers from the air strip. 
Owner speaks only Spanish. Charged us 6 mil. for the night.

name: Gringo Pete's
description: Cheapest hostel in town. Nice, clean and confortable. Hot showers, kitchen, wifi, free cofee big living room. Double private room 16usd.

name: Aduana Limon
description: To get your temporary import permit. Open from 8am to 4pm. Importation process (in our case from colombia to costa rica in container by Seaboard): 1. Go to shipping company office and get liberated b/l. 2. Arrange (via an agent, we had samesa) a warehouse where your container should be brought to and make sure they have your keys to unload the vehicle(s). 3. Go to aduana to have an aduana agent sent to the warehouse to inspect your vehicle. 4. Pay the invoice of the warehouse once inspection is done (266$ in our case). Payment needs to be done at banco de costa rica next to the park. 5. Wait for TIP at aduana. 6. Take the TIP and the proof of payment to the warehouse and pick up your car. Attention this all seems quite simple but it took us 5 days because aduana does not work at the weekend! Good luck!

name: Kawasaki Motorcycle Dealer / service
description: Authorized Kawasaki dealer with a large parts department.

name: Casa de Lis
description: 14$ a night for a dorm bed. Secure parking for two SUVs, camping might be possible. nice kitchen, near everything in town. Host speaks perfect English and are very helpful. Towel provided for hot showers.

name: parque guadalupe
description:
Quiet place to spend the night, with firemen and security guard. Is a place where fairs are held, but q is very quiet at night. 

lugar tranquilo para pasar la noche, con los bomberos y guarda de seguridad.
es una plaza donde se hacen ferias, pero q resulta muy tranquila por la noche.

name: River Crossing
description: On the road to Samara you have to pass this river,  which is not possible at all at the moment

name: River Crossing - Rió Bongo
description:
The river can be crossed during most of the year with any vehicle. It is very easy to cross in the correct part of the river.  River can be scouted by foot as crocodiles are considered safe at this spot.  Swimming however is not advised.  

Local tour guide gives free advice or offers paid services: Erickson Diaz. 
 Phone: +506 87215448 
*Check the strong current.

When crossing from West to East, drive into water and continue directly across to the gravel bar on opposite side.  Exit onto gravel and perform multi-point turn while out of the water.  Re-enter river and drive up-current to the exit now on your right side.

name: La Gavilana Herbs & Art
description: This small bakery is just 100m uphill on the right hand site from the Essence Arenal. They sell sour dough bread made with tropical lettuce as well as ice cream and they make their own chili sauce as well. They also offer other baked goods which you can order the day before and pick up the next day after 4 pm. Very nice place to visit and get some good food!

name: kc hotel
description: Very good place in the city center with a large parking We slept here before boarding of our children

name: Frogs Heaven
description: A private garden with a lot of colorful  frogs like bluejeans-frog, glasfrog and redeyefrog and a lot of birds. The price of the 2 hour tour is 25 Usd per person. Night Tour possible and you can sleep in your rv in the parkinglot for free (NOTE ON COST see tuckstruck entry below in Apr 2018). For as the perfekt place to see frogs and take pictures. Www.frogsheaven.com

name: Marchand De Legumes
description:
Between Las Brisas and Flamingo a Vegetable Merchant by the road, behind the shop a small closed closed between two condominiums, the very helpful boss authorizes us to take water, calm, tranquil clean land and it is FREE It's FREE), the beach is 20 m 

Entre Las Brisas et Flamingo un Marchand de Légumes au bord de la route, derrière le magasin un petit pres clos entre deux copropriétés, le patron tres serviable nous autorise de prendre de l'eau, calme, tranquille terrain propre et c'est GRATUIT ( it's FREE ), la plage est a 20 m

name: Hôtel Oasis (NO CAMPING offered)
description:
No longer offering camping option

A beautiful hotel between road and see, 2 pools, WC shower sur wifi we Paid 3000 colónes for each possibilité électricité of you have a 20 m sire,good welcome just at 500 m from the ferry ferry is 14500 colónes for a camper and 1050 colónes for each passengers

name: Uvita
description: On the parking of restaurant RAPIPOLLO near the road the restaurant good and cheap toilets With Seat and paper very clean water good wifi lot

name: Casa Sanchez
description: 6 pm night a bac localisation of Adonis campground who is in Puerto Jimenez and not at 13 km we stop in front a house we stop and as' the owner Sanchez of we can stay over night , there is water restrooms and basic shower but friendly it' s free a walking of 15 mon to the beach Where are turtle nest it sur free, we don't go more because the road is very bad for my camper

name: Beach Soley Guanacaste
description:
An incredible beach with 24-hour security due to a small police station. Water is drinkable as it is purified in the entire region, there are always people, easy access for any type of vehicle, the sand is firm. Police let us use the toilets and showers. No tents allowed, but that might depend on how busy it is, so just ask to be sure. Lots of friendly and well-fed dogs (the police take care of them, how adorable.) Small restaurant on the beach next to the police station.
---
Una playa increíble con seguridad las 24 horas debido a una pequeña estación de policía. El agua es potable ya que se purifica en toda la región, siempre hay personas, de fácil acceso para cualquier tipo de vehículo, la arena es firme. La policía nos permite usar los baños y duchas. No se permiten tiendas de campaña, pero eso podría depender de lo ocupado que esté, así que solo pregunte para asegurarse. Muchos perros amables y bien alimentados (la policía los cuida, qué adorable). Pequeño restaurante en la playa junto a la comisaría.

name: Camping Don Trino
description: Very nice place at the beach with a lot of space. Everyone has a table with a roof, light and electricity. A little expensive .4000 colones pp. You have to pay in the house at the end of the camping area. Be aware of low-hanging wires in many areas. Box trucks make deliveries but a big rig would be a tight fit.

name: Dr. Gas
description: Place to Replace american propane bottles! Bottles seams to be pretty new,good condition! 5000 colones per 20Liter/15LBS/6.8kg tank

name: Puerto Humo
description: Johny offers nice boattours on river tempisque. Good for wildlife spotting. Many different monkeys, birds and crocodiles can bee seen. He will let you camp for free on his property. With a biger rig you can park on the street in front of his house. It seems to be pretty save here and it was quiet at night. Nice place to be. For infos call Johnny: 88327991 only spanish spoken.

name: Finca Los Maestros
description: Beautiful finca tucked up in the mountains near Parque Nacional Tapanti. We were not able to camp inside the national park but this place is literally 2 minutes down the road. $10 per car per night. Super tranquil and there's no one else here! Bathrooms with shower but not sure about electricity or wifi. Restaurant, as well.

name: Cabanas Prusia
description: Super nice quiet place in Volcan Irazu National Park, Prusia Sector. 6000 Colones per person. Cold at night hiking trails, water, and kitchen area, restrooms inside a cabin. Electricity near camping area. Low entrance, so not for high campers

name: Casa Monge Lodge
description:
*Ask for Anthony on the pink house just before quetzal view sign (park just after the bridge and walk up the hill to the left and his house is on the right)*

Beautiful spot on the river!! (Way nicer and cheaper than Suenos del Bosque). 12$ for 2 people in a camper. There are 3 really nice spots to park your car: the first is on the flat grassy area as you're heading down toward the river and the other two are actually on the river. Super quiet and relaxing place. Wear those layers because it's coldddddd. Also, Los Lagos Restaurante (across the street) is in the same family and they have wifi and huge portions of delicious food. 

- for a hot shower: open the valve just a little bit so you will use less water and the water gets the chance to get hot.

name: House of Don Gelbert
description: Front yard of a really sweet old man, Gelbert (sp?). We checked out Casa Mariposa and there was only space for 2 cars in a super tight parking lot so we ended up here. Such a great [flat] spot with a view of the valley below and plenty of space for at least 3 cars. 3,000c per car per night and we used the bathrooms at the restaurant across the way (buy a coffee so they continue to let overlanders use them!) 2 min walk to the trailhead to Chirripo and we left our cars here while we were gone (same price as camping). No gate but it's a very safe area with lots of light at night.

name: Fiesta casino
description: We needed to get to the airport for 5am to drop family off so we asked at the casino if we could park. they said yes and said they have security, they said we could park in the carpark after 10pm or we could park next to the train tracks whenever. security around and felt safe. Dennys next door with free WiFi even though it's crazily overpriced! we also used the casino toilets..

name: Gas la Colonia
description: Gas station that also has Z gas for fixed tanks.

name: Gas Station
description: didn't camp here but it's the entrance road to monteverde.has toilets and showers available and plenty of trucks overnighting here. might be a good option for after or before monteverde.

name: Costa Rica Overland
description: Ricardo, the owner of Costa Rica Overland has a fabrication shop. So if you need any custom made racks other pieces that required professional welding this is the place to do it.

name: Beach Parking Lot
description: Spacious and safe parking area just steps away from the beach. 4,000c per night per car (he originally asked 5,000c but we said we didn't need the shower so he lowered it). There aren't bathrooms but you can pay 500c at the restaurant across the way to use theirs. Joey, the super nice security guard who collected our money, lives in the truck container and is also the vigilante at night.

name: Botella de Leche
description: GPS COORDINATE SLIGHTLY WRONG BUT DOWN THIS ROAD. we didnt camp here but visited a friend and the owner of the hostel said we could camp here out the front if we wanted. it is a really nice hostel with a pool and a huge kitchen and security overnight. definitely reccomend. we camped by the beach which was also amazing but no facilities . unsure of price though.

name: Adventure Park
description: Great place to camp and get out of the city. A lot cooler up here in the mountains. They have fun mountain bike trails, zip line and many other outdoor activities. The family owns a forestry and a saw mill. Very nice, clean bathrooms, and hangout out area for a rainy day. Playground for kids. Kitchen sink and drinkable water. Nice owners that speak perfect Spanish, German and English. Steep and narrow road to get to, but everything is paved and shouldn't be a problem for anyone.

name: Servicentro Barrantes
description:
It is a gas station, but very safe all the time there is movement, lend you the toilets and to us until light they gave us there is a soda and the password of the wifi is  [passwords are not allowed unless explicitly permitted by the owner]


Es una gasolinera, pero muy segura todo el tiempo hay movimiento, te prestan los sanitarios y a nosotros hasta luz nos obsequiaron hay una soda

name: Destinos La Lucha
description: This is an adventure park with mountain bike trails, paintball, motocross and other activities. During the week it's pretty empty and free. There is running water and multiple campsites. There are little outhouses or showers, but were locked. Probably open on weekend when more people come here to ride.

name: Mecánico Cristian
description: Excelente mecánico, buen precio y la atención excelente!!! Mil veces recomendable

name: Scenic Route
description: This road goes from the coast to Santa Cruz. You drive on saddles along mountain tops with views of mountain valleys and the ocean. It is amazing.    The road is rough. There are some steep uphills when it is rainy like it was when I passed this road it can be quite an effort to make the road.  The road is narrow and not for large vehicles    I only saw men On horses and some motorcycles   The road takes some time. But is very cool.  I talked to one guy that rents his house out. So maybe you can find a place.  There is no services on this road. You are alone  the road number is 904

name: Casa Angela Hostal
description: Super clean and organize hostel just for 7 people, close to the beach excellent to learn how to surf and just steps to from mountain for exercise walkings, ocean views, maybe monkeys. casa Angela offeriert private and share lodging, professional surf lessons, homemade food if you require, tours and bike and surfboards rentals. WhatsApp 506 87290304 Skype: Angela Aguilar email: anje1a@hotmail.com

name: Parking slot
description:
Right at the water front. During the day there is a lady asking for money for parking, but officially it's free. Quiet at night, cool breeze and shade.
We haven't paid.

name: Tiquicia lodge Vara Blanca
description: Very cute place to stay, very close to the volcano Poas. Very warm welcome. Beautiful garden and half an hour birdwalk. 40 dollars standard room and 60 the upper class (which does't worth the difference of price). 15 dollars more for a third person. There is also a nice grassy field where you could stay in your vehicle but no idea if they allow it or if you could get any accommodation.

name: Cabinas Sol y Arena
description: Really nice little hotel with 3 or 4 rooms and secure gated parking lot, private bathroom, ac, tv, wifi for 15,000 colones (27usd) for both of us. The lady owner, Emidia, so sweet and great energy! Made us feel immediately welcome by giving us a discount 12,000 colones for the night and made us smile with her good vibes. Totally recommended! Walking distance from Maxi Pali supermarket and a Chinese restaurant. One block from the  highway but can't feel any noise from this place.

name: Parking slot
description: Slots next to the church which fits trucks up to 7.5 meters length. Had no problems and good for a night. Very quiet after 11pm.

name: Aros y llantas mundiales
description: All kind of tires. New and cheap with friendly staff.

name: Restaurant EIMI
description:
Nice grassy area to park near Guayabo national park. The owner Oswaldo is very nice and helpful, they also have a small restaurant. If he's not here call him 87388947 or just find a place and wait for him. 4.000 colones car/day. Good wi-fi
There's toilet/ showers. Washing machine you can combine price to use.

name: Las Fresas
description:
Hotel, cabanas and italian restaurant. The entrance is not very appealing (it just got a new owner and they are refreshing the place) but you can sleep in cute wooden rooms for 35 dollars (no extra fee if a third person). Very quiet, green and clean place. They run a restaurant as well but we didn't eat there. 
There is also a large flat and grassy field to sleep in your vehicle (didn't ask if possible but looks made for it). Should be tents friendly too.

name: Taller J.R. Automotriz
description: Great mechanic and reasonable prices. Fixed our oil leak very well! Super friendly people! Highly recommend this place! Phone +506 8513 2569. You will also find them on google maps.

name: Hotel Calocita
description: Nice hotel, 50 meters from the main road, 150 meters to the beach. Well equipped shared kitchen which allows you to prepare your own meals. Clean rooms, warm water. Good WiFi. We piaid USD 30/night (mid-seaon). Christian, the German owners, is a very nice and helpful guy.

name: Playa Panama and Playa Hermanos connecting road mirador
description: Wide spot in backroad overlooking Playa Panama at top of narrow but paved road. No problem with truck camper.

name: Cabinas Iguana
description: This hostel is owned by a Swiss. It offers bungalows (USD 50) and 3 bedrooms with shared bathrooms (USD 25). It has a beautiful garden, swimming pool, a fully equipped guest kitchen with free coffee in the morning. Everything very clean. The hostel is located 150 m from the beach and 10 walking minutes from the centre with plenty of bars and restaurants.

name: Beach south of Puerto Limón
description: Beach front which is easily accessible by any kind of vehicle. Turn left before you cross the bridge and the beach stretches back from the river mouth until Limón. You can also walk through the river and continue south the beach. On the other side of the bridge are lots of small parking spaces under the trees but nothing for our big truck. Sundays were locals swimming and fishing, Mondays we were alone. No facilities.

name: Petrol Station San Gerado
description:
24hr petrol station, Truck stop, tire Shop. FREE toilets & showers.
Just talk to the guy at the petrol station where it's best to park over night. FREE :)

name: Colorado salt flats
description: Parked next to Central Park and soccer fields.

name: Aduana for Vehicle Permit
description:
Aduana office to suspend and reinstate your vehicle permit for storage.

Suspend Permit - Provide paper stating your vehicle is in storage along with vehicle import permit.

Reinstate Permit - Provide suspended permit paper and make sure the "Movimiento #" is printed on your new vehicle permit.  Storage will not release vehicle without this number on the permit.

*Reinstated vehicle permit will be for the lesser of the remaining time of your original permit or for the length of vehicle insurance you purchased.

*Updated location and GPS coordinates are correct but did not adjust on map.  If this appears near Mal Pais it is incorrect.  Correct location is near San Jose airport.

name: Gas Station & ATM
description:
FREE! We stayed for free at the 24hr gas station incl toilets & shower. There also is a guard at night.
There is also a big parking area behind the gas station where the Nosara Coffee Factory is but there is no security guard at night.

name: The Bakery Cafe
description:
Nice bakery cafe with good food and monkeys all around!  We enjoyed breakfast. 
First restaurant closest to informal camp spot.

name: Ferry
description:
Ferry to Punta Arenas (1 hour).  Prices and schedule attached in pictures.  Paid 17,200 for our pickup truck w/camper + 810 for each adult.  Nice large ferry with a/c, bathrooms and snack bar.  Empanadas de Pollo w/chile sauce were solid. 
Update 6/2/23: 
$15973 CRC total for 2 people and Toyota pickup with RTT. Departure times for Paquera to Punta Arenas: 5:30AM, 9:00AM, 12:00 PM, 3:00 PM, 6:00 PM.

name: Road 935
description: we took this road to go from Bahia Salinas to Liberia as directed by maps.me and our GPS.  More than ten Creek crossing that were not so bad but at 600 metres from the end, we got stuck in clay mud and had to use our winch to get out.   Didn't continue to highway as road got much steeper and we didn't think we'd get up.  Turned around and went left here:  11.01539, 85.67316 where it says "to Liberia"!!!! and it's a paved road.  Neither of our systems showed this road.

name: PLAZA KAHUNA
description: FREE! We stayed overnight at the Parking of the Plaza Kahuna in front of the French Bakery. There is also tap water in front of the Dive Shop. FREE!

name: Hollyday inn
description:
Very welcoming, we found a parking lot for our 24-foot RV. The price is only 15% more than the hotel KC. There are many more services including swimming pool, counter clerks, excursion services, parking, ect ..


Très accueillant,  on a trouvé un stationnement pour notre VR de 24 pieds. Le prix n'est que 15% de plus que l'hôtel KC.
Il y a beaucoup plus de services dont la piscine, le nombre de commis au comptoir, les services d'excursion le stationnement,  ect..

name: Black sand beach wild camping
description:
Beautiful black sand beach. Stayed two nights without anyone bothering us (besides some mosquitos during sunset and sunrise). Many coconuts for refreshments. Good swim.

There are at least 10-15 beach accesses on this stretch of parallel road. Just try one and the beach is yours. No crowds. Might need 4x4 for some of those accesses (not on this one though). Just look around and you'll find a great spot to spend a night... Or two (it's easy to get lazy here ;)

We arrived just after hurricane Otto went through, sea was a bit rough, some trash and lots of firewood on the beach, no problems though.

More pics at www.dermessing.com or facebook.com/letsplayontop

name: Playa Cocles
description:
Many parking spots on beach side. Owner of "Reggae Chill" said it would be safe (there are two guards on either side of the restaurant). Police cars driving by frequently. We stayed two nights without any hassle. FREE.

Nice surf but pretty short breaks for beginners. Life guards until sunset. Lots of trees for shade or hammocks. Little fruit stand right next to us.

Maybe Wi-Fi from restaurant.

name: hotel villas Colibri
description: just forgot to mention that the GPS position been saved 100 m away of the hotel, on the main road. Hotel is located at the end of a small streeofat the next crossroad on the right hand (coming from Almacen El coco).

name: Centro turistico Nelly
description: Motor in style hotel with a fresh water pool! We payed $26 a for a room that had room for 4 people. Easy walk from centre of town and plenty of parking.

name: waterfalls
description: this is a beautiful spot for a swim. the water is clear and fresh and you are surrounded by jungle. the pool is actually quite deep so you can have a good swim. it is directly across the road from "bar la cascade". it makes a great pit stop. not sure about wild camping but there might be spots further up the track.

name: Hotel el Teca
description: great hotel. very clean, run by a very friendly family. it is possible to park a car at the back and they let us store our bicycles in a spare room. we paid $34 for a room with ac for two people.

name: Hotel Moctezuma
description: We paid $45 for a triple room with really good AC but hit water wasn't working.  Right in town.  Very nice receptionist. We stayed on building across the street from reception. decent internet. It was a Friday night so noisy from bar across the street till almost midnight.  we tried the pizza place kitty corner to us and it was reasonable and very good.

name: Parque Nacional Volcán Arenal
description: Park ranger allowed us to stay inside first parking area overnight.

name: Soda Ranchito Dona Maria
description: this soda serves tasty food with big portions at a good price. lunch specials are huge and go for 3000 col. the nachos and fresh juice are also delicious. the owner is really friendly. open for breakfast, lunch and dinner (7am to 8 pm) but I think it is closed on the weekend.

name: bike mechanic
description: place for bicycle repairs. the owner is really friendly, quick and cheap. we had three spokes replaced (on the drive side) and brought four pairs of brake pads for 7000 col. the place is down a lane way .

name: Delta Gas Station
description: It was beginning to get dark so we stopped for gas here and asked if we could spend the night. The manager at the oil change place here said of course.   His security guard let us park under cover inside the oil change bay!   Not fabulous but worked.  Restrooms at gas station, key attached to a bottle next to the closest pump.  Not all that quiet but felt safe. Possibly could get power as there are outlets in garage.

name: bike mechanic and bike shop
description: does bike repairs and sells a range of bike equipment. does repairs fast.

name: Parking lot beach
description: Parking lot in front of the beach.

name: Zarcero Gardens
description:
The catholic church to the east of the surreal topiary garden has a fenced and gated parking lot on north side. 
After a discussion with the caretaker, they allowed us to not only park there free of charge but stay in camper overnight. 
We donated c5000 to church as a thank you. 
Gate is locked from 5pm until 7am. 
Many restaurants within walking distance.

name: La Angostura, Finca Aliza y Werner
description: Swiss owner in a Finca with cabins, B&B, also a possibility to park a RV or Camper. Maximum 21 feet, possibility electricity and drinking water. Just ask what is possible before enter the street. Restaurant at the street.

name: camping in the woods near the beach
description: stayed under the trees at the road that leads to rooster restaurant. no-one cared that we had our camp with two cars here for the night and it felt safe.

name: Estacion de servicios Full Sardinal
description:
Tire shop behind the gas station. Good service.


Atelier de pneus derrière la station d'essence. Bon service.

name: Honda Dealer
description: great mechanics. best iv found on the entire trip.  Super helpful to travelers it seems.  they have all the proper tools and know how to use them and had a clean professional workshop. Some english spoken.  not to bad pricing either, 30usd an hour, not bad for Costa Rica i think

name: adventure park (gate)
description: We camped in front of the entrance of the adventure park, since it fite late and dark. The guard of the park said it's fine if we camped here. Pretty noisy road, but apart from that good spot for a night, felt safe.

name: ZEV
description:
Very good workshop, most of the people come here and the owner speaks English and is very fair with the prices, they also let us sleep in the workshop and lent wifi, bathroom, kitchen and electricity, highly recommended


Muy buen taller, la mayoría del pueblo viene aquí y el dueño habla inglés y es muy justo con los precios, además nos dejaron dormir en el taller y prestaron wifi, baño, cocina y electricidad, muy recomendable

name: Kahawa
description:
It is a magical place. The road is steep to get there. The waiters are very welcoming and we are left to sleep in their garden (with two rabbits). A splendid place to camp with wi-fi, clean toilets, restaurant and parking. Ask for the trail of the waterfall! 3km walk.


C'est un endroit magique. La route est raide pour y arriver. Les serveurs sont très accueillant et nous on laisser dormir dans leur jardin (avec deux lapins). Un endroit splendide pour camper avec wi-fi, toilettes propres, restaurant et parking. Demandez pour le sentier de la cascade! 3km de marche.

name: Eco Camping Papgayo and Pizzeria
description:
A small pizzeria a half minute walk from the beach with a large area for camping; tents or vehicles. There's decent washrooms with showers, though we didn't try the showers. The pizzeria has wifi measured at 1.5Mbps, and the staff were very kind, offering us bug spray. The price per night is USD$6/person. 

We stayed on New Years Eve and I think we were the only non-locals. At the beach too there seemed to only be locals with very few, if any non-Ticos. 

Although the campground is between two roads, it was fairly quiet. My girlfriend and I would stay again. In my opinion this is a far better option than the Congo campground in Playa Hermosa if you want cheaper and quieter.

name: Playa Bahia de Los Piratas
description: Pretty, small, swimmable beach. Free parking right on the beach with shaded areas from trees. Tent campers, car campers. Guy with tiki looking stand selling grilled food & sodas. Not nearly as busy as Playa Conchal or Flamingo. Roads were no sweat, dry & no potholes.

name: Kontiki
description: The best wood oven pizza on this part of the world! You need to try the sangria and epic "Peruvian chilly sauce". The owners of Kontiki are Peruvians who have beeing living hear since 1992 super chill and dream inspire family, for sure they know a lot of secret spots to explore around depending on your interest. They also have some cabinas for $10 pp

name: Puerto Los Pargos
description: At the end of the road there is an open space with ocean and port view .. haven't camp hear but coming every sunset for a week and the place is quiet and safe , the owners of Kontiki have camp hear for 6month when they first move into town

name: Picnic Spot on Beach Papaturro
description: arrived at this little spot at the end of a dirt track to find a clearing between some trees. Asked some locals spending the day on the beach whether it was okay and safe and they assured us it was. No amenities with but from the old fire coals could see where others had stayed. Few cars drive by during the day, everyone friendly and welcoming. Great quiet, free spot with view over the bay. Strong cell signal.

name: Kiteboarding Costa Rica
description:
Little dirt track to side of the kitesurf house leads to the public beach where there is a small, shaded flat area to camp. the road is steep and area small so not suitable for big rigs but 4x4 is not needed. 
Lovely quite night with breeze to keep it cool and the mosquitoes away. 
Kitesurfers come down to play in the morning as wind picks up early. 
No facilities but if you speak to Kent the owner of the kite house he may let you use the bathrooms and internet.

name: Kacha Hostel
description: We were trying to check out Beach Packers and drove past it.  Joey, the parking attendant at Kacha said we could park there and he gave us power.  Charged us 7000C per night for two people.  Beautiful beach.  Bars and restaurants nearby.  You can walk to Manuel Antonio NP.   Outdoor showers with curtains near the parking  and banos at the bar. There are a few wifi signals including a free one.  Okay Movistar reception.  TP and seats in bar banos.  We saw tents under the trees on the beach.

name: Playa Hermosa
description:
ADMIN NOTE: WARNING!!! Thefts and vandalism reported in this location. Please use caution. 

Wilderness camping with bicycle tents Face to the sea, under the trees, quiet corner! Attention to the picnic picnic nearby not bad day pass but very quiet night and wc for 500 colones at the tourist center at 100m south

Camping sauvage avec tente + vélos
Face à la mer, sous les arbres, coin tranquille!
attention à la marée
tables de picnic à proximité
pas mal de passage la journée mais très calme la nuit
douche et wc pour 500 colones au tourist center à 100m au sud

name: Terminales Unidas
description:
Long term storage place for vehicles.  we left our rig for 16 days.  despite being told $3 a day from friends, we ended up paying $80! 
Outdoor parking $30 for the first 7 days and $3 per day after.
----------------------------------

name: INS - Vehicle insurance renewal
description:
This is where you get new insurance for your vehicle before taking out of storage.  go up ramp to second floorIf you want to extend your insurance, this is the place to do it. Calle 1 and Avenida 9 in Alajuela. Open Monday to Friday 8am to 5pm around $40 for an additional 3 months of coverage. 
OR

name: camping and rock climbing
description: very nice and small campground and rustical cabins right at the rock climbing wall and at the river. access only with 4x4 due to very steep gravel road. you may have to get the keys for the gate from the owner Don Vidal, who lives a few meters down the main road. 3000 colones, beautiful place in the nature

name: Los Cusingos - Skutch Reserva
description:
The bird guide Ornithologist Dr. Skutch Refugio de Aves allows overnighting inside their facility. Our truck camper just fit sideways. $17 pp for the Park fee. Guides are only $10 pp. No sure about overnight fee. Will know tomorrow morning. 
Has bathrooms, wifi, sink, picnic tables down in garden area around his house. Wifi code: 19cusingos41.
Absolute quiet.

name: Caverna de Venado - Venado Caves
description: Free camping in the parking lot if you take the tour. Showers and clean restrooms and a pool. 10,000 Colones ($18usd) per person for the tour. Includes guide and gear. Park closes at 4:00pm. Manager Yorleny Cubero +506 8653 2686.

name: hotel Gran Impala
description:
Hotel in beautiful old building right on the road  Noisy in the morning porq many trucks park

hotel en la carretera. muy básico y viejo, pero fue lo primero q encontramos barato (nos lo dejaron por 20$). tiene varios WiFi con el nombre del hotel. ruidoso por la mañana porq aparcan muchos camiones

name: The Garden CR
description:
We found this oasis after going to several that either had no parking or were very expensive. Freshly opened. The owners and manager helped us with everything we needed. They have parking (maximum height 2.25cm) that communicates directly with the house. Very comfortable and clean facilities, equipped kitchen, good internet and very nice patio. Point of reference in San Jose without a doubt !! We slept in the car, but they have both shared rooms (about 13-15 $ per person) and private (not the price ...). Contact in one of the photos


Encontramos este oasis después de ir a varios que o bien no tenían estacionamiento o eran muy caros. Recién abierto. Los dueños y el gerente nos ayudaron con todo lo q necesitamos. Tienen estacionamiento (altura máxima 2,25cm) que se comunica directamente con la casa. instalaciones muy confortables y limpias, cocina equipada, buen Internet y patio muy agradable. Punto de referencia en San José sin duda!! Nosotros dormimos en él coche,  pero tienen tanto habitaciones compartidas (unos 13-15$ por persona) como privadas (no se el precio...). Contacto en una de las fotos

name: punta Uva
description:
Parking area with shower option if you talk to the guy who takes care of the cabins. Quiet but very windy when we were


zona de estacionamiento con opción de ducha si se habla con el tipo que cuida las cabañas. tranquilo pero con mucho viento cuando nosotros estuvimos

name: Kawasaki and KTM dealership - Red Motos
description:
Official dealership of Costa Rica for at least Kawasaki, but they also sell KTMs and Polaris. 

They have a HUGE amount of parts for the popular KLR650, and a clean workshop to get it diagnosed, serviced and fixed if needed. They even wash your bike for free while shopping parts.  
Did a great job servicing our KLRs - even though it's more expensive than the street mechanics in Central America, they do know the bike well enough to do proper work! Recommended.

Open from 8 to 5.

name: Firestone
description:
Courteous and efficient staff repaired slow leaking tire and did oil change. 
Staff speaks enough English. 
Waiting area is shady, has toilets, coffee, cold water and free WiFi

name: Canon camera repair and sales
description:
Our Canon DSLR smashed in the ground, and there is a huge lack of proper repair shops in Central America. These guys fixed all the error codes in just a day!! They also do service and sell camera equipment here. Worth checking out if you have a Canon and need a sensor cleaning or service. Great service.

E-mail: ventas@equi-foto.com

Find them on Facebook: Taller de Equipped Fotográficos

WARNING -DO NOT USE THIS PLACE see details at Tucks Truck entry April 2018.

TEL: 2244-5490

name: Camping Playa Bejuco
description:
You can sleep inside a farm or in front of the beach, in both places you have electricity. They charge 4.000 colones per person, and the telephone number is 506 8631-8596


Puedes dormir dentro del terreno o al frente de la playa, en los dos lugares tienes electricidad.
Cobran 4 mil colones por persona, y el numero de teléfono es +506 8631-8596

name: Free Camping Across from Hotel
description:
Not a bad place to stay along Playa Hermosa. There's room for one or two vehicles almost right across from the hotel, under the trees. The site feels better than some along the road which are pretty secluded given that this site is so close to the hotel and thus feels a bit more secure. Although it's close to the hotel it's not directly across from it and is therefore out of sight from hotel staff. We stayed on Sunday night and it was quite quiet. 

The hotel has a restaurant and has open wifi at the restaurant (but the signal didn't reach the vehicle. There's also bathrooms in the lobby but we didn't use them. 

Big rigs probably won't fit under the trees.

name: Taller Brandt (VW and more)
description: Very good antique VW Mecanic who also does newer cars. Very safe part of the city and very nice guy. Fixed our '72 Combi fast and professional, having a lot of parts available on site.

name: Hotel Posada del Sol
description:
24800 COL for a double with bathroom, parking (for small car) and breakfast. 
Coming from South America everything seems very expensive here in Costa Rica (Panama too). 
The same accomodation in Bolivia or Peru will charge twice less. 
Possibility of dormitory but we don't know the price. 
Good wifi.

name: Cabuya Bakery and coffee
description: Beautifull place. The best coffee in the Area. Breakfast, lunch, dinner and deserts.

name: Hotel Las Olas
description:
The cheapest hotel we found in Costa Rica coasts so far : 16000 COL (30USD) for a double with bathroom. Access by the main road with possibility to park in front of the hotel; rooms are disposed backyard in small houses (two floors) by steps overlooking the ocean. Terraces for ground floor rooms, balcony on first floor. 
Accomodation is basic but related with price; the hotel close to this one asked 100 USD for a double...

name: Riverbed in the dry season
description: If you drive southbound, you will cross the Bridge. There you will see, how much water is in the river. We were here in February and there was a "road" along the riverbed. Drove some hundred meters along and stayed for the night. Felt safe and had a good night here. Only some very kind locals here.

name: Citgo gas station
description: We bought engine oil at the shop of the gas station and they offered to do the oil change for free. The mechanic was very friendly and did some other small maintenance (lubrication of axles etc), all for free.

name: Montezuma
description: Beach front parking under potbellied trees. Straight on sand. Quiet and safe. Just past casitas apartments. Walking distance to town. On track to ylang resort. An informal tented campsite precedes this spot if you want to pitch a tent.

name: Ferry from Puntarenas to Paquera
description:
Here is the terminal to have a ferry to peninsula. 
Departures : 
a. m. : 05:00 09:00 11:00 
p. m. : 02:00 05:00 08:30 
Price : 15000 COL for a car (Defender) + 2 passengers (900 COL per passenger). 2400 COL for a bicycle.

name: Locos cocos
description: Friendly beach bar. Buy a beer, chat to Henna the owner. Water available.

name: Corozalito
description: Shop and water tap. Garbage bins. Little town.

name: Camping Fernando Morales
description: Large, clean and quiet campground on the beach between Montezuma and Cabuya. Water with sinks, electricity, tables at each site, showers, toilet. 5000 col/person/night. Nice owner Yolanda. The owner has 2 dogs but not sure how they behave with other dogs. You can take the local bus outside the gate to go to Montezuma (700 col/person), about 3 miles away.

name: Whale  Viewpoint
description:
This is at about 600m and gives you a decent view of the tail from above. Road does require 4x4 as it's super steep and there are actually signs saying that.  Follow the signs to Kura Design Villa; you can park at the fork and walk up the last steep section that has a lot of loose rock. Once up there go to the left and walk a few steps down the dirt. 

Or at fork in road, keep driving up road to the right. On the left you will see ”welcome del congos” sign there is a pull off directly across from that on right side. Easy parking & fantastic view.

name: Oasis Hostel & Camping
description:
Small beach front hostel with shared and private rooms, camp spots, full kitchen, hot showers and clean toilets. This is the best option for camping in Puerto Viejo area and our favorite camp spot in Costa Rica. We ended up camped here for 2 weeks. Two minute walk to Salsa Brava and 10 mins to Playa Cocles along a gorgeous trail. Mellow vibe. Dog friendly. Completely gated / secure from 10 pm- 7am. Wifi. Hammocks. Quiet but in the thick of town. Really an Oasis ;) 

Just behind Orange Green Cabinas, green building.

name: Waterfall Cascada Verde
description: Short hike to falls which you can, if you dare, slide down the falls or jump off the rocks.  There are two pools of refreshing water to swim in.  Cost 2000C pp.  Nice spot.  There is a small restaurant where you pay.

name: Los Campesinos
description: A beautiful but small park in the middle of the jungle. 4x4 needed to get here and camping allowed but the cabins are also beautiful. There is a very steep and long suspension bridge, a waterfall and two natural swimming pools all hidden in the forest. Worth to visit for an afternoon or unique night. Wifi available, price entrance for the park is 16US, camping we don't know because our old VW van could not make it up so we asked the reception for transportation.

name: Rio Celeste Access to swim
description: Park at the bridge and you can walk down to swim in the blue cool waters. Why pay $12 plus parking to walk with the masses to see the waterfall and lagoon where you can't even swim when you can get into the water here! Possible roadside wild camping too if you don't mind being on roadside space.
