Cost $4 for parking and all amenities, you can camp in the parking or at the mountain but too windy at the top, not lot space to the tend there. --- Parqueo con ducha fría, sanitarios y agua disponible. Está en la entrada de Cerro Pelado, es un lugar de caminata con intencidad media/alta con una vista increíble. Cuesta 2000 colones el parqueo con todas las facilidades incluidas. Se puede acampar en el parqueo o en el cerro pero hay mucho viento arriba y pocos puntos para armar la tienda de acampar.

name: The Family Hostel
description:
After a long bike ride up from Nicoya I found  a new hostel family run.Got decent dorm for $5.I booked through booking.com.Friendly place,a couple of minutes walk from the centre.Kitchen,hot showers,free wifi, etc.Most hostels are expensive in Costa Rica so it's nice to find a cheap one.
If you've just arrived,there is free wifi at the tourist info centre on the corner in town!

name: Cabinas Dormi Bene
description: Hotel with gated parking owned by an American. Small rooms with private showers. Shower had plenty of hot water and lots of pressure. Room was clean and bed was comfortable. Gated parking in a courtyard style parking lot. Large rigs would not fit, but it was great for our motorcycles. WiFi was fast and A/C works well. A room with one queen size bed cost us $19,000 Colons (about $33USD).

name: La Casona Mia
description: Restaurant up a hill.I arrive by bicycle thrashed and asked the guy if I could sleep/camp in the parking area.Kinda dake tenis court material so not mucky.I think it would'nt be a problem to park all night there.He said they have a guard too.No problem.You can eat,drink,use wifi,toilets till 10pm,opened in AM at 6am.Very friendly place.Nobody there.

name: Restaurant Nacascolo
description:
Nice restaurant on the road from the border to San Jose.
There is a menu or a “buffet” option where tou can select everything you want from a good selection of meats, veggies, omelette, rice, beans and pay according to what you choose.

For example : a large plate with 3 big pieces of chicken and veggies was 3800 colones. Not cheap but very tasty.

Free wifi

name: INS - Instituto Nacional de Seguros
description:
Here is the place to get the insurance for Costa Rica. First house after border, a Alamo advertisment stands in front, just ring the bell if nobody is there. Only possible to buy insurance for 3 months, it cost us 47$.
You have to get it before you go to the Aduana.

For the Aduana you need:
- Copy of passport and stamp
- Copy of car papers
- Copy of the insurance (red paper that you get here)

name: Parque Nacional Cahuita
description:
Here is the entrance to the National Park Cahuita where you can see a lot of different animal as sloths, monkeys, birds and many more.
These entrance is donation based, so you can pay as much as you want.
The entrance at the other side of the park (near Boca Chica) belongs to the gouverment and you have to pay 5$ pp.
The trail from one side of the park to the other is 10km long and takes about 4h.

name: Taller Libéria - Land Rover specialist - But not only
description: Great mechanics. We had an unforeseen event with our defender Land Rover in the middle of the road and Octavio promptly helped us. We stayed 2 nights in his mechanic garage, where he received us and we were able to sleep in the car, with shower, bathroom and security. He works with all car brands, and does impeccable work. super recommended! Octavio: +506 8335-9833 (whatsapp)

name: North Fields Coffee Tour (with cacao and sugar cane too)
description: A family run coffee tour operations. they have been growing coffee for 5 generations and started the tour side 4 years ago . A GREAT tour with a ton of information about the entire process from seedlings to coffee in your cup. You can touch and taste almost every step. Taste many different chocolate drinks and even make your own molded chocolate. And of course grind your own sugar cane too. They share how to sustainably grown and manintain crops. Very cool!

name: Casa de Quesos
description: Little house next to the street with a big parking area. They sell a lot of cheese and other products like yoghurts and honey!

name: Supermercado Junquillal
description: Little supermarket near the coast with good selection.

name: Cafe Corazon
description: Best coffee in town! Nice location directly at the beach and super friendly stuff!!! I highly recommend.

name: PN Cabo Blanco
description:
Entrance fee is 13,50$ pp, small parking lot right in front of park, maybe hard for big rigs. Recommend coming early in the morning to find a spot.

At the entrance are toilets and a tap with potable water. Don‘t know if they allow you to camp here, but would be a good spot.

There are 3 trails from 1km to 4km which takes about 4h both ways. At the end is a beach where it is allowed to take a bath. Park closes at 4pm. No pets allowed.

name: Arenal Volcano National Park
description: Entry fee is 15.00 USD p.p. Way too much for what you can do there. Bad informations, nearly no hiking possibilities.

name: Matapalo beach
description: From Panama up to here, for us the best beach so far!! Few people hundreds of meters of sandy beaches! The current can be a little string at times but not as much as to prevent you from swimming. Definitely worth the stop for a couple of days!!

name: Marina Pez Vela
description:
We got a great tip from a boat crew, who told us about this bathrooms with showers (hot water + soap). I don’t know how long this might still be accessible but since the marina is open to the public you can easily get here, I would just advise to be discreet so it stays open for other travelers! there's security snooping around that could get suspicious
When going down the stairs it’s on the far left

name: Hotel Quelitales restaurant & birding
description:
Great place for birding. 400 species of birds with 35 species of colibris. Opens at 8am.
Fee to the birding trails is 5$US or 3000Colones per person. 
If you pay for the trails you can camp for free on the parking next to the restaurant.
If you don't bird but eat at the restaurant, you can also camp for free.
The owner is the chef of the restaurant and very welcoming. We didn't eat at the restaurant but he is one of the best chef of Costa Rica. Heard the food was great.
Access via a narrow dirt road. No problem with our 7m/23feet long Iveco. Not sure for bigger rig.
Didn't ask for shower or toilets.
Average Wi-Fi

name: Bosque Del Tolomuco Hotel
description:
Cabine, campground, trails
This is a great place to watch birds and relax.
Trails are 5US$pp. There are many feeders.
If you prefer to camp and use the trails, it's 25US$ per vehicle. potable water, electricity, hot shower, swimming pool.
Two sites but one is only 4x4. Big rig, tent and pet friendly.
No restaurant but you can order breakfast for an extra fee.
Two cabinas available equiped with kitchen.
Rolf is German and Lise is French Canadian. so they speak French, German, English and Spanish.

name: Playa Avellanes Pasto
description: Camping in pasture on the corner. Large field with room to spread out. Simple open shower under a tree. $4 a day. Open Friday, Saturday, and Sunday. Safe and comfortable, good people

name: Finca Las Mercedes coffee farm
description:
3 Double Rooms (with shared bathroom) are available in historic plantation house on a beautiful family run coffee farm. 

- $35 per room (without breakfast)
- $45 per room (with breakfast)
(Prices based on two people sharing).

Breakfast options include, traditional tico breakfast, homemade granola with fruits, or pancakes. 

Opportunity to take a guided tour around the plantation and to a micro mill for $10pp. 

We also have a self serve coffee bar in the house where you can learn how to make coffee using different methods. Also for sale is single source coffee grown and processed on the plantation. 

Also lots of hiking available directly from the farm and in the general area. 

Evening meals also available on request - speak to the hosts to find out the options and prices each day. 

Fast WIFI available

Hosts are Spanish and English speakers. 
Please call for directions:
Sarah +506 6295 7573

name: Playa Iguanita
description: Wild camp in front of the beach. Safe place. Easy 4x4 access. Lots of threes to get a nice shadow to camp. Calm and clear water. No houses near. No facilities. Very crowded with beach campers.

name: Taller Martinez
description: ariel, the mechanic who used to work at ZEV with all the great reviews, doesn't work there anymore but has his workshop here now. he is a very nice guy, good experience. his number is +50687634171

name: Crossing Rio Prio
description:
On the way from Puerto Jimenez to Carate this was the longest and maybe deepest (30-40cm) river to cross (about 4-5 rivers to cross at the moment).
When you’re coming from Puerto Jimenez stay on the left of the river, as right is a deep hole. We walked it first. No problem without high clearence but 4x4 is recommended.

name: P.N. Corcovado - La Leona Station
description:
Here is the enrty to Corcovado La Leona Station. Walk 3.5km on the beach (or there is a trail in the jungle just behind the beach for much of it) from Carate Airfield to get here. There are toilets, outdoor showers and potable water to refill your bottels. Open from 8am to 4pm.

IMPORTANT: You must buy your tickets in advance by completing a multi step process of emailing reservaciones.pnc@sinac.go.cr and paying at the Banco Nacional in Puerto Jimenez. You can no longer buy tickets at the information center in Puerto Jimenez! If you show up to this ranger station without a confirmation you with be turned away. See detail in comment below.

name: Lavanderia
description:
Laundry owned by a nice lady. When it isn‘t open just ring the bell or call the phone number written on the door.
Price is CRC 1‘200/kg.
We brought our clothes in the morning and could pick them up the same day in the afternoon.

name: Feria Uvita
description:
Every saturday here is a market with fresh vegetables, fruits, handcrafts and many more stuff. If you're lucky the german butcher is there with his amazing meat and sausages!
Open 8am until 12am.

name: Petrogas
description:
Great plant, very nice 30pounds -> 13kg approx. 2 bottles for 16’650colones. 
The plant before had electricity issues and couldn’t deliver gas so they sent us here. You take care of the process from A to Z: go in, take the bottle, see how it’s filled, sign, pay and leave :-) they fill with GLP and there’s another plant just next to this one that I heard they fill propane...

8 to 17h Mon-Fri
8 to 13 Sat

name: Camping Paradise Point
description: Great camping option next to the ocean and close from downtown. Very quiet at night. They have clean showers and bathrooms. Eugenio the Argentinian owner nice guy!

name: Laundry Express
description: 2 hour express service, no self service. 2000 CRC per kilo. Open Mon - Sat 9.00am 1.00pm.

name: 'Makeout Point'
description: This was a great spot on a point overlooking the ocean. We showed up and there was no one around. Then the couples started showing up to make out at sunset. Absolutely beautiful.

name: water refill station
description: next to green Market. you can refill your 18L bottle for 2,200 at the machine. purified water

name: tap
description: Tap by the road, free. No idea if it's potable water but we drank it and were fine!

name: Family Farm
description: This is going to be the replacement for the old Hostel California. It looks like a family farm. Go in and ask for an English lady named Rosie. They let us stay in our camper next to the house for $10 US. The hostel was not up and running yet.

name: Finca Nano
description:
Finca Nano is a coffee plantage up in the hills of Orosi. Nano is a nice older guy who lives up there alone with his dogs and cats. He tells you stories about Costa Rica and the process of making coffee, takes you through his plantages to a nice waterfall and at the end shows you a different way to walk back to Orosi. It’s less about coffee more about good stories and even better company. He asks for CRC 3‘000 pp for his tour.

To get to Nano go to the gasstation in Orosi and follow the way to the right. After some hundert meters you have to cross a little river. Follow the way, when it gets steeper you almost there. Hold to the right and you should see a sign with ‚Welcome Nano‘. He should be around his house, if not follow the way uphill and look for Nano, maybe he is working somewhere on the Finca.

name: Parque Ecologico Volcan Arenal
description:
The campground lies about 450 m away from the coordinates but the coordinates are at the start from the road. It is very quiet but for a tent, it is hard to find an even patch. There is a 3-floor frame with some tents in it, maybe this is an option for a single tent. 

Basic facilities: toilets, cold showers and dishwashing area. 

Not sure in the place is reachable with a big rig, because the last few meters are very steep.

name: Queseria Hacienda Palmira
description: It‘s a cheese shop which produces his own cheese and yoghurts. The had cow cheese with different flavors like chili, almonds, pepper and so on. We could taste everything and some of the cheeses are really good. Yoghurts they only had with flavor and no natural one, maybe you have more luck.

name: hostal anita laundry service!!
description:
we wash youre clotes for a ship price!
in two hours is clean and dry!!!

name: Near Beach
description: Great spot on avellanas next to the beach. It has lots of shade under trees or lots of sun closer to the beach. We stayed here for 4 nights no problem. You can rent showers and toilets at the camping next door.

name: Camping Mirella
description: Little camp on the beach right off the road. Paid $14 US for first night then $12 after that. Nice swim able beach. Clean toilets and shower. Didn’t use electricity but saw some trailers plugged in with a long extension cord.

name: Le Bistrot Nosara
description: Run by a french family. No bagels. Recommended!

name: Total Car
description: Fixed our damaged bumper, AC and headlight within 4 hours! Friendly guys, big mechanic yard, several iguanas onsite too.

name: BSD Costa Rica - Swiss Mechanics
description:
Beat, Silvan and David are great mechanics and really lovely people. They did a awsome work on our Toyota Hiace and fixed the whole breaks and axle. They are really professional and the price they asked for was more than faire.
It is uphill right in front of the mirador Orosi when you are coming from Paraiso. You will see a blue container next to the house. Just drive up one of the two driveways. Big rigs be aware of cable hanging over the driveway (approx. 4m).

name: Quiet pullout on road to viewpoint
description: A little secluded parking spot on the rocky road to the free cloud forest hike. We weren’t able to drive any further with our Trooper without jumping into 4WD so we parked here - enough room for two cars to park. Blocked from wind by tall grasses, nice sunset view of the peninsula! Practically no one drives by as the road is steep. Quiet night, safe, convenient! About 30-40min walk to the summit.

name: ceiba  tree by Malte von Schlippenbach
description: very big tree and a very nice view over the Lake. 2000colones for watching. The old men, his name is Malte, is very friendly and helpful. You can spent a lot of time with him and watch the very big Tree. its amazing!!

name: Todo en Frenos
description: Mechanic specialized in brakes. Luis from Adventuri Ticos recommended us Ernesto, the owner of this place. Best place to go in Costa Rica if you have a problem with your brakes. It‘s right next to the Repuesto Gigante store.

name: Casita del Café
description: Great restaurant with good food and a stunning view over the mountains to the pacific ocean. For lunch they have fajitas with salad and meat.

name: Lubricentro JB
description:
Good place for a oil change. They have a lot of different oils directly from the barrel and brands like Castrol and Mobil. For 7 liters of 5W30 Castrol we paid around 60$.
Don‘t know how much filters cost as we brought our own.

name: Casa Mango
description: A very secure and private camping spot. Clean showers and bathrooms with good water pressure. There is a decent wifi signal, 220 power hookups, potable water, and a small sink. We're about 20 minutes from the ferry in Puntarenas. Parking space reserved for only one or two vehicles, so it's best to call in advance to reserve your spot. Josh or Mariela English/Spanish +506-6335-6186

name: Gas station before border crossing
description: Not sure if there will be another gas stop before arriving at the Panama border, but know there are not many on the Panama side. It’s a Texaco. They take credit cards.

name: Playa Matapalo 1
description:
***THERES ROBBERS AT THIS BEACH 

Nice and private camping spot suitable for big car with rooftop tent. Enough shade to keep the tent cool during day. Make sure to lock EVERYTHING in your car as robbers will even take your old and dirty clothes hanging outside.
Not so great for small kids running around because of tiny and mean biting ants.
Nice beach, swimming and surfing both possible. Fast changing tide.

name: Eddies Bioluminescence
description:
If you want to do the Bioluminescence, Eddie is your guy. He’s from here,  welcoming and very humble person. He explains how Bio luminescence works and takes you to te best places to see this phenomenon by kayak or boat. He let us camp in his property and use the atheism with an awesome shower for
Free. Totally recommend him.

name: Se Verde Lote
description: Really nice artist couple with a daughter that rents out rooms in their house. You can camp in front of their house for $6 pn. I think the rooms are only $10 pn. They offer you their toilet, shower and kitchen. If you ask they have the wifi password of the neigbours that just about reaches out to the campspot. You're close to the road but its very quiet at night. Would recomend this place!

name: San Vicente Hideaway
description:
We talked to one of the owners, and they let us stay in a green area just in front of the hotel and charge us $6pp. 
We got late to the place so the hotel was already closed but you can get to the green area without problems since it right outside the hotel. Then we cooked some meat for dinner and camped in the roof top tent of my car. 
The next morning we packed everything, ate breakfast at the restaurant of the hotel, went to the restrooms and left to continue our trip.
They offer some really cool hiking trails as well.

name: Playa Pajaro
description: A small beach, where you can see the mainland and some small islands. Not too special but nice and calm. A local we met told us it should be safe and offered immediatly water,shower, wifi, whateverweneed to us. light switched on in the night.

name: Ocean front parking
description:
close to the beach, lots of palm trees, a restaurant and close to the highway
quite at night, safe

name: Free Parking Spot next to camp site
description: Great and free spot on public sandy street. There is a security guard from the house called Akoya working from 6pm-6am. There's also another guard from the campsite working all night. Felt safe.

name: Soda las Vueltas
description:
Incredible homemade foods. The Casados are super tasty and cost 2800 colones. We also had a fresh berry juice 🤤
They have tables outside with beautiful views. 
They also let us fill our garrafón with fresh potable water.

name: Hotel Tico Aleman
description:
Big and secure parking lot. 15,000 for a double room with aircon and private bath (shower was cold). Didn't ask about sleeping in the vehicle as we really needed aircon (!) but you possibly could as there's a toilet. 

Lots of macaws!

name: Pull out
description: Just a pull out off the side of the road, but great for a night. No one bothered us and it's nice and cool after the heat of the coast. In the cloud forest.

name: Junquillal Eco-resort
description:
This one of a kind hotel of 14th room divide in separated little casitas is own by a professional and gentle Canadian couple (Tibor and Elizabeth) with their 3 children . 
We pass 9 nights in the back yard with almost full hook-up (no dumping spot )at this point but they will work on that ! 
The beach is wonderful and almost desert 
25 min of Tamarindo and other surf beach 
The big pool was also perfect for some good time and the restaurant menu really attractive, tasty and affordable . 
Laundry service also available at a reasonable price.

name: camping el playon
description: very nice quiet place to camp near in the rio turrubares with grocery store near bar lots photos on Internet Camping el playon and its free if you camp on the river

name: Canaan church
description: Flat spot close to the church. Big rig friendly! Pets should be possible. Restaurant only 100m away.

name: Bus parking
description: It is a large parking reserved at bus, delivery, shuttle. we asked to local and they we have said that it was ok. there access with our 24 feet has not not been of all rest between the track of 7 km who is not not very good and the crossing of village crowded. Night very calm and safe, totally free. We there are remained one night.

name: Soda y Mirador Chinchona
description: nice cafe (soda) overlooking the catarata San Fernando and also home to hundreds of birds. they feed the birds in the back so it's great to come take photos. food is a bit pricey but it's one of the few spots on this windy mountain road.

name: Autopits
description:
We were passing by to service our rental 4x4 and had worries with breaks falling apart after a (mis)diagnosis from a mechanic in Monteverde.

Thankfully the team was amazingly serviable and one of them spoke perfect English. Situation was solved with absolute care and patience. 5 stars.

name: Santa Maria Volcano Lodge
description:
They offer food at the restaurant and cabines to sleep but the owners were OK to let us camp with our roof tent on the 4x4 on their area, close to their event room. Cold shower and toilets are available + wifi at the restaurant only.
The area is beautiful, well-maintained and peaceful. The owners were super nice and friendly, the food is also very good.
They also offer farm tour in a typical Costa Rican family. Good stop before doing the chocolate tour at La Finca Anita we were doing the next morning.
We paid 10$ for 2 people and 1 night.
Recommended!

name: EUSSE
description: decent shower, fantastic toilet.  Free. Staff super Nice and helpful.

name: Hotel Ceiba
description: Lovely hotel with good size rooms, some with terrace, and a large parking area - we had a ground floor room and parked our motorcycle right outside our door where we could keep an eye on it. Hot water with fantastic water pressure. TV with CNN (English) news. Restaurant which was closed on the Sunday we were there but opened for breakfast (extra charge). Small outdoor seating area. Everything very well maintained (western style) and was a welcome stay after crossing from Panama at Rio Sereno. Paid 26000 colones for a double room without breakfast. Quite a few eating places in town and a good supermarket 100m away.

name: Camping Outdoor Safary
description:
The experience of feeling camping in the African Savana a wall away from the giraffes can only be experienced with Outdoor Explorer CR and Ponderosa Adventure Park.

Would you like to camp?

$16 per person per camping night (camp tent not included) "Great wall" view point African Wildlife lookout included

$21 per person per camping night + camp tent included (Prior reservation) "Great wall" view point African Wildlife lookout included

name: near the soccer field
description: Big flat place at the entrance of El Castillo. No facilities but quiet and safe. The village seems calm and safe.

name: Cabinas Jerusalén
description: It is a clean and very friendly place to stay. I rode my motorcycle here and parked it right in front of my room. I paid 12000 for the night.

name: Angela y Neno
description:
Big yard with coconut trees and shade.  3500C camping for one person per night, shower and toilet included. If you only want a shower, the cost is 500C. Only toilet: 500 C. 

They let you sleep in a hammock if you don't have camping equipment.

name: Catarata Llanos de Cortez Parking Lot
description: Nice camping spot for camper vans. The road to get here is a bit rough. 5 minute hike to the waterfalls. Free, but must give small donation to the owner. Bathroom. Now shower. No wifi and no cel signal.

name: Toucan House
description: Small hotel with private rooms. All rooms have air conditioning and private bathrooms. Large common kitchen that has a few very basic supplies. Secure parking for rigs of any size. They have a free washer and dryer as a nice perk. Price is $45 USD during my stay

name: JSM gasolinera
description:
Big gas station, not very cozy nor quiet, but safe, practical, flat and free after the ferry arrival at 9:30pm. Had a good sleep.
check with the boss first!

name: Restaurant El Clon
description: Amazing value for money. One of the best lunches we’ve had. The lunch special for 3,500 colones (usd$6.13)  included a casado with delicious BBQ chicken, a sample of banana ceviche & chicken soup, plus a drink. This train station themed restaurant has a fabulous view of the valley from the back.

name: Potable water in front of Walmart
description: We asked the security guards if there was drinking water and they directed us to a tap between the blue shack and small cement building right as you enter the parking lot.

name: Rancho Antojito Criollo
description: Lovely restaurant next to the road. Perfect for a stop on your route. Prices are good, food is delicious.

name: Cabinas ojos azules
description: Hotel ojos azules 25.000 for 2 persons share kitchen. AC. Wifi TV. Prívate bathroom

name: Café Coral
description: Sweet little restaurant with a very friendly host. Prices are oké and food is excellent. Even for vegans it’s a perfect place.

name: La Andreia la Estrella
description: Very quick laundry service - like 4 hours! Asked for 2000  per kg - wash and dry

name: Omael Store
description: Small corner store with free bathroom inside

name: Turtle sanctuary & Surf Camp (June-Dec)
description:
This is a local volunteer that runs a turtle rescue conservation program here at Esterillos Beach. 
Very nice guy called Gorge, speaks English and Spanish. Please leave some donation for the turtles as Gorge does not get any support from the government. 

We stayed here at the beach overnight and helped to watch the baby turtles hatching and after hatching putting them in a secure box and letting them free in the ocean later. 
Gorge would be glad for any help during the night as he does this for 5 month every night.

Great place where you can camp at the beach - very safe and clean.

name: Finca Cristina - Great Coffee Tour on a local Farm
description:
Great Coffee Tour on an Organic Farm. 
Family owned business since 42 years.
Super nice Tour, learned everything about Coffee and how nature plays together. 
Tasting is included. 

There is a small shop where you can buy some local produce and of course - great coffee ;) 

Please call in advance: +50625746426

name: Playa La Palma
description: nice place to rest, no big waves on sea, nice to swim. some local people live behind this spot, far enough away to still have privacy. If I take a coconut from a tree they only take a smile. Restaurant 500m north.

name: Lavanderia in Neily
description: laundry service, I pay 4000 cojones (cheaper in cojones , normally 10  us dollars) for 3 t-shirts, 2 shorts, 1 vff shoes.

name: Riverside
description:
This is a small place next to a river with some flat areas and huge trees for shade. The river is nice for bathing. 
The place was recommended to us by the police and we felt quite safe, there was nobody around during the night. It is down the slope from the autopista so you definitely get some traffic noise, but there is also the wind in the trees and the stream to cover it a bit. A little bit of trash around, not too bad. No houses around.

The access road is a short dirt road which is very steep. I would recommend this place for bicycle travelers, motorcyclists and small overlander vehicles with 4wd.
Take the parallel road to the autopista to get to the dirt road.

Good Claro signal.

name: Aeropuerto Limon
description: Parking lot of airport, flat, quiet, has toilets inside. Were kicked out of Uno gas station and ended up here at 4am. Much better than gas station. Good for one night if you end up in Puerto Limon late. check with police first, or continue to Cahuita.

name: Opposite APM terminal
description: A huge level hard sand area opposite the new container port. A few locals about and there is a background hum from port operations which works 24/7 but it is not intrusive. Interesting to watch the ships coming and going. Take the new access road then turn right before the port entry. The new road ends and becomes a potholed track for about 200 metres then turn left onto the sand.

name: Arrecife restaurant
description: Wonderful place to stop to have a nice meal. Super clean kitchen, the owner has lots of travel information and is super helpful and friendly. Next door is santa Elena lodge .. we had wonderful ceviche..

name: Cevichería Boca Del Mar
description: great local seafood place, tucked in next to the Pollalandia. highly recommend!

name: Cabinas El Tropico
description: Not much to look at from the road but the lady that runs it is extremely nice and has 3 friendly dogs. We were allowed to camp for 5 dollars pp and could use the facilities in the cabinas. The cabinas themselves were great, we were kinda tempted to stay in one! They had WiFi but we didn’t need it at the time so didn’t ask to use, same with electricity point. I think they would let you if you asked.

name: Restaurants Chicarita
description: Facing the restaurant there is a flat soft piece of land, down the slope behind the bus stop. The restaurant owner said it was fine to camp, he was a very nice chap. We utilised the bathrooms/shower of the gas station opposite, see other overlander post. We didn’t have to pay but had a breakfast the next day.

name: Villa Celeste
description: A beautiful place in the middle of the jungle and a few meters away, with its own descent, from the spectacular Celeste River, with a very large camping area with bathroom and showers, and also cabins. They have a restaurant where they offer all meals. Martín is the owner, WhatsApp +506 8996 6026. www.villacelestecr.com prices: cabin per couple 23000 colones per day approx. 40 dollars. to camp 4000 colones per person (8 dollars approx.)

name: Chicharronera El Chaparral
description: Nice local restaurant that serves local food. We had chicharrones (fried pork) and it was delicious!! It came with yucca, plantain and chimichurri (dices tomatoes and onion).. very friendly people. A mother and son. The son speaks English! Wonderful stop with big windows overlooking flowers...

name: Wilson Hotel
description: Small hotel with big parking lot with room for big rigs if necessary. Also clean rooms for rent with a small pool. Very quiet area, safe and conveniently close to Liberia. Very friendly and accommodating owner. Wi-Fi available. I think we were the first to park with a rv so he said we could pay whatever we wanna do and so we gave him 5000 colonies. We didn’t use any facilities.

name: ABC Lodge Costa Rica
description:
ABC Lodge Costa Rica. 
Amil is a Dutch owner who has lived in Costa Rica for 11 years. He has air cabanas for rent but also has a large yard with plenty of shade and gated property that a few small rigs could camp on. Charges about $6-10/person per night for camping depending on if you need bathroom and electricity.  you can reach Amil +50685102541. He is on what's app as well. he can speak some Spanish and good English, German and Dutch.

name: Rio Chiquito bridge
description: Right by the river to the left side of the bridge as you drive west. Very quiet at night, no traffic. Many birds come to the river. Pretty flat area. Great for a quiet night!!

name: Taller Coco
description: Great paint and body repair shop. Very helpful and professional. Excellent attention to detail, amazing service and fair prices. The shop phone number is : 2233-0794

name: Belongs to JSM petrol station
description: Huge private parking lot. Arrived at the petrol station at night and asked for a place to sleep. They opened up the gates next door and let us in. Private and secure

name: Taller Chema - Auto mechanics
description: Chema is a very honest person who works on any vehicles. I happened to need a wheel bearing replaced, and ended up changing all 4 on the Defender. I had the spare parts and he charged 65k col for an entire day’s work.

name: Cabinas Ryanny
description:
This is a very simple “hospedage”, but super clean.
I wild camped in front of the soccer field for a week, and they stopped by with their child (Rihanny) to check the Jeep out, and offered me to use their shower and restroom. They asked for USD 1 a day... The bathroom was perfectly cleaned and dedicated to myself only during that week. Super nice people... They have simple rooms if needed and space for medium size rig.
Nice couple to help out building their dream restaurant and cabinas if anyone is intere$ted on a partnership.

name: Casa Playa Brown
description:
Very nice campground right at the beach.
Pablo is running the place and speaks good English. 
This is one of my favorite places in my 4 years of traveling the world.
We payed 6$ a night.
If you stay longer you can negotiate. 
Supermarket is around the corner.
You have to cross 3 gates to get to the place.

name: Grupo Internacional Jomar
description: Fabio is a great shipping agent with 30 years experience. We shipped our truck/camper from Limon to Tampa FL. It is not easy!! Many steps !! This guy holds your hand, answering EVERY question, even videos of the loading ! Really 100% correct, honest and helpful. Start to finish !!! Email:grupojomarinternacional@gmail.com and WhatsApp : +506 8712 9598 Fabio Madrigal

name: Playa Cedros
description: Driving down Carrt. Montezuma toward Cabuya, there are informal beach campsites all along the left side (not a very busy road). We found a pull off spot with a steeper entrance right on the beach's edge. Lots of rocks on the beach at low tide, and the tide came up quite a bit at night. Ground was filled with hundreds of hermit crabs at night, but they scattered eventually. Someone tried to pull into our site at night, but hit a tree branch and left. Besides people walking along the beach during the day, seemed pretty secluded.

name: Camino Quepos-Tarrazu
description: This is an amazing 4x4 road from Quepos to the cloud forest of Tarrazu. You definitely need to be a confident driver and have a capable vehicle (big rig not recommended). The drive is 3-4 hours, muddy and on the sides of the mountain (steep cliffs). We saw rainbow eucalyptus trees on the way (AMAZING). There are a few eco lodges, but none seemed open. We went during the dry season - this road would definitely be treacherous in heavy rain / wet weather.

name: Free, calm parking
description: Free parking in front of the supermarket HJ in Buenos Aires. Even though it is next to the road it is quite calm and quiet at night. There is a bus stop at the corner. Small garbage bins and some sort of covered place were you can sit outside in case of rain. The access is easy, the ground is gravel. Good for big rigs as well. Buenos Aires is not a tourist spot at all, but good when you are passing through. In the small town you find supermarkets, do-it-yourself store, farnacy etc.

name: Street Parking -
description: Parking on a paved road around the soccer field of San Gerardo next to the church. Small patches of grass next to it. The place is behind the bus stop. There are no services but the ground is even and clean, the place is quiet at night. In front there are several Pizza restaurant and a small grocery shop. Because of the altitude it cools down at night, very nice climate! The access road to San Gerardo is quite steep and curvy but paved. Don't try to get to the Chirripó National Park entrance by Campervan or RV! The road gets very bad, steep, narrow and curvy and has almost no possibilities to turn around. Call a taxi to take you to the NP or the even better Cloudbridge Reserve. This private reserve has well-marked trails through the forest to several nice waterfalls.

name: Siloe bed & breakfast
description: Small bed & breakfast with cabins. Nice pool and garden. Very quiet, beautiful view. Clean rooms with bathroom with hot shower. Breakfast included. Family owned . We paid 35,000 CRC for a night. Not sure if they would let campers park

name: Volcan Turrialba Lodge
description:
MODERATORE NOTE: Read check-in comments before committing

The hotel provides a nice grassy field (firm even after rain) where you can park your camper or put your tent with a beautiful view of the smoking Turrialba volcano. It is very quiet. You may or may not have access to the bathroom, depending on the owner's mood, even though the price includes access to the bathroom and shower.  

There is freshwater access and you can get rid of the garbage. No wifi. The access is through a wooden port with yellow letters "GANADERAE Volcan. Open it and follow the 600m unpaved road through the flowers to both sides. Vehicles with very low clearance could have difficulties since the road is a bit bumpy but going slowly you should be fine. There are three dogs, three donkeys, and 9 goats. The owner Tony speaks Spanish and some English. You can reach him via WhatsApp at +506 8383 6084. 

Please note that there are several ways to get to this place. If you don't have a small 4x4, don't take the road via La Pastora and Hacienda La Central! It is extremely steep, curvy, and narrow and there is an unpaved stretch where you absolutely need high clearance. Instead, take the 219 and then 417 to get up to the Turrialba volcano. The cost is 20USD per camper per night.

name: Pulperia muy simples
description: If you run out of food this is the only option. Really just the basics and meant for locals. It’s a house at the end of this road. Some canned food, rice, beans, pasta. They had no fruits when I stopped by. No beers either. Super basic for locals. Road is not for big rigs. Nice forest to get here.

name: Trogon's Birding Lodge
description:
This place feels like being in the middle of the jungle with monkeys playing in the high trees above you. The house has an outdoor platform ideal for bird watching. You can sit on a sofa and wait for the birds. You can camp in either a tent or your camper on front of the house. The ground is solid and shady. There is fresh water and you can have access to a cabin with shower and toilet. You can even have electricity. Space for maybe three campers. 

The owner does not live here so contact him in advance. José A Solis WhatsApp: +506 8891 8589 Email: josesolism21@yahoo.es 

He speaks Spanish and English and charges 10 USD per person. Expensive if you only look for a place to stay but okay if you are interested in taking pictures and watching the birds. There is a path leading to the river. It is very quiet at night, howler monkeys might wake you up early in the morning. I saw toucans, woodpecker, a sloth and monkeys. 

Access is from Ruta 4 south of Puerto Viejo de Sarapiquí and then about 3,5 km of bad gravel road but totally okay without 4x4.

name: GS gas
description: Parking bay for cars and some trucks.  It has bathrooms and a convenience store

name: Brisa de la Montana parking
description: Rustic parking bay close to the mountain breeze restaurant.  It has bathrooms, restaurant and WiFi

name: Cerró La Asunción
description: Best views are here! Cloud cover may vary. Short trial to the top of Cerro La Asunción and clean 360 views. Beautiful little hike and highly recommended!

name: Beto Solis Gas Station
description:
Asked the attendant if I could spend the night at the back, along with some other parked buses and he said yes. Covid times. Convenience store and the gas station closed at 9. WiFi at the store that reaches the parking.
Felt safe. A bit noisy but not bad.

name: Chirripó’s trailhead
description:
Asked at Mariposa Hostel and they said they were closed until November and suggested Don Gelbert next door, but according to comments here, he doesn’t offer toilet, so I decided to stay over here. There’s a street light nearby, so your rig is lit all night. Small somewhat level spot for 1 car. It fits a medium rig, but since this is a pullout for traffic, one small van or pickup still allows enough space if someone has to actually pullout.
Stayed 2 nights without any problem.

name: Hospedaje El Alto
description:
Lodging house, equipped with a living room, two bedrooms, kitchen, laundry area, ample parking.
Food service on request.
--
Casa de hospedaje
Casa equipada con sala de estar, dos dormitorios, cocina, área de lavado, amplio parqueo.
Servicio de alimentación por pedido.

name: Centro Comercial Guácimo
description: Local supermarket with ample parking, there are toilets and showers available at no cost.  It is recommended to speak with the security agents for the permit to stay.

name: Salón Comunal La Argentina
description: Adjacent to the communal room is the parking place, it has a large green area for camping.  The living room has a bathroom, kitchen, electricity.  The cell phone signal is low for Movistar and Claro, but good for Kolbi.  There is a large waterfall less than 15 kms.  Find Doris for the hall key.

name: Taller Berrocal
description: Needed to change some bushings (I had the spares) and looked for a mechanic with a hydraulic press to do the job. This dude had it and charged way less than I had been quoted before. He welds MIG also.

name: Don Orlando and “Lorito”.
description:
Don Orlando is a well know figure in the region. He and “Lorito”, as locals call his self made“ car”.
He became disabled 8 yrs ago and with the help of the community, who donated the wheelchair, he build a unique “Land Rover Defender style” vehicle for himself. His dream now is to put a small bicycle engine to it.
He came and talked to me while parked in front of the church, and after a good chat he invited me over to know his place.
He lives alone in a cozy rustic house, and can offer you shower, toilet and even a room if you need.
He doesn’t mean to charge, but since he doesn’t work, anything you donate will be greatly appreciated.
Worth the visit even if you are not a Defender fan. His number is 8995-0118, in case he’s not around.

Bellow a link to an article about him on local newspaper.

https://www.google.com.br/amp/s/www.lateja.cr/nacional/hombre-arma-carrito-con-silla-de-ruedas-bicicleta/ZW6KL2UXUJDO3FMCP77A25WPR4/story/%3foutputType=amp-type

name: Pacific South Freewilli
description: This is the Demos Place we DIN on This Iand! You Need a 4WD to arrive safely. Its an absolutely wonderful Place! Its a Must-do in Costa Rica Tour! The water is clear and Beautiful

name: Nature Camping 4WD
description: ADMIN NOTE: as per Maritime Law wild camping is prohibited in maritime zones, fines will be enforced. NO Camping allowed.

name: Quetzal spotting (January 2022)
description: We went up the hilly road today at 5:30 am from Rancho la Isla / Hospedaje Monge. You will find a lot of cars parked at the street and Tour guides with crowds of tourists. All they do is walking up and down the Street, whistling or using the Merlin app with the Quezales call to attract the birds. Just stick to the group. We saw 1 female and 2 male quezales but the crowd of people scared them away quickly. Around 7:30 am we returned to Hospedaje Monge and just where the track to the waterfall starts was a male quezal in the tree. We had a really nice view at it for a long time before it flew away. There are tour groups coming to Hospedaje Monge as well, so it’s easy to follow them and find the birds. It was nice to see the Quezales but I think a tour with 30-35$ p. P. is way to much. We are happy we saw the birds for free. Normally Hospedaje Monge / Rancho Las Islas charges $6 per person to see the quetzales and do the waterfall trail, but because we camped there it was free for us.

name: Playa Biesanz
description:
There’s a flat space for 2 small vans right in front of the public access to the beach. No services but there’s the possibility to pay for toilet and shower at a house by the beach. You’ll see signs when you walk down the trail to the beach. The entrance is just an opening in the fence, not easy to find if you don’t look for it. It’s an easy 5 min walk. Spent 6 nights as highways were blocked with protesters. and here is way safer than being exposed at the park’s entrance. No one bothered Some cars drive by until about 10 PM or so because of the resort at the end of the road.
Road is tight and dead end, so mind that if you have anything bigger than a Van.
At 6:30AM (Fri/Sat/Sun) people arrived and start charging 2k col for parking (even though is public road). No one asked me for money, and I didn’t feel like paying...
Nice beach but lots of rocks. Towards the center-right there’s space without rocks to be enjoyed.

name: Unidad Movil Delta Costa Rica
description: This is the end of the road in the north east corner of Costa Rica. This road is along the San Juan river which is the boarder between Nicaragua and Costa Rica. The river is large, swift and muddy. The area is mostly small farms along each side of the road. There is only a couple places to access the river along this road. There is no real place to pull off the road. I camped on an unused part of the road that is a ramp to a bridge that is no longer there. The road now bypasses the unused ramp. Not much traffic so no problem to stay the night. It was good to check out the area, river and forest but there is not much to see or do in the area. If you have limited time in Costa Rica, this probably should not be high on your list of places to see.

name: Beware! Not honest - Auto Tica
description:
I stoped here to replace a wheel seal that had been leaking for a while. I had the replacement in hands and showed the leaking one as well. The mechanic knew exactly the amount of work involved, as old Defenders are all around here, and are not different than the one I have. 
We agreed upon a price, and I came back next morning as scheduled. 
The mechanic then wanted more money, saying he had not realized that’s what he had to do.
I left and was lucky to find another shop 750m north, called Maesa.
At Maesa, Carlos took care of what I had to do and I even decided to do more work as he was honest and his prices also reasonable. Spent the night at his shop as we took 2 days to finish the job.

name: Maesa
description: Carlos took care of what I had to do and I even decided to do more work as he was honest and his prices also reasonable. Spent the night at his shop as we took 2 days to finish the job.

name: Good river to chill
description: Pretty nice stop to refresh... There’s an entrance by the bridge, towards the beach, with access to the river... Nice clean water.

name: Public access to the beach
description: I liked this option better than the other 2 around. Still visible from the road... but quiet.

name: Small cabin in rural area (I'm owner)
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: This place was added by the owner. It has not been overlander verified.

Cabin with shower and toilet, in a quiet area, without electricity. but, has a small solar panel for micro USB.  There are fruit trees, sometimes corn or cassava, available.  There is also a small creek and ponds nearby. 
Just ask me for the keys by WhatsApp at +506 88159663

name: Public access to Zapotal Beach
description:
I forgot to mark it at the beach, but this is the start of the track (4x4 required) to access Zapotal. Nice wild camping but I ended up not staying because there were some people fishing when I arrived, so I decided to move on.
The fisherman left their Suzuki Vitara about 200m before the beach, as the track gets rough after a small river.

name: Kolbi SIM-card provider
description:
In the same building as the post office, closer to Avenida 1. Watch out for the frog sign. Tell the guy at the door that you need a tourist SIM - card and you can skip the queue as the manager is taking care of your business.
1000 CRC for the card plus 5000 CRC for 2 GB data for internet, 3 GB for WhattsApp (no calls) and some 30 minites phonecall. Manager speaks english.

name: Food stalls in the central market
description: Lots of food stalls, mostly traditional Costa Rican kitchen. Mostly locals eat there as prices are lower than in the streets around. We had a delicious Casado with meet for CRC 3650. Don't miss the coffeshop where coffee is made the traditional way. BTW you can find close to everything in the market.

name: Gas Station
description:
Stopped here at 9 PM, next to some trucks, where I was pointed to, after asking if I could spend the night. Free.
There’s a shower on the outside toilet, that truckers use, so I’m sure it’s fine to use as well.
Mini Market.

name: Taller Industrial Chinchu - metal workshop
description: I came here to build an oven wind deflector. They are fully set up to build anything you may need made of metal. Good people and fair price.

name: Finca La Realeza
description: It is a very quiet, safe place with a very beautiful view of the town of Pejibaye, they also do bee tours where they teach how honey is produced..!

name: Marea Baja
description: Very popular, cheap and very good road restaurant!

name: Camarita - Safe place for one night
description:
4X4 required. Safe place for one night
At the end of the road, by the beach. Asked the neighbor up the hill and he was super helpful and said I’d be safe.
Beach is wild and a bit dirty from plastic and stuff the ocean brings, but good to rest.

name: Near Beach
description: A more secluded option. Not so pretty, but quiet. Spent one night here. Super quiet as no one drives here because the road is super bad. 4x4 may be required.

name: Mirador
description: This is a place people come to see the sunset. Spent one night. Felt safe.

name: Toucan Hostel
description: Good quality, clean hostel with dorms and private rooms, plus kitchen. 10 minute walk to the airport. 10 minute walk to Walmart. Convenient parking lot with 24h security and gates shut at night (not suitable for big rigs though). Very friendly and helpful owners and staff. Neighborhood not great, location is purely for convenience with the airport.

name: beach near dominical
description:
in my opinion better than dominical beach.
no one around 
not visible from the road
but noise from the road

name: Finca Los Vientos Santa Ana
description: It is a place with an incredible view of the entire valley, you can see from Cartago to Puntarenas on a good day;  It is also very close to San José!

name: La Trocha
description:
On the route between Isla Chica and La Trocha which is strictly 4x4 only, I stayed with a family along the route as it was getting dark. 

They were very welcoming with about 12 children and grand children running around. We played games and did magic tricks. 

I recommend to any adventurer to stay with a local family if they will have you.

name: La casa de el árbol
description: Great place to camp, a lot of clean bathrooms and cabins if you want. Big space and nice landlords

name: Paraiso de Manantiales
description: You can camp on the grass in front of a sheltered restaurant, in the middle of the woods. Very pretty and safe. There is a swimming pool we could use, showers and cook under the shelter. Owner charged us 5k col but probably negotiable. There are waterfalls you can hike to. The off-road is quite steep.

name: Los Cocos Cabinas
description: Rustic Cabins located on Playa Zancudo. Owner (Susan) is bi-lingual Spanish/English. Beautiful place to chill and hang your hammock. Owner also provides a lot of information to visitors on local activities/places to eat/shop for grocery etc.

name: Retos del Irazu
description:
This is a very cool camping, only 4x4 rigs can go up there, please note that NO low cars can enter the area since the road is not suitable for those.
Camping costs 25.000 and you get a little hut “Rancho” for up to 6 people (the price is for 6 people). You can call 8378 3556 for reservations

name: roadside yard
description: Spacious place next to a small river in a pineapple growing area.

name: Rustico Camping El Castillo
description: A place to camp with excellent views of the lake and the Arenal volcano.  The entrance road is gravel.  You have to walk a few meters from the parking lot to the camping area.  Accessible prices and they offer breakfast service for a very comfortable price.  There are many activities to do in the surroundings for fun.

name: Lakala Camp
description: It has parking place surrounded by forest, walking trails and view points to enjoy the ocean, electricity, drinkable water, toilets and showers, grill available, hammak’s common area and fire pit common area.

name: Arenal Oasis Eco Lodge & Wildlife Refuge
description:
This eco lodge has a private forest preserve with walking trails and really beautiful log cabins, they organize night walks in the property to see the most colorful frogs and other nocturnal creatures. There is a restaurant in the property and a bird photography deck for those bird watchers. 
 This place is owned by a local costarican family and they can let you camp on the property for a small fee or by purchasing some tours or meals.

name: Aroma coffee bar
description:
If you are looking for vegan food this is the place to be.
Yummy vegan burger for lunch or delicious vegan pancake‘s for breakfast!
Open from monday through saturday 8am to 6.30pm. Cozy atmosphere and chill vibes!

name: Ganadito Camping Bahía Drake
description:
Beautiful campsite at the beach. Basic toilets and showers provided. Some tables and shade structures are also available. Looks like they are building more facilities.
There is a kind of an informal beach bar where the caretakers live and locals hang out during the day. It was far enough and didn't bother us at all. 
We were charged $10 pp. (5000 col)

name: Cafetería Ara Macao
description: Really nice little cafe in the center of Paquera. They serve delicious cakes, coffee, tea, cold drinks in a relaxed atmosphere. Everything looks stylish and decorated with love. Enjoy your time in the beautiful garden!

name: Las Orquídeas
description: A great place to stop in route with friendly service and you have to try the chifrijo!  (A bowl with rice, beans, chunks of pork and the delicious pico de gallo on top). This is our second time coming here, and it didn’t disappoint! I highly recommend.

name: small spot : campfire/forest/river
description:
One spot under trees, close to a road (low level of attendance) and a river (possiblity to swim).
A few kilometers from here, possiblity to buy local products like fruits, cheese, etc.
For going on, cross a ford. 4x4 recommended.

name: Casa Soley
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager. 

We are located 2km from Puerto Soley, Papaturo, Copal, Jobo and Rajada, one of the prettiest beaches on the north pacific of Costa Rica. 

We have rooms and camp area available and a warm smile to welcome people from all over the world. 

We offer a very well equipied external kitchen, shower and common area. 

Come visit us!
+506 8347-8943

We are open! (March/2021)

Adress: (Casa Soley) Tempatal - La Cruz -Guanacaste

name: Close to river and town Uvita but quiet
description: Close to the river Rio Uvita, with natural swimming pool under somes trees and a road but few traffic. Close to the city Uvita, you can shop or go at the beach. Secure, some ticos in the day and for the sunset.

name: Riverside
description:
we slept in a tent on the banks of the rio, the place is very popular with locals during the day but in the evening there is no one.
Quiet, clean and very pretty place.

name: Rancho Cucho
description:
Nice place with little lakes, homemade and fast food, inexpensive place. Run by the owner and family. 
.....
Bonito lugar con laguitos, comida casera y rápida, Lugar económico. Atendido por el dueño y familia.

name: Mal País Surf Camp
description: Nice place with swimming pool, restaurant (closed due to Covid), plenty of shade, súper clean, walking distance from beach. English spoken. Doug and Rosie are the managers. 0050626400031.

name: MegaSuper
description: Grocery store in a small town with all yow need.

name: Cafe Avenida 4
description:
Beautiful little cafe. Really good pastry and delicious coffee products. Fast wifi as well.A lot of shade but you can sit inside as well. Prices are especially for Costa Rica quite good. Staff is very nice and english speaking.
Alternative milks like almond etc. available.

name: Pizzeria
description: Amazing little Pizzeria with a super super friendly owner

name: MiniSuper Verita
description: Small local grocery store. Wifi available.

name: Arenal 1968
description: Big parking lot behind the visitors center for tour buses to park. Views of the volcano if the clouds allow! It was $17 which included access to the trails for two days and parking for the night. The showers are minimal but they exist. There is good WiFi up at the observatory platform or at the visitor center. Also there is a small cafe at the viewing platform which is nice to grab a coffee and view the mountain before your hike.

name: Big Vehicle Alignment: Alineación Automotriz
description:
whatsapp: 89930459. phone: 89930457

It was difficult finding alignment for our Promaster van. This was the third place I visited and I called a few more. we needed the alignment done after having some suspension parts replaced.

name: La Muñequita Car Camping
description:
La Muñequita offers safe space for your car and camping essentials, including drinking water, access to common areas (shared bathroom/covered patio), and WiFi accessible close to the main lodge. 

Guests have access to wander the grounds of our farm and enjoy the nature, fruits, and ambiance. 

In addition, authentic familial meals are offered daily at an affordable price. 

Please note that cellular signal is limited on our farm.

Our location is accessible by main cities such as Uvita and is on the way to attractions in Sierpe, Drake Bay, and Puerto Jimnez. In addition, we are only minutes away from the most important archeological sites in Costa Rica: The Stone Spheres (Las esferas de piedra).

name: Arvide Moto Service
description: Motorcycles work shop, brands BMW, Ducati, Triumph KTM, Honda, Japanese brands.

name: Minisuper Pocora
description:
Local asian supermarket in the town.

Host: Leung Ching

name: The Night Poacher
description:
I don’t know whether I should share this special place or not. For me it is exactly what I have been looking for and have travelled Costa Rica in search of.  Raw wild riverside camping. It has everything; jungle behind you, howler monkeys and friends, river, waterfall, warm spring water, secluded, an abundance of different kinds of birds. 

Great swimming in the river but be respectful - she’s strong. Look out for the warm water rock pool I made for bathing in. 

To get here you’ll need to ford across one and sometimes two rivers making it exciting to get to. Occasional locals further upstream playing on the tree swing or paddling in the river. 

Flat ground but needs a 4x4. Other vehicles could park down river nearer to the weir but less secluded. The only place I stayed for two days. Not ready to leave but must continue my adventure. Enjoy ;) x

name: Arenal Cacao House
description:
Nice place outside La Fortuna crazyness. Has electricity, water, bathrooms, great forest in front and a lot of nice frogs and birds. Private access to a river too.
Best place of peace to camp in Fortuna.

name: Just in front of river Caño Negro
description: Spot in front of the river. Within the week, no people at all, only the river at night. Really peacefull.

name: French Bakery
description: Sells baguettes and some sweet European delicacies. Because bread goes limp easily in this high humidity, its not fully baked. Either you have an oven yourself or you asked the French owner to finaly bake it, right away. Don't expect light, fluffy baguettes.

name: Waterfalls La Piedra del Indio
description:
Restaurant and waterfall trail.

Alejandro is a certified guide that will take you in his truck to see a carved rock. Then you can walk the trail down, see four waterfalls and take a dip in fresh water. There is a group of monkeys around and birds.
Typical Costa Rican food at the restaurant and fruit smothies (and beer), also bathrooms and water.

name: Laundry Service El Almendro
description: Laundry service in town. Price is 2000 colones per kilo. Clothes ready in 4 hours.

name: Malekus Mountain Ecolodge
description: This countryside hotel is located in Upala, north side of Costa Rica. You can enjoy two small lakes. Miravalles Volcano view. This is a very quiet place, excellent for relaxation. There is a green forest where you can enjoy a 8km hike or you  can camp in the highest part of the mountain and wake up with a panoramic view of Nicaragua Lake

name: Hone Creek Park
description: Free WiFi, speed is ok, easy to register.

name: Servicentro Cerro Cortez
description: Gas station with vehicle propane filling service

name: Salón Comunal de Parismina
description: Place where travelers (including motorcycles to trucks) can stay overnight.  Community safety person pops up a few times.

name: Río Iroquois
description: Small pond of the Iroquois River, acceptable to spend the night in the place.  Local shops 200 m.  The water is not drinkable, but you can swim

name: Parque Nacional Cahuita, Ticket Office
description: We took a taxi from Cahuita (3'500Col) to this entrance (5US$ for foreigners). The first 2.5km are a raised wooden walkway over a flooded area. We saw howler and white face monkeys, a sloth, numerous hermit crabs and iguanas. After 5km, you have to cross a small creek (knee high) and an other at 7km (thigh high). After 9km (we needed 4 hours :o), you arrive in Cahuita again. Recommended.

name: Parque Nacional Manuel António
description:
Early on at the road to the park entrance, guys in luminous vests try to make you park your car and sell guided tours (group 40'000C/p, private 45'000C/p, incl parking/5000C and entrance fee/13'000C/p). Instead,
drive on to the car park 100m from the entrance, at the right. We took a guide (2 hours) and we could see more animals then without one. The beach at the end of the tour is nice. But in the end, for us, the experience was not worth the money.

name: Cahuita
description: Free wifi in the park. Easy to register, speed is okay. It is at the playground for kids.

name: Puerto Viejo Free Wifi
description: Free WiFi in Puerto Viejo. Easy to register, speed is OK.

name: Campground Piratas Place
description: Great small campground with power, water, wifi, bathrooms, indoor and outdoor showers and close to the beach! I stayed two weeks in my truck camper! It’s a 15 min walk to Tamarindo but a world away. Don’t sleep on Taco Star nearby! Laundry service at Hotel Manglar nearby and if you’re staying for a few days, you can call the gas guys in Villarreal to come pickup and refill your tank.

name: Bakery
description: Their pañuelos with dulce de leche are very yummy! We stopped here to get a treat and asked to get our bottles refilled - they were so kind! :)

name: cachi
description: this place is next to the road is very quiet and is close to tourist places

name: La Jama
description:
Very nice place with GREAT cold brew! We stopped here after biking from Liberia and this was such a great little break. It’s super well ventilated and they have WiFi and great food - with vegetarian options. They have a good variety of licuados and coffee and other fruit drinks. It’s very clean too, you can pay with credit card or cash

The chairs are very comfy :) stop by!

name: Playa conchal by bike
description:
We biked on the beach from playa brasilito (cars and motos are not allowed but walking/bikes are). The ride on the beach was gorgeous (we lowered our tire pressure to make it more pleasant - we have tubeless). 

From brasilito to conchal on bike is probably 10min on the beach.

name: Supermarket
description: Good grocery right in front of a big park with shade. Perfect stop to get some shade. We got some food at the store and ate breakfast in the many benches around the park.

name: Comedor
description: Small comedor under a big roof and with some hammocks. Food was good and affordable

name: Albergue ostional
description:
We are on bikes and this is exactly what we needed after a long day on the saddle + rain! 
We had heard a lot about the camping spot in this town but decided to look for a small hotel. 

We saw the sign for this place and knocked on the door -  big rooms (bunk beds) for 4-5 people (25,000) and they can also be rented for 2 people - she asked full priced and then we explained that we will use only one bed. 

We paid 20,000 ($32). The room was simple but very clean. It had AC, private bathroom with hot water and very very comfy beds. The mattresses are big and comfy!

name: Falafel Cafe
description: Good falafel and yummy natural drinks. Does not has WiFi. Very clean place and very friendly staff

name: Atardecer dorado restaurante/tienda
description:
This is a big local restaurant with lots of wooden chairs facing the beach. They have a lot of dishes with vegetables- for the vegetarians! And their vegetable Casado is fully vegan :) the service is a bit slow but the servings were generous. 

We are on bikes at the next door store (connected to the restaurant) if we could pitch our tent in the storefront once they close, they said yes. The store front had a little cover and protected us from the heavy rain that night.

You could ask to camp in the restaurant once they close (at 10pm). 

We had access to water (a spigot right next to the store front!) and bathrooms from the restaurant.

name: Parque Nacional Rincon de la Vieja
description: This is the entrance to Las Pailas of the National Park Rincon de la Vieja. Before you arrive here, you have to pay 700Colones/person to cross through a private hotel property. The entrance fee to the park is 17US$/person. We walked the Las Pailas Sendero (3km, 2h) and could see some geo-thermal activities. Depending on what you have seen in your life, its either a interesting walk or a nice stroll through nature.

name: Road to Las Pailas, PN Rincon de la Vieja
description: Take this road to drive to Curumbé and further on to the entrance Las Pailas of PN Rincón de las Viejas. Its all paved. Shortly after Curubandé, you will have to pay a crossing fee of 700C/person (privat hotel property) before reaching the park entrance.

name: Soda Curubandé
description: After having a delicious fish dinner in this restaurant (local & international food), the owner allowed us to spent the night in our motorhome at his parking lot at no cost (incl. access to toilets during the night if needed).

name: ATMs
description: Intersection with a few ATM machines. BAC, BCR and others.

name: Restaurant car park
description:
A large opening in front of the bay beach that is also used as the car park for the Kalaluna Bistro. Park here for one night, but beware that it’s busy with fishermen in the early hours of the morning (5AM) and late hours of the evening (10PM) coming in and out. Incredible view however and safer than next to the “police” station in our opinion.

Do not try driving here from the East via the road from town as you will get stuck (too narrow even for normal cars) don’t drive on the beach either, take the longer southern loop road from inland!

name: Biciclo - taller/bikeshop
description: Really good bike shop with lots of high end and also affordable stuff. We got our tubeless tires fixed in here. They have a great store and also really good bike mechanics. They also sell very affordable bikes and very pricy ones, food mix

name: Oban taller
description: Allan and his father are great mechanicals and they help a lot the Overlanders. The Best option in San Jose.

name: Rancho Edén & Chocolate Tour
description:
We arrived on Tuesday and the restaurant was closed. The owner Rolando came-up from his house, nonetheless, to greet us and offered the carpark with toilets for overnight (traffic noise during night).
The next morning, we had a delicious continental breakfast in the Rancho (3'500c/p; see foto) and did a very good chocolate tour (30$/p; schedule 8-9.30 & 13-14.30; phone 2200-5497) on their finca. Later on, we came back several times for drinks and food - all were delicious, highly recommended (see also our iov entry of Arenal Cacao House).

name: El Fogón de Chela
description:
Autentic Costarican food.
El Fogón de Chela offers a typical lunch and our authentic Costarican Cooking Class with organic products in a Rural community near to La Fortuna.

name: Soda Flor
description:
Nice soda with WiFi and nice meals. This is the place we sat at before we cross the border to do the panama health affidavit/download bank statements to show at the border. 

The hotel next door has private rooms for $10

name: River Crossing
description: River crossing next to road to Palo Verde. Beautiful spot next to the bridge on a little sandy beach. We asked the family living on the other side of the river if we could camp here. That was no problem and they assured us it’s safe. Many animals around: Mexican porcupine, iguanas, basilisk, howler monkeys, kingsfisher and a lot of other birds.  We also saw a scorpion coming from under the car. Locals liked it that we camped here. A lot of honking and waving from the bridge. The water is nice to bath and swim in, lots of tiny fish that give you a free Spa experience. The local family also came for a swim with kids and dogs, and came for a chat, very nice and friendly! We found this place because the campsite in Palo Verde doesn’t exist anymore. Lots of mosquitos from dusk.

name: Santa Rosa - playa naranjo
description: Campspot in between the ranger station and the beach, in the forest. There are picnic tables and BBQ’s. The toilets (latrines) smell very very bad... When you come with a car with rooftop tent you can’t camp at the campsite, but in the parking lot next to it. But that’s nice also. The road isn’t open all year, only in dry season. You need a 4x4, the road is very bumpy and a bit tricky. Lots of tame animals, like deer, iguanas, crocodiles (in mangrove), crabs, snakes, birds of prey. You have to pay entrance + camping $ 19,- per day. The ranger is very friendly. Strong currents at the beach, not good for snorkeling or swimming. There are surfers though.

name: Parqueo da Sabana
description: We arrived in the afternoon and parked/slept for 2 nights under the roof of this 24h guarded and fenced-in parqueo (22'000c incl. electricity). Some traffic noise, but ok for us. 1.3km from the city center, perfectly located to explore its tourist attractions.

name: Hotel Cabanas - Siete Colinas
description: Beautiful cabinas in private, secure (gated) green space backing onto wild rainforest. Parking inside gate, small swimming pool & table football. Trail into the forest, small ponds & landscaped seating in trees. WiFi (v slow) electricity, fridge & coffee machine in room. Lovely, clean rooms with ‘viewing window’ into canopy. Owner Jose on site, friendly, spoke mainly Spanish a little English, asked for $40 USD per cabin, with a little kind persuasion got down to $20 USD. Bobbly cobbly road to get here, seemed in the middle of nowhere, but stunning.

name: Hotel, Restaurante Mystica
description: After unsuccessfully checking other places to stay overnight, we found this place, had pizza & caprese salat in the restaurant and a quiet night in our 7m motorhome for free on their parking lot. Toilettes and wifi in the restaurant. There is a shower in the handicap bathroom, but we didn't try it.

name: Higuerón Rooftop Tent Camping
description:
Experience Monteverde from a new perspective at our rooftop tent campground. Nestled in the heart of nature, our camping offers breathtaking views and an unforgettable experience. Sleep under the stars in your rooftop tent and wake up to the sounds of the forest and birds. With access to our hiking trails and other activities, our campground is the perfect base for your Monteverde adventure.

Previous reservations are highly recommended.
Phone/WhatsApp: +506 83735808
Email: hello@higueroncr.com

name: Rescate Automotriz
description: Mechanic,family business. Josafat the ownerSuper friendly and super fair on his price. Rescued me a couple times here in San Jose he is an angel! Works with automatic american cars also. Fixes motorcycles cars buses trucks anytjing. Big space for bug rigs while fixing, under roof.

name: Williams Dental and Associates
description:
Recommended to me by Aussie globe trotters.
info@williamsdentalcostarica.com
+50222282914
Opposite MacDonalds, up the stairs to the first floor, parking available.
Dr Adrian Saenz Portocarrero. Fluent English speaking.
First class place. Professional, competent, full service dentist from check up through to major work.
Price guide: One filling, one old filling cleaned up, and a night guard to prevent grinding, 180usd

name: Passo del Mar
description:
Big rig friendly, stacks of room parked against the fence, opposite the theatre, overlooking the marina.
Safe... just past the police station.
No facilities. Easy stroll to town.

name: Glass specialist. Vidrios Villa Quesada
description:
Replaced a shattered tempered glass section with strengthened Perspex (acrylic) glass.
Could have ordered tempered glass cut to exact pattern from head office, ten days delay.
This is the biggest glass business in the region, many branches.
Head down the gravel track, around the corner, and if the shutters are down, call the number on the wall... the boss lives in the house at the back of the workshops.
I am very pleased with the work.

name: Farm
description: Front of the house there is 2 options. Gardens are big enough for camping I asked people and they gived me permision for camping. Also there is a small market near the houses

name: Football Field
description: I spent all day near the beach. After that I started cycling, the rain started and I found this place. There is a nice shelter, potable water, and a plug for charging my equipment. Between 22:00 - 05:45, no cars came by. It is a good camping place for one night.

name: Camping Catarata Tesoro Escondido
description: Tourist spot and main entrance for the Hidden Treasure Waterfall. Established campground, because of Covid you need to reserve online. They offer clean bathrooms, breakfast, lunch & access to waterfalls. Camping area is definitely not flat nor is the parking lot. Very muddy during rainy season. Entrance is open for big rigs. Pet friendly. A good option to visit a beautiful waterfall and crash for the night.

name: Workshop Taller Electric-Mechanico Automotriz
description:
Johnny Motoro is a local legend when it comes to vehicle electrical systems, air-conditioning, mechanical and suspension.
English speaking, smart clean workshop.

name: parque de lleno grande
description:
In the founded park you can camp, ask people no problem has water and a bathroom

En el fundó del parque se puede acampar, pregunte a la gente no hay problema tiene agua y un baño

name: Hacienda Blu Beach lounge and grill
description: Can is the owner of this place. He is very kind  person. His restaurant is amazing. also foods are perfect. If you have van you can park here for one or 2 night . he has a parking area with security.

name: Servicentro Uno
description: Fuel station with space to park overnight.  It has bathrooms.

name: Feria de Food Trucks Los Angeles
description: This is a great informal place to stay with your rigg downtown in Cartago just adjacent to the impressing Basilica de nuestra Senora de Los Angeles. It's a flat Parking area with an additional entrance gate around the corner for big trucks. We just asked the owner Jose where to park at the basilica and he said; come in to my place here, you are welcome to stay here. There are clean toilets, water and electricity, wifi you might pick up from one of the food trucks. We stayed here for two nights, due to the bad impact of the pandemic Jose is reorganizing the place, he and the colleagues are very very kind. A laundry you can find on Avenida Central  shortly before the corner with calle 7 on the left if you come from the parking, a 4 minutes walk. At about 10 pm all gates close, this place is very safe.

name: Riverside Lodge Sarapiqui
description:
River Side Lodge camp site located right next to Puerto Viejo River. Easy to find, there is every things you need.

5,000 pnpp

name: Taller de Scott
description:
Mechanical WorkShop. Repair all type of motors and brands.
The prices are standar and normal for Costa Rica. 
The quality is garantized.
This workShop fixed diferent issues of my camper, such as, brakes, transmision, gears. It Has a network which can repair other problems (electric, radiator, soldering).

name: Sol y luna camping
description: campground in playa herradura. showers and room for rigs/tent camping. run by Alicia and luis.very friendly. 10.000 CRC per vehicle or 5000 CRC pp. best found with Google maps and not with Waze

name: Beach front spot isla palo seco school
description: Cool beach front spot between palm trees, super flat great for parking or stay few days, just in front isla palo seco school , there are two blue giant tires .

name: Oasis Place
description:
IMPORTANT: Before you go, call/WhatsApp/text Albert (+1 973 517 0237) to check if they are currently in Costa Rica or the US. 
They speak Spanish, English and a little French. 

Albert and his wife Carmen have a beautiful finca here where they live when they are not in their other home in New Jersey.
They welcomed us warmly and invited us to stay in their generous driveway as long as we wanted, to use their restroom and shower and to wash and dry our laundry.  We also spent a lot of time together sitting around the table, talking and eating. 
For all of that they did not want anything in return but we at least managed to share some self-made bread and German sweets. 
Albert and Carmen are in the process of building a campground and cabañas on their property so this place promises to become a fully equipped overnight spot soon. In the meantime they already like to meet and accommodate other overlanders and collect ideas for this ongoing project. 
We highly recommend this place either for a quiet comfortable night or for a few days making awesome new friends.

name: Rincon Beach Campsite
description: The camping spot is right at the end of the street (on the right hand side). The street here is only doable with a 4x4 at least if you are not a local (these guys do crazy things with normal cars). The river you have to cross was at least knee deep (during rain season). Once you are here you get a paradise beach all for yourself with perfect sunset and camping on green gras right next to the beach.
