name: Alto del Rualdo
description:
A viewpoint of the central valley at 1800 meters high, suitable for overlanding, there is a ranch and bus for rent.
---
Un mirador del valle central a 1800 metros de altura, apto para overlanding, hay rancho y bus para alquilar.

name: gsm
description: Gas station we paid 358 per liter good for big ring to

name: Moligas
description:
Propane and gas station. Clean bathrooms 
360c per liter

name: Cabanas Tipicas
description:
Basic room. Clean with AC. Secure parking. Close to food. $16 AC/ground level -  $13/2nd level.
Perfect for bikes.

name: Mirador Lago Volcánico Río Cuarto
description: Perfect place to sleep if you want to explore the lake the day after. We spend one night with 25rv, nobody bothered us. howing monkeys!! The police passed by and didn’t say anything.

name: Lake Rio Cuarto
description: Peaceful volcanic lake, smal and beautiful, great for kayaking or padle board, there are bathrooms and cold shower, the price is 1000c pp and 1000c for parking, had no problem with our 25rv, the road is big rig friendly.

name: Lavandería El Roble
description: Nice owners. we paid  2000 per kilo. he did everything in the same day. WhatsApp 50661045637

name: Gas station volcano
description:
Gas station with nice people, the guy who works there told us that could stay overnight. Free bathrooms, there is a segurity guard for the night.
We didn’t stay because we were filling gas.

name: Cabinas Priscilla
description:
Cabinas in the sticks, not much around for services.
Good rooms with AC cable wifi got water and clean. Secure parking. Paid $24.

name: Finca el Mirador
description:
Translation: Ideal place viewpoint and sleeping area there is no water only rest area

lugar ideal mirador y zona de dormir no hay agua solo área de descanso

name: Jose Carlos Vanagon (syncro) mechanic
description:
We got in contact with Jose through a friend of him in Guatemala to do some maintenance on our VW vanagon Syncro. This guy truly knows what he is doing, there are very few mechanics in central america that know vanagons, let alone syncro's. he owns quite a few and does amazing precise work and engine swaps for his customers and himself.
We needed some custom work like a special pully for our waterpump which he had machined in his shop in San José.
Our suspension bushings on front lower control arms where worn which he imported and replaced and got the van perfectly alligned (better than back in the Netherlands to be honest). He has his adresses around san jose that he 'trained' to work with vanagons. (you could call him a project manager aswell since he's got connections all over)
If you need some work or maintenance on your vanagon, do it here. Don't expect it to be as super cheap as the Mexican mechanics, but the jobs you get done here stay good for a long time, see it as an investment
Before you go here make sure to send him a text since he's moving in between his shops. Also if you need parts, reach out to him as early as you can in case it needs to be ordered.
his number is:
+506 8311 3899 

He also has a place to stay in Orotina, about an hour away.

speaks Spanish and really good English, easy to communicate

name: Hans’ secret place
description: Nice place besides the road and river. The road is not proper to drive so not much people who pass you.

name: Auto Cori Iveco Service Repair, San José
description: We had the good luck to find this place for the inspection and service of our 4x4 Iveco Camper. Great team, perfect service. After the service was done, Señor Carlos invited us to stay the night on the premises - safe, with guard 24/7, under a roof and with electricity, Toilets and WiFi. So if you have an Iveco, this is THE place!

name: Super Baterias
description: Battery shop chain. These guys were helpful, thorough and the one buff guy spoke great English.

name: Massive Buffet - El Yugo
description: Buffet that had absolutely everything you could imagine, it’s massive and quite busy. Normal Costa Rica prices, not super cheap.

name: Tap - big El Restaurant Yugo
description: On the far right side of the front of the restaurant, the pole holding the sign has a tap on the bottom that would attach to a hose. This restaurant is huge and busy, doubt anyone would notice or care.

name: Brisas del Mar
description: Great restaurant serving fresh homemade pasta including ravioli and lasagna, North American style burgers with artisanal buns and homemade patties, a good selection of vegetarian options. Owned by Canadians. closed on Mondays.

name: Las Ventanas Gas Station
description: Very nice and convenient place on the Caretera Sur. Clean, safe, security, open 24/7, clean toilets (with seat and paper) and clean shower (one, in the men‘s bathroom, but I used it, too). If you ask nicely, they turn on the hot water :-) Shop at the gas station and restaurant around the corner. Music all day and night, and cars and trucks coming and going, but we slept well. And it is free, even the showers.

name: Servicentro Costa Caribeños
description: Easy LPG filling for our fixed tank. Also big enough for our Class C 29f

name: Big blue water tank
description: Big blue potable free-standing water tank (EcoTank label) only for human consumption. Nice area. Locals confirmed you can fill op drinking water here.

name: Finca El Chori
description:
Ideal place for free volunteering with plants. 
The finca has space for camper, tents and there is a bus where you can sleep, and there is an area with kitchen. 
The job is from 7 am to 3 pm, excluding breakfast and lunch. 
Choir's house let you into bathroom, shower, you can use the refrigerator. 
This place is ideal for visiting around the zone, the owner Douglas is friendly and he likes to give you tours of all zones. 
8.5 km from the finca is Santa Teresa and 5 km Montezuma.
Send a message before to Douglas. 
+506 8846 6897 
.....
Lugar ideal para hacer voluntariado gratis con las plantas, transplantes, sembrar, regar, etc,... 
La finca cuenta con espacios para parkear, para armar carpa o cuentan con un bus acondicionado para dormir y con área de cocina. 
El trabajo es de 7 a.m. - 3 p.m. incluye desayuno y almuerzo. 
En la casa de chori hay baño y ducha, también te comparte su refri para guardar cosas, y aquí mismo hay enchufes para conectar lo que necesites. 
Ideal para conocer toda la zona, a Douglas, el dueño, le gusta llevarte a conocer toda la zona. 
8.5 km se encuentra Santa Teresa, a 5km Montezuma. 
Contactar previamente con Douglas 
+506 8846 6897

name: Playa Blanca
description:
Laundry service. Just drop off your laundry and it will be clean and ready a few hours later. 
2000 C / kilo

name: Pochotel
description:
Campsite next to a hotel in a beautiful location.
Campground is well-maintained with a super friendly and helpful host. We received a very warm welcome and enjoyed the gorgeous views of the two volcanos from the restaurant. Highly recommended spot to camp and enjoy this beautiful place.

name: Osa Conservation Biologist Station
description:
Osa Conservation Biologist Station (NGO)

As Corcovado NP was closed for several days due to heavy rains when we visited Osa, we ran into some biologists from this station who offered us to go hiking around their research grounds. It’s actually a big area with several more or less maintained hiking paths and even some explanatory posters here and there. 

You can also hike to the beach where you find interesting rock plateaus and formations.

We saw spider monkeys, bats, an agouti, a coati and several birds, even 2 great curassows, during our visit. It was a great, free alternative to the park.

Road from Matapalo up to their facilities is not too bad (also accessible with heavy rains and you don’t need 4x4, just high clearance), we did not have to cross any rivers (all have bridges by now). 

They also rent out cabins and probably wouldn’t mind if someone stayed at their grounds for camping but we did not ask.

name: Caribbean Rainforest Sloths
description:
Campground and nature reserve hosted by a lovely couple, Jose and wife. Beautiful garden and 100m path through the forest to a river with lots of wildlife. Grassy space for camping. Sloths, frogs, and many birds can be observed here!!

Beautiful wild sloths and a lovely and hospitable couple. The two of them love nature and spend their time conserving the local forest. Jose spent almost 2 hours with us, showing us every inch of his garden and the forest, then gave us coconut water and sat with us for a coffee.

name: NanoGas
description:
You can refill your own propane gas tank here without having to replace it (as we normally do here in Costa Rica).
Open from 7:30am - 5:00pm, monday to saturday, sunday is closed

name: Restaurant Los Sementales Finca, Campground, Cabanas
description:
This place was recommended by our rental company Nomad America. The owner, Ádrian, is a friend of theirs. He owns a lovely farm with different kinds of fruits, which you may pick yourself for personal use. He has a lot of different animals, which he really loves. He passionately gives a tour around the farm. He even came to us to let us feed the calves. There’s a family of howler monkeys living around his farm. He is truly hospitable, friendly and really cares for you. He has a steakhouse/restaurant  (super recommend, tasty food). There’s a bathroom and toilets. It really is a paradise here, cannot recommend this place enough. Perfect stay between Puerto Viejo and la Fortuna. 
By the way, if you’d like to do some rafting, the Rio Toro is super nearby. 

Make sure you contact him before arriving. Number; +506 84496786 (not a must)

name: complete auto repair
description: well equiped mechanics, owner is David Vargas

name: Playa Cabuya
description: Tranquil spot by the rocky beach with great ocean views. Not good for swimming due to stony shore. Nice view of Cementerio Island and Cabo Blanco NR from here. Locals hang out here in the evening until it gets dark, but heard no one at night. No facilities except a few benches and table structures. Place for a few cars, big rigs might struggle for space if not alone.

name: Distribuidora, Don Joaquin, Los Angeles
description: Next to Verduleria Don Joaquin, sells different sizes of propane bottles, we needed a 20 pound one and they have that, a lot of the other places do not!

name: Bolivar park
description:
Open wifi with name Zii_para_todos
Connection possible after providing reason for use

name: Jose Carlos Vanagon Mechanic Orotina
description:
We got in contact with Jose through a friend of him in Guatemala to do some maintenance on our VW vanagon Syncro. This guy truly knows what he is doing, there are very few mechanics in central america that know vanagons, let alone syncro's. he owns quite a few and does amazing precise work and engine swaps for his customers and himself.
We needed some custom work like a special pully for our waterpump which he had machined in his shop in San José.
Our suspension bushings on front lower control arms where worn which he imported and replaced and got the van perfectly alligned (better than back in the Netherlands to be honest). He has his adresses around san jose to work with vanagons. (you could call him a project manager aswell since he's got connections all over)
This is his other adress where he has a place to work. The main shop is on San Jose.
If you need some work or maintenance on your vanagon, do it with Jose. Don't expect it to be as super cheap as the Mexican mechanics, but the jobs you get done here stay good for a long time, see it as an investment.
Before you go here, make sure to send him a text since he's moving inbetween his shops. Also if you need parts, reach out to him as early as you can in case it needs to be ordered.
his number is:
+506 8311 3899 

If you need a place to stay contact him, there is an appartment here that you can stay in in case you need to spend some time.

name: Veterinarian
description: Good place. English speaking vet. On-site lab service. Dog food.

name: Rancho de Ceci
description: I highly recommend this restaurant, the owner Ceci is very welcoming, and even gave us a pack of Costa Rican coffee. The food is amazing, we had fried fish, churrasco and maduros con queso.

name: Camping de vida
description: Camping de Vida! Easy to reach using google maps. Small campsite with a steep hill up, not for big rigs. Has two sheltered places to cook and sit, one with a refrigerator with freezer. Two showers and two toilets which were doable. Not a lot of place, think for 5/6 cars in total. Lovely family that runs the place! So please help them ;)

name: Servicentro del Mar
description: Fuel, small spare parts, fast food and restrooms

name: Campground Piratas Place
description:
Campground with spaces for RVs, camp tents, vans, etc.

Good wifi, water filter, common are kitchen with two fridges and a gas stove, indoors and outdoor showers, clean toilets, all shade by trees and wonderful nature, beach within 2 min walking distance. Palm beach states have 24 hours security at the gate.  Dog friendly. 

The price is $10 per person per night. Discounts for more than one night / Please make a reservation beforehand with Chelsea at +506 72039086  

We have for rent, bikes, and surfing boards. Sergio our second manager can help you with fishing tours and connect you with fantastic surfing coaches.

name: Llano Escondido Camping
description:
Mountain campsite with basic services, with access to ravine, river and waterfalls, flora and fauna on site, showers, toilets, and an indoor common area.
.....
Camping de montaña con servicios básicos, con acceso a quebrada, río y cataratas, flora y fauna en el lugar, duchas y sanitarios, área común bajo techo.

name: Tilawaland
description: Hostel Glamping and camping area with beautiful sunset and good prices

name: San Miguel Surfing School and Camping
description:
Surf school and camping right at the beautiful beach of San Miguel. 
Nearby, rock pools, lush jungle , waterfalls, hikes, viewpoint, wildlife. 
Great beach for surfing.

name: Caprinaland
description:
A campground with a lovely view high up in the mountains. Please note the place can only be reached with a 4x4 or a motorbike. Sloped grassland with a little pond in the middle. The toilet, cold shower and wash basins are very clean and well-built.  Pet -friendly. 
Contact via WhatsApp: +506 7114 0678 Jose. Reservations are recommended.

name: Finca La Pelota
description: Place surrounded by nature, with a beautiful view of the mountains on the Pacific side, perfect to spend a moment of relax and contact with nature

name: Water point/ Aqua free
description: Free potable water tank in big blue tank. (Eco tank)

name: Aquamatic Dry Cleaning
description: Location has changed. There is a parking lot and it is open everyday but Sunday from 8:30 to 6pm

name: Hospedaje Coffee mountain
description:
Very cozy hotel in the mountains.
Secure parking behind a gate.
15k for two people. Shared bathroom and toilet. Small kitchen and great view from the balcony. The people are very kind!!

name: Cabañas Colibrí
description:
Cozy hotel with secure parking behind a gate.
We paid 20k for two persons. Has a small kitchen.

name: Camping Los Garrobos
description:
Great campsite facing the sea. Clean showers and toilets. And a very warm welcome.
.....
Super camping face à la mer. Des douches et toilettes propres. Et un très bon accueil.

name: Ticket at Kiosk
description: We tried to buy our tickets for Volcán Poas online (17$/P), but none of our cards were  accepted. So the ranger sent us here (kiosk opens at 8 am). But be aware the tickets here now cost 25$/P which seems to be quite a rip off considering the online price. Couldn't negociante and no chance to buy the ticket at the park entrance. the rangers didn't care.

name: Beachfront Parking
description: Nice place to sleep in Montezuma. Big space and great location on the beach. Mostly flat surface, Laundry service 20mts from the place. It's next to the road but very few cars run by at night.

name: Rancho Los Girasoles restaurant with camping
description: We camped overnight at restaurant Rancho Los Girasoles where owner Ronald offers us a spot for 5000C per person.  This restaurant is still under construction but not very crowded.  From the campsite you can walk the route to Cerro Pelado where you can watch a great sunrise.  Ronald is friendly and hospitable and can cook wonderfully!

name: La Chelita Farm
description:
Good place in the southern of Costa Rica, Italian food, friendly and of course good specialty coffee. 
If you want to do a coffee tour this farm is perfect.

name: Finca Malvaez
description: Hike in or 4WD only, public access roads are rough and unpaved last 5 Km to location. Finca Malvaez is a tree nursery. Totally undeveloped campsites located in rugged forest terrain. Running water at head of trail.   Appx. 3 Km of winding sometimes steep trails through private forest. Cell reception only at higher elevations.

name: Cascada Pozo Azul
description: Nice campsite behind a Soda with toilets and showers. Large sloping place right by the river with several undercover areas to park next to, but few level spots for campervans or roof tents. Amazing waterfall walks, swimming holes, a hand pull cable car over the river on the longest walk is great fun! We paid $28 for one night, which included the entrance fee to the walking trails, so not as expensive as it sounds. Wifi is ok at the soda but gets weaker the further away you park. Some of the most impressive waterfalls we have seen in one area, and very few tourists.

name: Drake Bay Public Carpark
description: Public carpark outside the dive shop, by a lovely beach. Flat. Room for 4x4s with tents.

name: Jaco Mirador
description: Stayed here for one calm night. Loved the place. Super quiet with a nice view over Jaco. For the sunset came two locals (by foot?!). We have seen toucans, macaws & monkeys in the trees! The entry to the road to this place is opposite to the abandoned hotel (or for searching in Google Maps: opposite to Jaco Town Plaza). You can not find it in Google Maps. It is possible to enter without 4x4, if it is not raining. Of course, no bathrooms or showers! We stayed at one platform (the first on the left side), but there were more.

name: Casa Marbella
description: This hotel is amazing value for the money. We paid 40$ for a very spacious double room with private bathroom (even has AC). Breakfast is already included and they have a beautiful terrace at the river. They lent you kayaks and boots for free and of course can organize all the tours and transport for you that you want. Very clean and well maintained. If you arrange transport with them the boat will most likely pick you up directly at their dock at the terrace (very convenient). We stayed the night before close to the National park basically for the same price but this is another league. Very close to one of the biggest supermarkets as well. They don’t have a shared kitchen but there is a fridge and a microwave you can use.

name: Puerto Vargas Lodge
description: 9 cabanas style detached rooms with a/c, 2 double beds each and fridge. Communal open air kitchen and outdoor pool all impeccably maintained. End of lot is adjacent to the jungle and has multiple fruit trees growing. Ample parking for motorcycle to rv. $35-50 depending on how long is your stay.

name: Belcruz bed and breakfast
description: Good size comfortable, clean rooms off the main road  so quiet.  Safe parking but not locked.  Lovely family run place. Wifi average.  Access to walking track to watch sunset over Monteverde and the ocean.  Food very good and a great walking track to restaurant for breakfast which they will light up at night.  Restaurant open to guests at night but you need to preorder food and a time to eat… well worth it!

name: Bella Vista restaurant
description:
Good place to stop for food and a drink with a view put across the valley.
Popular with locals.  A nice vibe.  Prices for food from 1500 to 3500 colons.

name: Heliconias Garden Cabins
description: Rustic no frills cabins with private bathroom and fan and small patio with a cabin.  Only meters from a beautiful beach and the Drakes Bay hiking track that runs through the jungle and along the beaches in both directions.  The surrounding area is full of wildlife and in the 3 days we were here we saw lots of monkeys, anteaters, squirrels and a python.  Also sloths around.  Lots of butterflies and birds too, especially hummingbirds in the gardens.  The set up is very remote and a full board basis.  All the meals were good and different every day.  For two of us we paid $152USD/day full board, when you break it down it’s good value for what you get and the unique stay… right in the jungle and away from everything!

name: Boss Circuits
description: Electronic Engineering for overland vehicles. From consulting, advising, checking, fixing and designing any electrical wiring to customized works for your overlanding requirements. Includes installing any electrical/electronic device such us compressors, solar and dual battery systems, water pumps, etc up to more sophisticated ones as ARB Lynx, simarine screens and more.

name: Kasiké Kamping Beachfront
description: This is a private beachfront camp ground on beautiful Ventanas beach Costa Rica, adjacent to playa grande. Permission is obtained through contacting the owner at +1 518 694 1174. via whatsapp. Nightly camping is $30/night. Discounts for extended stays. Access to amenities is 5 min away at a sister property. There is a rustic bathroom and shower, potable water, wifi, and electric to charge your devices. A pool at this location is under construction.

name: Río Piedras
description:
A place to park at the side of the river. Very safe,
.....
area para acampar al lado del río , muy segura

name: Green Camping
description:
Chito is a very friendly host. Lots of birds. Several camping places.
The price is 5$ pp for a truck and 5$ / night more if you need electricity. 
The price is 6$ pp for a space to pitch the tent, with electricity, light and wifi.
It's possible to rent a tent. 
There are toilets, showers and lockers.
Ask at Hotel Maria Luisa o by phone: +506 85356353 o +506 83919780

name: Poza Larga
description:
Natural swimming pool in a river where locals go to swim. It’s perfect to cool off on hot days!
___
Piscine naturelle dans une rivière où les locaux vont se baigner. C’est parfait pour nous rafraîchir lors des journées chaudes!

name: Karen cabins
description: Nice place and quiet, well situated.  Clean room with private bathroom, AC and TV,  1 double bed and 1 single 25 000 colones per night for 2 pple. Pet friendly.

name: Cabinas La Central
description: Simple but cheap accommodation. Room with double bed and private bathroom + fan 12000 colones. Pet friendly and good to park the bicycles inside.

name: Twins Spot
description: We spent 2 nights on this quiet place in the street, in front of an unoccupied field. In front of the sea and quiet, we will see even howler monkeys

name: Camping Bahía Ballena
description:
Old Mountain house, ocean view.
bathroom and shower depends on water availability.
Contact. Berny +506 89834030

name: Rancho Guadalupe
description:
Home of a lovely Costa Rican family with two kids and some nice dogs. Also a place where they rent their rancho for private events. Place for several vans, big rigs would also fit and there is also a small grassy area for tents. They charge 3000 colones pp/pn.
It's a private place, so please text Keren (only Spanish) some time in advance via whatsapp (+506 8445 2925).

Casa de una familia maravillosa con dos hijos y algunos perros muy amables. También un lugar donde alquilan el rancho para eventos privados. Hay lugar para varios vans/big rigs y también tiendas. Cobran 3000 colones por noche/persona.
Es un lugar privado, por eso por favór contácte a Keren un poco antes por whatsapp (+506 8445 2925).

name: Camping Arrecife
description:
This is the campground Arrecife.
It’s at the corner before El Arrecife Bar, a little bit confusing.
But this place is way better than the car park of the bar where you can also stay.
We paid 6500 colones per person.
Two flush toilets and several cold indoor showers are available. 
Wifi available as well.
We stayed two nights and had a great time close to the beach.
Busy on the weekend as it’s also used as a paid car park but then almost empty during the week.
If there’s a big swell you can walk down the road to the left for about 100 meters and surf a nice right hand point break.

name: beach and trees
description: place naar the beach, locals fishing, beautiful. check the tides of the sea

name: river to cross
description:
The road has become impassable for our 2x4 sprinter here.  A major river to cross.  The locals cross it with smaller vans and pick-ups, but we didn't dare.  So we went around by the 155 which is in very good shape. 
---
La route est devenue impraticable pour notre sprinter 2x4 ici. Une importante rivière à traverser. Les locaux la traversent avec des fourgonnettes et des camionnettea, mais nous n'avons pas osé. Nous avons donc fait le tour par la 155 qui elle est très belle.

name: Hotel Cortez Azul
description:
very cute little hotel, downtown of Alajuela. During the day you can park in front of the hotel,  for the night there is a secure parking for 4 US$ just one block away. 
breakfast is included in the price (we paid 32$ for two persons in a double room with bathroom).
Also offer a laundry service within 3 hours. great service and super friendly!
15 minutes drive from the International Airport.

name: Beach
description: As you pass through the banana and ananases vessel port right behind Limon and drive to this peninsula, you can actually pull out almost anywhere. The road gets close to the railway and then follows it all the way until the river, where the road stops. It is easy 4wd, doable even in 2wd I guess. Nice black beach, really remote area. You can ask at any of the few houses by the road if you want to be 100% sure.

name: Sukia Hostel & Camping
description:
Nice hostel in Drake Bay. Has a few spots available for 4x4 with rooftop tents. They provide nice and clean showers, toilets and a big communal kitchen. We could stay here for 10 USD per person, and we're traveling with two persons. 

They also arrange and organize multiple tours. If you want to go into Corcovado NP, make sure you book in advance. We try to book it a day before, unfortunately wasn't possible anymore.

name: Quiet side street
description: Quiet place under trees close to hotels, restaurants and supermarket. Dead end street, so no through traffic.

name: Finca Lora
description:
Café Finca. Great coffee tour with Jorge from Switzerland. Very informative and super tasty coffee! You can also stay for the night on his finca when booking a tour. We can only recommend this place. Jorge and Roxana are very welcoming! 
His number: +50683767877

name: Cool Air Aire Acondicionado
description: All kinds of AC for cars, campers, yachts etc. The owner, Hans Wimmer, speaks perfect English, very helpful and friendly!! Whole-hearted recommendation!

name: La Palmita
description: Off the main road, uphill, next to a small children's playground /school building. Level space, some road noise from the highway below, otherwise very quiet. Nice neighbours, free wifi. The first spot we found on the way from San Jose to El Arenal.

name: Jery's Garage (formerly LaTrocha)
description: See entries for La Trocha about 4 km away - everything still applies.Jery and his team are VERY conscientious and thorough mecanics, very friendly and hospitable, too. We slept for 2 nights in our car on the premises, Jery invited us to dinner with his family :-) One of the most agreeable bunch of persons we met on our whole trip. Thanks a lot, all of you!!!

name: mariscos Pargos en Altamar
description:
Bonne poissonnerie, prix honnêtes!

Good fish shop, fair prices!

name: Flat area with very sick access
description: Flat area above the paved road with very steep access, last 100m are steep and narrow, most ok small gravel pieces, but last 15m are mud and grass. Definitely give it a walk before you shoot.

name: Cerro Haku Summit
description:
This is as far as you can get into Parc Amistad. I do not know about the trail from Olan to Cerro Utyum, so I can only speak for the trail from Cerro Kai to here.

It is brutal.

The approx 7km from Cerro Kai to here took me 5 hours of never-ending fight. The trail disappears, you climb on your knees, in dry season in knee deep mud, there are root sections out of this world. I got lost and searched for the path for 30min, even with blue sky and with GPS. GPS on smart phone will not connect almost all the time as the jungle is too thick. There are no tracks of humans, and super cool old signs that have grown with the trees they are attached to and are now about 6m high, even more.

But if you believe you can make it, do not hesitate a second. It is stunning, beautiful, and you can see as far as you can see on all sides. Top as it can get.

I never take guides unless it is mandatory and always walk or  climb alone, but this time doing it again I would consider a guide because if it gets seriously foggy or heavy rain, it can become serious.

name: Camping La Fortuna
description:
CAMPING CERRADO DESDE EL 6/6 AL 24/6
CAMPING CLOSED FROM 6/6 TO 6/24

Welcome world travelers! The campsite, although it is near the town of Fortuna, is a very quiet place in nature with a small lagoon, tables to relax, showers, bathrooms, full kitchen, refrigerator, common area with tables and chairs, electricity and Wi-Fi. There are many animals such as sloths, ducks, turtles, frogs, toucans, etc. There are nice trails around the grounds. Drinking water available! Ideal for RV or tents. Price: 5000 colones per person, free for children under 5 years old. Pet friendly.

 Marco Tulio is really very welcoming, simply amazing.  You can write to him before passing if you wish.  +506 6248 0679 (Whatsapp)

                          ----------------

Du propriétaire :

 Bienvenue aux voyageurs du monde !
 Le camping, bien qu'il soit proche de la ville de Fortuna, est un endroit très calme en pleine nature avec une petite lagune, des tables pour se détendre, des douches, des salles de bains, une cuisine complète, un réfrigérateur, un espace commun avec tables et chaises, électricité et Wi-Fi.
 On y trouve de nombreux animaux comme des paresseux, des canards, des tortues, des grenouilles, des toucans, etc.
 Il y a de jolis sentiers autour du terrain.
 Eau potable à disposition !

 Idéal pour camping-car ou tentes.
 Prix : 5000 colones par personne, gratuit pour les enfants de moins de 5 ans. Animaux acceptés.

                        - - - - - - - - - - - - - 
Del propietario:

 ¡Bienvenidos viajeros del mundo!
 El camping, aunque está cerca del pueblo de Fortuna, es un lugar muy tranquilo en la naturaleza con una pequeña laguna, mesitas para relajar,  duchas, baños, cozinha completa, refrigerador, área común con mesas y sillas, electricidad y wifi.
 Hay muchos animales como perezosos, patos, tortugas, ranas, tucanes, etc.
 Hay agradables senderos alrededor de los terrenos.
 ¡Agua potable disponible!

 Ideal para Casa rodante o tiendas de campaña.
 Precio: 5000 colones por persona, gratis para niños menores de 5 años. Aceptan mascotas.

                        - - - - - - - - - - - - - 

 Do proprietário:

 Bem vindos viajantes do mundo!
 O camping, embora próximo à cidade de Fortuna, é um local muito tranquilo em meio à natureza com uma pequena lagoa, mesas para relaxar, duchas, banheiros, cozinha completa, geladeira, área comum com mesas e cadeiras, energia elétrica e wi-fi.
 Existem muitos animais como preguiças, patos, tartarugas, sapos, tucanos, etc.
 Existem trilhas agradáveis ao redor do terreno.
 Água potável disponível!

 Ideal para RV ou tendas.
 Preço: 5.000 colones por pessoa, grátis para menores de 5 anos. Pet friendly.

name: se ua
description:
amazing host. clean rooms. kitchen is clean and perfect. away from any loud noise. homey feeling. secure parking. Cost 40$ usd for single bed. cold showers.
highly recommend

name: Arboleto Salazar Coffee Plantation
description: Small Coffee producer who is glad to welcome travellers. Christian gives you an exhaustive tour through the small compound where he and his fsmily process their coffee harvest. Lots of information plus tasting, sells his coffee at a VERY good price. Wholehearted recommendation to visit and support this local and independent producer!!!

name: McDonald's parking lot
description: Right behind McDonald's, a bit away from the street. When we asked the employees, they said company rules don't let them give us official permission for liability reasons, so we agreed to not have asked them :-) , we stayed and they ignored us benevolently. In exchange we had dinner there.

name: free access WiFi in the park
description: Free and fast Wi-Fi in the park. No password is required

name: Spot aeay from all noise
description: Last left before the highway starts to climb up. Perfect spot between palms rigjt on the beach.  Enjoy

name: Playa Brasilito
description: Lots of shady places to stop by. We came on Sunday afternoon, some locals as usual in these places on weekends, after sunset we were alone. Absolutely quiet, only the sound of the waves. Beautiful view of the sea and the islands.

name: Free and Fast Public Wi-Fi
description:
Thats an amazing ioverlander spot!
Perfect place to park your motorhome and spend few days with an amazing fast and for free, public Wi-Fi!

name: Next to the river
description: Just a small street down the Main Street. Locals said it’s a good place to camp and it definitely is! There is some kind of holiday building in the making next to it. One of the guys working there said we could sleep on the property, they have running water and some tables. If not, just next to it is very nice too. They made a little pond in the river with beach to swim

name: Gas Tomza
description:
It is possible to refill the American bottles, 10,000 colones for 2 bottles. Closed on Sundays. 
.....
 possible de remplir les bouteilles américaines, 10000 colonnes pour 2 bouteilles

name: TRM Precision
description: The best metal specialists we have come across on our complete Latin America trip. A company of 10 to 12 highly professional people. Doing any kind of turning, welding, grinding, boring, polishing. They repaired an aluminium cross-section of our tent's poles. A task that four tornerias had failed on before. Cut new threads and turned new hollow pins for the component. The result was better than new. They can repair or renew pretty much everything of metal/aluminium. Location is a bit hidden. A few hundred meters before the parallel road of the Panamericana joins the Panamericana, follow the short gravel road on the right. After 100 m you reach TRM.

name: Natural Hot Springs
description: Nice natural hot springs inside the National Park. Around 38 or 39 degrees Celsius. Obviously you accessible from the Mountain Lodge by a nice 4KM trail without paying entrance fee for the park.

name: Playa Negra
description: When parking at Playa Negra, there is a security fee for the parking (1000 colones) You can then go down the path toward the beach. Just before you reach the beach there is a « shower » for public use to rince off salt for surfers I guess. Nothing fancy but the shower itself looks free to use. Haven’t check if it was drinkable.

name: Playa Ricardo
description:
Great quiet place! We originally went for the Playa Hermosa place already marked on ioverlander, but it was packed with people. Instead we went down about 150 meters on the highway and found this gem! 
Ricardo has created a nice quiet spot for you to settle down and watch the most amazing sunsets. Although the spots are close to the road, you can't hear the traffic due to the waves crashing on the shore. 
There is a toilet and a very crude open air shower to use for 500 colones.
Ricardo also has a small drink and snack cart offering chips, pipa fría, soda, water and beer. 
He lives on the property, and didn't charge us to stay. Just that he asks for a tip before you leave.
We gave him 6000 colones for the night for the two of us in a RTT.

name: Maxi Pali
description:
Agua purificada inside Maxi Pali. Refill Station as known in any Walmart in the US. 2700 Colones for 5 gallons (pricey, but we don’t trust the tap water in Costa Rica yet).
You can also choose 1 or 6 liters. Credit card only.

name: Gevi Hot Springs
description:
Wonderful place at the end of the road. 
We tried to stop at the spot right below this location on the map, but no one was home. We decided to keep going since the hot springs was the thing that originally brought us here. As we got to the top of the road, there was a friendly woman who greeted us. She didnt have any space for us to camp, but did have a room with breakfast. It was 30,000 colones ($50 USD). Beautiful spot and very quiet after they close at 5pm. The entire space was ours including the hot springs. You get a nice view of Chirripo Mountain as well. We utilized our camp stove and cooked up some dinner as there are no places to eat dinner on the property. 4x4 recommended and no big rigs.

name: Hotel La Rana de Arenal
description: This is a really lovely hotel, with large parking away from the road, and very affordable rooms for this area. I paid $20 on Booking.com for a private single room. The view from the hotel is stunning, looks down on Lake Arenal. The restaurant serves German food, and had the best currywurst I’ve had outside of Germany. Also at dusk and dawn, the staff sets out bananas to feed the birds, and you can watch birds come right to you including Toucans! Highly recommend for moto-travelers, you may be able to negotiate to park a van here too, not sure. I might ride back here again just for for the food. Note that the paved driveway down is a bit tight and steep (single car width) so super big rigs might not fit.

name: Marisqueria Vista Mar
description: Small restaurant, very good food, nice view and very friendly people.

name: Icaco camping Limon
description: A little campground in front of the sea.

name: beach spot
description:
We spent one night here, near the road but no problem at night, beautiful beach, we were alone, we felt safe, the "neighbors" came to chat with us :)


Nous avons passé une nuit ici , près de la route mais aucun problème la nuit, belle plage, nous étions seuls, on s'est senti en sécurité, les "voisins" sont venus nous discuter avec nous :)

name: Playa Guiones secondary access
description:
Open access to a beautiful sandy beach, with trees where we were able to hang out hammocks. We parked directly on the right when entering the beach, but you could drive a little further from the access to be less disturbed by the locals who access the beach at pretty much any time of the night with loud motorcycles. Check tides though as at high tide there is little beach left and you could get trapped in your spot until tide goes down. And please don’t get your car stuck in the sand :). When the beach is dry the sand is firm but if you drive in the water you WILL stay stuck. So park far back in the trees if you end up driving on the beach.

As mentioned the locals access the beach at pretty much any time of the night so expect to be disturb by the noise of tick-tucks and motorcycles, and of course be mindful of your valuables, though we absolutely haven’t felt threatened the slightest bit, there is a sign at the entrance of the beach to warn tourist about thieves.

This our 2nd night here as I write this and probably not the last if we end up staying longer in Nosara.

I deemed the spot accessible for big rigs because before the beach there is a parking area that will accommodate bigger vehicules, but I don’t think driving one on the beach would be wise as the tide goes quite high and I haven’t scouted the beach for a spot that would both accommodate a big rig and be completely safe from becoming wet and soft under the wheels at high tide.

name: gas station /water
description:
Possible to refill 20 l 
Possible de  remplir  maximum 20l d' eau

name: Grateful Hotel
description: Beautiful small hotel with rural setting. Total chill atmosphere with close access to beach ,store and Tamarindo. Came here on a motorcycle but I think there is nearby parking for larger vehicles. Spendy but fun . 90usd. it was a treat for this old deadhead. Met up with my tribe and recharged my batteries! Worth a stop for lunch or supper if as anything!

name: Servicentro Sixaola
description:
Potable Water 
free shower 
space for sleep into the vehicle

name: Public Beach Parking Samara
description: Convenient, safe parking adjacent to the playground near the police station. Located right in the heart of Samara near restaurants. Tall palm trees provide shade for eating at the picnic tables in the sandy beachfront area though the parking lot does not have much shade, unless you park with your vehicle facing the ocean. This is a popular parking lot so it is best to arrive early in the morning or wait until after the sunset crowd departs and the lot empties out. Playground is well lit and locals were hanging out until after 10pm, though we spent a very quiet night here. There are only a handful of level spots for overnight parking as the lot is a bit lumpy. We found a perfectly level spot without any difficulty once the parking lot emptied around 6:30pm

name: Manzanillo
description: Showers for 1000 colones, next to the national park and another further back from the entry, a little pricey but good

name: Don Juan coffee tours
description:
tour of a coffee and chocolate plantation, the guides speak English very well and are highly entertaining.

You get to make your own chocolate from freshly ground cocoa beans and drink all the coffee variations.

name: Pescaderia
description: Great fish for reasonable prices! We bought 2.6kg of Tuna and Mahi Mahi for 29 US Dollars. They only take cash.

name: Bar'coquebrado camping
description: We stopped here for dinner and found out that they have Glamping!  We had a 4x4 with a rooftop tent, so they opened a spot for us to stay for the night.  Clean bathrooms and an outdoor shower.  Super friendly family!  We had pizza in the evening and then they made us breakfast in the morning (fresh cut fruit, eggs and homemade bread!)

name: Agua purificada
description:
Refill station infront of good market. Next to the entrance. 
2275 colones for 5 gallons

name: Across the Policia de Transito
description:
Small green strip against a wall with a mural. Across is the Transit-Police. They are very nice people. Quiet night.
Plain street parking so no facilities, but if you ask kindly the police might help you out.

name: Entrance to the beach
description:
NOT FOR BIG RIGS AND 4x4 HIGLY RECOMMANDED! 

This location is the entrance to the beach where we spent the night. You can then follow the dirt road down until the beach. It’s steep, curvy, and probably slippery but we had a rental car with permanent 4x4 and had no problem going up and down. On the right when you arrive there are plenty of spots under the trees. It was crowded with cars and locals when we arrived (around 5pm on a Sunday) but as the sun went down most left. We set up our hammocs and had a good night with the sound of the waves. The tide can go quite high so park your car up high in between the trees. The view is outstanding. Plenty of people came to the beach but we felt really safe the whole time.

name: Hacienda El Rodeó
description:
Charming small hotel 40 minutes from San José in the quiet mountains and with a swimming pool. Possibility of dinner on site by reservation ($20 for the menu with starter, main course, dessert and pineapple juice). Very attentive host. We are traveling by motorhome and we have been there with a group of friends from France. We were able to park our motorhome without problems in the park.
-------------------
Charmant petit hôtel à 40 minutes de San José dans la montagne au calme et avec une piscine. Possibilité de dîner sur place sur réservation (20$ le menu avec entrée,plat, dessert et jus d’ananas). Hôte très attentionné. Nous voyageons en camping-car et nous y avons été avec un groupe d’amis venus de France. Nous avons pu stationner notre camping-car sans problème dans le parc.

name: Poas Volcano Entrance
description: It’s a little and narrow spot (12m2, about 5m wide) in the left of the Road when you drive to the entrance at the park. Very quiet, very safe, we did not see anybody pass on the road in the night. No amenities! It’s high altitude so.. freaking cold at night! Gorgeous view on San José 500m down the road!

name: Lubicentro MFM
description: It’s a mechanic garage. We needed to change a piece in the motor and the boss of the garage ( Franklin) said at us it’s ok to stay on the side. It’s very safe (cameras), and quiet. We can use the water, the wifi and the toilet of the garage office . Lots of people walk in the street but very friendly . Franklin has a fast food beside the garage, good food and good price. If you need to fix something in you car and want take your time it’s perfect!

name: AYA potable water
description: Blue AYA potable water station at side of road

name: Aurora Camping
description: Nice little campsite close to the Rio Celeste NP entrance. Shelters, power, toilets and a hot shower for 5000 colones per person.

name: Monteverde Butterfly Gardens
description: Very nice and well managed butterfly gardens. Open 9.00 am to 3.00 pm. Tours inclouded in the entrance fee, highly recommended! You get to see butterflies, insects, scorpions, beetles, birds and eventually small animals. 18.00 USD per person. You can come back as many times as you want within a few days! https://www.monteverdebutterflygardens.com/

name: tilaran central plaza
description: In the middle of the Town. Quiet and safe. Security cameras and the police said it's was ok to stay. Free. Some playground for kids and good green area. Some shops around the plaza . Free wi-fi.

name: Zii free wifi access
description: Just another place to get zii wifi. Park and get internet

name: taller Mora
description:
Great mechanic specialised in alternator.
They allowed us to sleep in our van in their garage, giving us the key and access to a bathroom and potable water while they were fixing the alternator.
We drive a Mercedes sprinter, therefore it was very hard to get the alternator here. It would have been 2 weeks and 1300$ but they repared it in less than 24h and 120$.
Andy Mora and his father are very welcoming and knowledgeable.

name: Coco mar
description: camping ground (3000 colónes/pax/night) and cabinas (20,000 colones/night) available located in a very peaceful village.  very helpful and kind owner.  close to a quiet beach without tourists. I recommend

name: Palo Verde - Restaurant & Camp
description: Restaurant with campsite near the river (you can swim there.) 3,000 col/night/pax.  water, shower, wc and outdoor table available.  excellent restaurant where we ate very tasty seafood and fish.  we highly recommend!

name: Montezuma Waterfall
description:
Montezuma waterfall. Entrance is free. About 15min walking from parking lot.
Parking lot cost 1000 per person. But a little down the road next to playa montezuma you can park for free

name: Calido y Rustico B&B
Jungle spot
description: Little spot in the forest near arenal observatory lodge and spa. Very quiet spot, you can quietly listen to the sound of animals.

name: Park water spigot
description: I don't have my van with me so didn't fill up here but was walking by and appears to be a good spot. No threads. Just a pvc pipe. Good for jugs. Appears to be San Jose tap water which everyone seems to drink without issue. There is a parking lot right next to the spigot.

name: Water spigot
description: A threaded water spigot next to the parking lot for volleyball and tennis courts. Also a nice picnic area. Parking for vans and smaller. Parking spots are pretty small.

name: Playa Negra
description: It’s a really nice calm beach at the end off the restaurants/ bars area , a little busy during the day but keeping a relaxed and friendly ambience , there’s no street light at night but people where very respectful and we felt very safe , spend two nights here with no trouble

name: Playa Seco beachfront
description:
Place under the palmtrees between the ocean and the road. 
Flat  and grass.
No facilities

name: Playa Colonia 2 private wildcamp spots
description:
2 secluded wildcamp spots. Only accessible by 4x4. Under the trees on the beachfront.
Sand underground, no facilities.

name: Estero Ganado
description:
Place at the end of a dead-end road between trees and nice view of the mangroves and river.
Only accessible by 4x4

name: Pirate Cove
description: Sandy campsite right on the beach under trees. There is a road nearby but the spot is very quiet. 4x4 required due to sand and steep access road. No facilities.

name: Mariposas Alas del Destino
description:
We decided to stop by here on our way to La Fortuna and had a fantastic time! It is a butterfly farm and tour. Roberto is the owner who gives a very enthusiastic and knowledgeable tour. He really takes his time and wants everyone to enjoy the experience. It is also very much off the beaten track and a beautiful spot.

We were cycle touring and he was kind enough to let us camp here which we were really grateful for as it spent a lot of time raining!

Definitely recommend if you are in the area

name: Steep Gravel Road
description:
This is a gravel steep road to go to Playa Blanca from Montezuma. Do not attempt with a big RV!. Nice view from the top! 

Piste très pentue pour aller à Playa Blanca depuis Montezuma. Ne pas la prendre avec un camping car! Belles vues d’en haut!

name: Stefans Camping and cabinas
description: Camping and Cabinas , 200 Meters to Beach, bathrooms, showers , BBQ Facility, PET friendly, Mini Market, Ice, Electric hook ups, Campers and tents welcome, Bar and Restaurant at 200 meters

name: Free Parking Manuel Antonio National Park
description: We parked for free on the street near the bus shelter and walked 5 minutes to enter the park. There are shady and sunny spots available and there is free access to the beach adjacent to the national park if you want to skip the park. We enjoyed the park and the wildlife, for the record

name: JSM GLP
description: big gas station with GLP for cars so we were able to fill it up our Canadian fix tank

name: Sweet Escape
description: RV Parking, Restaurant Cabinas, Soda. Bathrooms, Shower, Wifi, Water hook up, nice and clean. They take Credit Cards, it 15 bucks for one RV with 2 people. The owner, Wade, speaks English and Spanish. Call 8969-8635

name: Brake Burner remote road
description: This road the 301 from San Jose to Parrita  is very steep and potholed. Not ideal for 2WD especially if going from the beach to San Jose. It's a brake burner.

name: La esquinita de la abuela
description: Amazing little restaurant with solely Costa Rican dishes for prices equal to a soda. We've eaten both breakfast and dinner here and both were very tasty. The atmosphere is old timey (hence the name). Give it a try!

name: El Cocal to/from Quepos
description:
Tiny ferry crossing between El Cocal and Quepos. It runs back and forth as needed, you roll on, pay 500colones, roll off. It’s sketchy and fun and not super necessary, but worth taking if you’re coming from up the road at El Cocal. 

Warning, the road from Miguel Surf Camp to here is kind of a trial - it feels like a mini game where you are navigating deep sand whoops through a run down village with downed power lines and small trash fires, as dogs, children, and anything else you can imagine darts out in front of you. Travel in Latin America at its best!

name: Electric pylon
description:
Tranquil and calm place to stay overnight just next too an electric pylone. We camped without asking anyone, some car passed (local), some didn't see us, and other did but didn't even came to us. 
Felt secure.
Not traveling with campervan, but it fit without any problem. Restaurant 100m before to fill water if necessary.

name: Drake Trail
description:
This is the entrance of the Drake Trail. It is free and it’s 20km round trip. Mostly flat, you’ll have access to many nice beaches along the road. 
You can park in the street before the entrance.

name: Hotel y Bar Casa Amarilla
description: Hotel tucked away behind Casa Amarilla bar. We paid 15000 for a twin room with 2 beds. Big space for bicycles in the room, but room was very basic. You can pay an extra 5000 for air conditioning. Lots of the other hotels in the town were closed.

name: River Camp
description:
Various sites along the small street at the river. Try not to stay too close at the bridge, this may be loud. Site itself calm and quiet without any traffic. 

Nice scenery at the river. Pay attention when it comes to rain, water level increases!

name: Rancho Tekales Playa Westfalia
description:
Nice restaurant with bar and Cabanas at the beach. Very friendly owner let us sleep after having a good and fair priced meal in his restaurant. 
Lovely and shady palm garden at the beach. Free WiFi and quiet at night!

name: Agutipaca Bungalows
description:
Prívate, very clean, gorgeous 4 little houses in a nice garden. It has little pool, very well equipped houses. Possibility of doing your laundry (for a little tip they do for you)
Kind and helpful owner.

name: Road side
description:
Very quiet roadside for a night before or after the hot springs. Right next to a field entrance. Easily accessible with our 26 footer. No network

Bord de route très calme pour une nuit avant ou après les sources chaudes. Juste à côté de l’entrée d’un champ. Facilement accessible avec notre 26 pieds. Pas de réseau

name: Unnaccesible road
description: Tríed this road to go from San Ramon to Fortuna and it was ok for the first km then NOT POSSIBLE to pass. No signs whatsoever warning the conditions of the road. Had to go back and take the other option

name: roadside jasic pull over spot
description: this is a no frills spot to pull over for the night if your headed either direction and don't want to navigate the roads at night if you haven't driven them . this is just east if Cervantes at entrance to Santiago.  it's just a roadside spot beside the lake . recommend only for in van or in car camp . I wouldn't set up a tent here . you will likely hear trucks passing or braking on nearby highway but it's safe .. bonus good birdwatching

name: casa Mawar
description: SMALL COTTAGES WITH BATHROOM, KITCHEN AND SHARED SWIMMING POOL. ONLY 10 METERS FROM THE BEACH!

name: Columnas basalticas
description:
Pretty swimmable river downstream of a dam with small waterfalls and basalt columns. Free and frequented only by locals, especially on weekends.
Possibility to sleep on site because there are a few flat parking spaces next to the dam. Non-potable water and free shower. Access a little difficult with our 26-foot (8-meter) motorhome because you have to do 8 km of tracks with climbs, descents, turns and a few holes
No telephone network
--
Jolie rivière baignable en aval d’un barrage avec de petites cascades et des colonnes basaltiques. Gratuit et fréquenté uniquement pas les locaux surtout en fin de semaine. 
Possibilité de dormir sur place car il y a quelques places de stationnement plates à côté du barrage. Eau non potable et douche gratuite. Accès un peu difficile avec notre camping-car de 26 pieds (8 mètres) car il faut faire 8 km de pistes avec montés, descentes, virages et quelques trous
Pas de réseau téléphonique

name: Columnas basalticas
description:
Swimmable river surrounded by nature with small waterfalls and basalt columns downstream of a dam. Frequented only by locals especially on weekends. Possibility to sleep on site (see wild camping spot). No telephone network. Difficult access with our 26 foot motorhome. 8km of track with some climbs / descents and complicated holes
--
Rivière baignable en pleine nature avec petite cascades et colonnes basaltiques en aval d’un barrage. Fréquenté uniquement par les locaux surtout en fin de semaine. Possibilité de dormir sur place (voir spot camping sauvage). Pas de réseau téléphonique. Accès difficile avec notre camping-car de 26 pieds. 8km de piste avec quelques passages montés / descentes et trous compliqués

name: Free Rural WiFi
description:
Free wifi hotspot here. 

You have to connect to the network and answer a couple of questions about your age and profession.

name: wild camping next to the road
description: Big and nice place next to the road. Quiet spot, just a few cars.

name: Lava Car Yema Car wash
description: It's a really great car wash for 5000c. Some spare tyres and a ramp for minor mechanics if needed. Family run and the owners are super friendly

name: Plaza principal
description:
Nice playground for children, shops nearby and a drinking water point. No restrictions on vehicle dimensions
---
Bel aire de jeux pour enfants, commerces à proximité et un point d’eau potable. Aucune restriction sur la dimensions des véhicules

name: Children's play park
description:
Simple playground for children between San José and the Pacific coast!
Access to all sizes, good 4G reception, no wifi. Ideal for children!
---
Simple parc de jeux pour enfants entre San José et la côte pacifique ! 
Accès à tout gabarit, bonne réception 4G, pas de wifi. Idéal pour les enfants !

name: Playa Grande
description:
Another perfect site direct at the sea. You will find plenty of shady places, not too hard to level. Beach is wide, clear water, nice sand. Surfers come along to surf and during day. Locals come to visit the beach with their families.

We felt safe and recommend this site!

name: big place right next to the road
description: Big place right next to the road. Just a few cars past the road in the night. Very quiet.

name: Camping Smoky Paradise // Charlie
description: Lovely little place close to the beach! We found this hidden campground by coincidence on our way to the Cahuita National Park and stayed there one night. The beach is directly across the street and super clean compared to other stretches we checked out before in this area. There is running water, a toilet and a shower in which apparently lives an iguana. But don't worry it will walk away as soon you make some noises otherwise just ask the owner Charlie for help. We paid 1000 Colones p.P. per night and were happy about this cheap stopover. The owner Charlie speaks also fluent English and is very friendly and helpful. On the campground is space for 3 vehicles, maximum Sprinter size because of the tight fence at the entrance. The road to the spot is hard packed sand with some overhanging branches. No traffic during the night and during the day it was also very peaceful.

name: Side of road in cloud forest
description: The pin lower down didn’t have much space so we drove up more looking for a better, flatter spot. What we found was just a flat grassy area right next to the road. It was quiet and felt safe for a night. No one bothered us. Only saw some runners. The road to get here is VERY steep. We would not have done it without 4WD.

name: Camping Mirador el Castillo
description:
This is an established campsite on a platform over the lake. Beautiful views of the lake and the volcano Arenal. the road to the campsite is rough and not paved. the site is quite new, when we arrived they were still building the sanatorio. 
the facility includes WC and shower. 
the place is above Castillo, quiet and totally in nature.
we paid 4.000 per person 

the entry may be too steep for big rigs

name: Tap with hose at grocery store
description:
Just at the entrance. We asked the guy at the cashier and he said we can fill up, no problem. He said it’s potable but we will filter it.

It’s easy to park next to it and use the hose directly.

name: Space for one by the road close to entrance of reserve
description:
Suitable for one small(ish) vehicle, there is a flat pullout by the road, only a few hundred meters away from the entrance of the reserve.

It’s protected from the wind. It was quiet all night, we had a good sleep here. Traffic starts around 5.30am, but up until 6.15 only a few motorbikes.

name: Rio Agujitas EcoFarm Hostel and Tours
description:
This is a really interesting option for staying in Drake, but getting to know the jungle much more intimately than being in town. It’s an organic farm project on a huge plot of jungle land by the river, they have an open platform with both queen size beds & bunk beds, with mosquito netting, looking out on the jungle canopy. Beds are $10/night, and meals are also $10 each. There is a private cabana also available, and listed on Booking.com. The food was really fantastic, Elmer the owner prepares the meals over a wood stove and they included a lot of variety and vegetables grown on the farm! There is also amazingly good Wi-Fi, better than a hostel in town I tried first. 

They offer some various tours, but you can also hike by yourself up the river to a waterfall. There is an official night tour ($45) that lasts 3 hours, but if you just stay here you’ll catch the part of the tour that comes to the lodging area, and see tree frogs and a variety of other creatures easily. I loved my stay here and wish I had found it sooner! The one downside is that they have 70+ chickens relatively near the sleeping platform, and even with earplugs the roosters woke me up at 4am. But that’s happened throughout Central America, and waking up with the rainforest around you was really special. 

As an overlander place it’s a bit tricky, because you can’t park directly at it, but for those who like a bit of adventure it’s worth it! It’s possible to park up at the entrance, and then hike down to the lodging. It’s a steep hike that takes about 10 minutes. I was able to safely park my moto at the white house on the hill, which belongs to a family member. Not sure how they’d feel about larger rigs? Google won’t direct you correctly - when it tells you to turn right, instead look for the signs for Rio Agujitas and follow the little road that splits off up the hill. When you see a white house, and a lower driveway with signs, you’re in the right spot! There is another project down the same trail on Google called Treehouse Tentcamp which I think is abandoned now - at the base of the trail cross straight across the river & follow the signs for Rio Agujitas.

name: DHL Agente Autorizado y Curubande Express
description: Here is the place where your package probably will arrive if you ship it to Liberia. We shipped our drone from Honduras to Costa Rica and our package arrived here.

name: Lavandería automática
description: Did one small load at 3500 and dryer same price. Little bit expensive but all Costa Rica is the same. Advantage self wash. Nice if you are doing some repairs on Iveco. No wifi. Card accepted

name: Brakes specialist - the best around
description:
I went to the overlander garage (also on ioverlander) to replace my brake pads when i realised that the disk was damaged. The owner of the overlander garage took me to this place saying they are the best anything brakes related.

They renovated the disk, good as new.

name: Overlander Garage
description:
Fantastic garage for all things that you need to get fixed. We changed our brakes here, Alejandro the owner helped an incredible amount. 

They do welding at a high level.

Very honest.

Highly recommended.

Green gate!

name: Ursa Gas Station
description: Free. Opens 24 hours. Toilets

name: Paradise Pura Vida
description: Cabins & Camping right at the coast. Entrance at the beach. Grassy area, palm trees and a lot of birds. Uncle Willy is the (American) boss . Cabins for rent, tent friendly and very good for parking your van ( look out for the wires at the entrance, we put them up for our 3.05 height)  The tiny bridge is strong enough! There is also a 'swimming' pool. The bathroom is poor (1 old flushing toilet and a cold shower in 1 room). Very friendly en hospitable people. $10US pp/night

name: Jabillo water tap
description: Potable water tap near the soccer field on the main dirt road.

name: Jabillo soccer field
description:
To avoid driving the dirt road in the night, we stopped in the jabillo village and ask if we could park and sleep on the soccer field. The local trainer (Vladimir) confirms it was ok.
You can also park on the kind of parking lot close to the field.
Potable water tap just on the corner and a tienda on the other side of the dirt road.

name: Altitud 1.4
description:
Every kind of car is welcome to come , small and big size. 
Wifi signal. 
110 V Electricity.  Water.
Private Camping Area. Lot of nature around.

name: Paradise Pura Vida
description: Inbetween Tarcoles and Quebrada Ganada, on Playa Pita beach.

name: Tilapias Rio Seco Brisas de la Montana
description: nice place in the mountains direct at the Rio Seco, this is a restaurant but you can stay over night, it costs 20$, is expensive but you have a nice clean pool, cold shower and WC, the meals are good, cold beer and drinks, nice owner, she offered us a short hiking tour along the river

name: Do NOT park here
description:
Do not park at this location, there are plenty of other parking places down the road close to the entrance.

Crooks at this place will flag you down and will tell you that you cannot go any further with your vehicle but that’s false and they will just rip you off. Keep drivong and find a better parking location.

name: free natural clear pool
description: clear river with natural pool. park at the hotel parking lot

name: Colder than the coast
description: Just a offroad street through the mountain with some street parking lots, but because of the heights (400-600m) its 4 degrees colder than the coast

name: Sandra Murillo Camping
description:
Camping place right in front of the beach. You can park your rigs, or just camp with your tent. There is a kitchen with everything you need, showers, WC, electricity.

Very nice local Owners! They barely speak English but very keen to communicate. Spanish is the spoken language.

Prices:
Tent up to 3 persons: 10.000 colones per TENT.
Campervan or motorhomes: 10.000 colones per CAR (if not using kitchen might change to cheaper price) 

Solo travelers with a tent can have a better price depending on the occupancy.

Whatsapp: +506 7270 4075
Sandra Murillo

name: Nature Lodge, Punta Riel Cahuita
description: We found this place on our way to the Cahuita National Park. This place was like heaven for us. Ovi opened this hotel a year ago and offered a spot for campers as well. The place has a pool, restaurant, a warm shower, WC, secured parking, potable water, and Wifi. Can also book a full-day quad tour with Ovi, which was one of the best experiences so far. We drove through the jungle, did river crossings, visited a farm, an indigenous village, a waterfall, ... just Amazing. He offers 1 & 2 hours tours as well. As we booked the tour, we negotiated the price for two people to 15$. To reach the place you find signs on the main road "I love nature", on the right side (coming from Cahuita) you find a small road, that leads to the hotel after 300m, the door is high enough for every vehicle size.

name: Parking with a view near Cerro Amigos
description:
Here you can park near the trail to Cerro Amigos. You have a fantastic view over the trees and valley. The last 200m are steep, but its doable with 2WD and a bit horsepower. Enough space for 4-5 Vans, some spots are flat, some not.
Claro LTE, Liberty 3G (LTE outside). Windy at night.

name: Belen waterfall
description: Small Waterfall with many small pools to cool down. It’s 1000c/person.

description: this is a free and potable water tap, it is part of a small monuments that Acueductos y Alcantarillados (national water supply company) locates in rural towns to be freely used
