description: This is a free and potable water tap, it is part of a small fountain supply that Acueductos y Alcantarillados (national water supply company) locates in rural towns to be freely used. Head to the left hand side of the building “asada” you will see some small steps, and next to this is the tap.

name: Burger - Yellow Bark
description:
Nice burger and other choice (fish, meat, casado) price is ok for the area.
One meal is around 4000-6000c

name: Water tap on the main road
description:
Water tap on the main road
Special adapter needed to plug in

name: Arenal Observatory Lodge
description:
You can buy the day pass for 15$/pers and have access to many trails.
The view on the volcano is beautiful, there is almost nobody on the trails. You have many different trails for all level.
Good alternative to escape the crowd from the NP.
Road is doable for every kind of van/car

name: Lavandero Calle Real
description: They open from 8 am to 7 pm every day. They charge 1500 Colones per kilo. The phone number 26654010.

name: Playa coco Park
description: They have free Wi-Fi. You can access very easy and is beach front in the park. With showers and shadow

name: Park beach front playa coco
description: They have free showers on all beach side. Nice pressure. Perfect to quick shower.

name: Petrol Station
description: Big flat parking area behind the petrol station. Very friendly staff offered the spot for the night to us for free even before we could ask them. Not the quietest place because many trucks around, but really perfect as you come from the border late in the dark as we did because of annoying border procedures out of Nicaragua. Located only ca. 1 km behind the border. Cold shower and toilets, but the small store was closed. Claro Nicaragua signal works still well here.

name: Finca Indigo Monteverde
description: There is a full kitchen, two bathrooms with hot showers, fast internet, hiking trails, gardens and greenhouse, creek and rivers, and a restaurant next door. The owner takes pride and cares a lot about the property. You’ll always be welcomed by the farm animals or the hosts family.

name: Agua Termales Agua Calientes
description:
Warm spring with a nice natural pool right beside the river.
Is well known by locals but as we were there it was really quiet, only two more persons.
Don't expect "hot" springs ;-) but the water is nice (around 30°C estimated) and really clear and if you dig a bit on the floor of the natural pool there is warmer water coming into the pool.
You can sleep on the parking lot, it's really quiet - we drove a bit down and slept right before the bridge in a side way (marked in the app, too.) At night cool and great for escaping the heat of the coast!

name: Side way next to river
description:
A small sideway on the right hand before the bridge (coming from the agua thermales) leads to a dead end where you can camp easily with smaler rigs. Entrance needs some clearance at the moment, but not extreme... Have a look. Otherwise you can park at the parking of the thermal springs. This place is a bit more away of the street, but you hear the vehicles. Anyway there is not much traffic.
Great to escape the heat of the coast :-)!

name: Dr. Alberth Castro
description:
A modern, well fitted veterinary clinic. Dr Alberth Castro is really friendly (with paws and humans ;-)) and really, really helpful.

You need SENASA papers to exit/export your pet out of Costa Rica.  Message ahead of time via WhatsApp +506 8894 8600  and you can get your papers the same day.  It's really simple, because the second vet with the Senasa papers is right beside the clinic. It's really uncomplicated here and for a good price! We got everything for 70'000colones.

Highly recommended to get here the paperwork done.
Well fitted pharmacy, too, if you need to fill up your pet medications.

Text or call before, because both vets are going to farms, too and are not always around. Spanish is better, but speaks quite good English.

name: Beach front free lots
Playa Junquillal
description: Nice wild camping right on the beach, full super, very safe, turtles, etc. No services.

name: Canto del Río; Cloudforest Reserva Paradise
description:
This little Paradise is really a gem in Costa Rica! Erwin and his Wife running a New Ecolodge Hotel in the Cloudforest and let us camp in front of the House. very secure. Brother Henry lives on the property and will help you if you need something.
Very friendly and welcoming people. They have beatiful trails at the river and in the Cloudforest on their property. They will love to welcome more travellers and campers and want to build a campingplace with more amnenities soon. Street to here doable in every Car. Big Rigs no Problem. Saw a lot of beautiful Birds and Animals. Erwin knows a lot about them and showed us around. Better than every Nationalparc. they also offer beautiful Rooms with including meals if you ask. Call Erwin before and PLEASE donate such awesome places; +506 8885 4031. Protect the Cloudforest...

name: Cloudforest
description: Beautiful and free Trails in the Cloudforest (please ask in the Hotel)

name: Casa Copey
description:
Coffee/avocado farm with guest house and campsites for rent. Expansive property with 3 environment options. Under large old-growth forest trees, individual sites amongst the coffee/avocado/banana trees, or riverside. WiFi, showers, cooking facilities all available. Receptive, helpful host can be emailed at CopeyDeDota@gmx.com. Beautiful spacious area in breathtaking mountain countryside. Under rancho roof sleeping for larger groups.
Email Silvia for more info. Spanish& English.
CopeyDeDota@GMX.com for more info. Reservations required.

name: Casa Copey
description:
Coffee/avocado farm with guest house and camp sites for rent. WiFi, showers, cooking facilities all available for a cost. Receptive, helpful host can be emailed at CopeyDeDota@gmx.com. Beautiful spacious area in breathtaking mountain countryside. Under rancho roof sleeping for larger groups.
Email Tomás for more info. Spanish& English.
CopeyDeDota@GMX.com or 
text Tomas' Costa Rican phone number  8669 6440 for more info. Reservations required.

name: No name
description: Super quiet small camp site. With 2 toilets and 2 showers. 30 meters from the river. The owner has a rating compagni. We went rafting with him and hoe crew. Super nice my two sons had a blast.

name: Mangroovy
description:
A really nice, chilled back campground.

Has cold shower (which is warm. In afternoon) and flush toilets.  They have plans to build an outdoor kitchen. But there are grills and few tables and a pool. (Only one is the area.) 

Camping 5000C without pool, 8000C with pool use. Also have different rooms available with or without ac and with or without kitchen. 

Suituated right on the edge of the mangroves you can wildlife watch.  There are Howler monkeys that come in the morning. Number of lizards. Plus varies birds.  

Luisa is lovely, speaks prefect English has traveled a lot around the world.  And can tell you what to do in the area.  Lots of beaches, national parks, diving etc. 

Close to the Nicaragua border. Get place to stop weather heading north or south.

name: ‚Lo Centro Recreativo Los Angeles’
description: Very nice and clean restaurant (3 locations). Nice pool and playground in the water for kids. We liked our break and enjoyed a realy nice meal after crossing the boarder Nica-Costa Rica.

name: Cocoloba Café-Restaurante
description:
Nice Caribbean restaurant with fish and shrimps tacos, ceviche, fish filet and fish burger.
Price a bit pricey but ok for here between 6000-7000c

name: Refuel station
description: Toilets for dumping your cassette toilet and a water faucet with very long hose in the South East córner. We filled with gas and asked them if we could also fill with water. No problem. Free! We filter all our drinking water through our Berkey but it seems most of the tap water in Costa Rica is potable.

name: Gas station
description:
We asked them if we could sleep here one night and at first they the employees said no but the manager said yes. It was perfect for one night. It was free, fresh  and not that noisy. We were a little hide behind an abounded bus from the highway. 
They have also some toilets 
Great 4G claro

name: Samara Beach
description: Very nice and flat spot directly on the wonderful beach which is very good for surfing and swimming. 5 min walking-distance along the beach to the center of the nice little village Samara, 200 m away from Hotel Bahia Beachfront with pricy but excellent food. Some friendly locals come along for surfing during the day. Free, quiet, felt safe and stayed 3 nights.

name: Parqueo gratis
description: Parqueo gratis in La Cruz. Safe and quiet for the night. Just the entrance can be difficult for vehicule with low clearance.

name: Las Cataratas
description: Nice place to sleep if you want to see quetzales, cabanas for rent, fishing place,  colibri garden, and walking trails. we managed to get there with our 24 feet euro RV. 15k colones for a family with 3 children. The place organize tours to see quetzales but you can also go by your own. we took a very good  breakfast for 5k colones pp.

name: iWash Laundromat & Cafe
description: Brandnew laundromat with great washers and driers directly in the centre of Samara. The place also offers free wifi. Pizza, Cafe, Smoothies, fruit bowls and much more during you wait for your laundry. They speak Italian, English, Spanish and German. Hot showers which were under construction when we were there will follow soon. Very nice and helpful staff. Rates are fine also. Highly recommended.

name: BriBri Lodge
description:
This is an indigenous BriBri community, and the lodge is run by a lovely couple named Waldi and Jenny. They have cabañas to sleep in (with running water and electricity, mosquito nets over the beds), and central wi-fi, and run cacao demonstrations and excursions into the mountains. 

Prices are 18,000 colones per night per cabaña, and they typically sleep two, one takes up to four. 

You can leave your vehicle on the other side of the river; there's a parking spot in front of somebody's house (not secured but they said they'd be there looking after it..) - 2000 colones per day for a spot in the sun, 3200 in the shade. A boat across the river sets you back 250 colones each, and a transport to the village 1000 each. 

Lovely experience; Waldi and Jenny were incredibly welcoming and it wassuper interesting to learn about the BriBri culture and traditions.

+506 8716 6371 or info@bribrilodge.com to book, more details on their website.

name: Suretka parking
description: You can leave your vehicle in front of somebody's house here; 2500 colones per day, 3500 if you want a shady spot. Not secured but right in front of the house. Maybe best to take valuables along with you  just in case but it felt safe enough. Not a huge amount of space but you could fit one large vehicle here; I don't get the impression they have tonnes of overlanders.

name: Punta Uva
description: We stayed here for three nights no issues very safe! During the weekend locals played very loud music but beautiful place to stay. There are some restaurants/bars near by. Only Liberty for cell service.

name: Water Supply
description: This is a free and potable water tap, it is part of a small monument that Acueductos y Alcantarillados (national water supply company) locates in rural towns to be freely used

name: Public beach access Santa Teresa
description: It‘s very difficult to find a good spot in Santa Teresa, so we tried this public beach access and found a very good option. Be careful at the entrance if you are higher than 3 m like we are, it’s a little narrow path with trees hanging over, but it works. There are a couple of spots under the trees on the left, but we took the one outside on the right. Directly at the beautiful beach and close to the center of Santa Teresa (does it have a center?!) Many people coming for surfing and hanging around during the day. We didn‘t have any problems with crime or something else, also left our vehicle alone to go out in the evening and stayed 2 great nights. If you are scared, you should know it‘s very dark here at night, not one light close bye. We didn‘t mind.

name: Flor Alvarado Hospedaje
description:
Family home, they rent some rooms, you can camp, stay in your RV, very nice people.

They charged us $20 a room for the night, but you can negotiate or even volunteer. They speak Spanish and a bit of english 

you can contact them +50662724842 or whatsapp +506 6396 0635 Flor

name: Laundry Hostel Sloth
description: We searched in the whole village and this is the cheepest laundry, I'll upload the prices on photos. We washed our esencial stuff by hand though cause it was still too expensive.

name: SENASA Main office (pet export)
description:
2nd step in exporting animal to panama.  come here after you went to vet and they prepared the Certificado de exportacion de caninos y felinos

drive in register with security, they will need your passport, enter building on right, check in with reception, they will take you to the left then down the first hallway to a window.  Give forms to person in the window.  Return to Reception to pay, the code reception needs is C-12.  Pay 17500 colones with card, but they don't accept mastercard.
Return with reciept, give reciept and wait.  Once you have your forms back its off to the final step  . Appostile

name: Department of Authentication (Pet Export)
description:
If you haven't yet, make an appointment, it is required, in general you are booking an appointment for one week from now. (Google apostille costa rica, look for Solicidad de cita),

https://www.rree.go.cr/?sec=servicios&cat=aut enticaciones&cont=734

This is step 3 in exporting a dog/cat to Panama, after getting your vet to complete the Certificado de exportatacion de caninos y felinos (Step 1), and getting it signed at SENASA main office(Step 2), come here on your appointment date and pay around 700 colones and your are done.

name: Termales del Bosque
description: A dozen of pools feeded by natural hot springs, from 30 to 48°C in a wonderful tropical forest. Far from the crowded and noisy ones around La Fortuna. Very cheap moreover comparing to the formers (3000crc/pp). Excellent snacks and cocktails at the small restaurant on the place. Open at night. Great to walk back to the parking through the lighted path in the forest.

name: RV Campground La Guacima
description:
An exceptionally clean and well-maintained campground right on the GAM (close to Juan Santamaria International Airport).  Includes use of bathroom, shower, sink with potable water, average wi-fi connection.
Very safe environment for tourists. Excellent choice for a quick safe night near the airport.
Make sure to call beforehand to book, since there are only 8 parking spaces available. Owner speaks English very well.

name: Natural spring on side of the road
description: We asked a few locals, they all said it is potable.

name: Green River
description: Green rivers Rafting and Kayaking is located into the bed and breakfast site. Very nice people and great tours for rafting and kayak. 75$/adult 60for children and less for both with cash. 15 minutes in car and then 2h30 tour with a break with fruits. Very good company. +506 2766 5274 costaricagreenrivers@gmail.com

name: Swimming Hole
description: Absolutely beautiful spot! Probably only for tent campers. There’s a little pull off where you can park your car and a trail that leads down to the water. There’s another little trail (probably about 10m over a small steep hill) that leads to a flat spot by the water, big enough for 1 tent. Very quiet peaceful night and extremely beautiful. There was a local family here when we first arrived that said camping was fine, but to stay out of view of the road to be safe.

name: Celeste River Camping
description: Absolutely gorgeous spot next to the Celeste river. Decent amount of room for tents or cars. No trash and very quiet night. One of our favorite places so far. There might be room for big rigs (I’m on a bike, so not sure) but it’s worth checking out.

name: Rio Sardinal Pull Out
description: Little pull out with river access. Only for small car, motos, or bicyclists. We camped on the beach, but it’s not super flat. Pretty quiet all night with a little car noise. River is beautiful. A local came by after dark to spearfish but he was super nice. Felt very safe. There’s a steep ledge, so you’d have to park at the top and carry stuff a couple meters to the river.

name: Road 408
description:
Warning this road is suitable for small 4WD only.  In some sections there are step lose rock sections.  You many need to trim trees in some areas. In others the road has been washed out all together.
Only do on large bike if you are supper experience at off roading.
 There is no service and no vechile on this road you need to be self reliant.

name: La Vieja Adventures Parking
description:
Flat parking area in front of La Vieja Adventures premises. Owners are very friendly, speak english and allowed us to use their clean bathroom. 
Quiet and secure place with houses around. Main road is at 100m but traffic is not that high and stops during the night. Superb view on hills.
We went with them for a wonderful hike in the canyon.

name: Bijagua Ranas
description: The best place to do tours to watch sloths and crogs with guide. Price 25$ per person, including tipical lunch and overnight for free, if you make the tour. It has a big flat place, good for big rigs. With bathroom, wifi, pet friendly. Staff incredibly very very friendly.

name: Om cafe
description:
Lovely veggie/vegan cafe with excellent food, coffee and friendly owner. Super calm atmosphere in a beautiful space, we could have stayed there all day! 

Owner was excited to see bike tourists and made us feel a little special. She indicated that camping by the river in this little village would be easy, so you could ask for more advice on that. Nice big parking lot for anyone in a vehicle.

name: Playa Punta Uva
description: Calm and peaceful beach. Great spot to spend the night. Safe. Great places to camp with Campervan. On the day we camped, there were people camping in Kombi and others with tents. Police always present. Place to take a bath, nearby. We pay 1k colones per person. I recommend without a doubt. Costa Rica is “Pura Vida” without a doubt.

name: City Mall Car Park
description: Underground safe car park for vehicles up to 3m high. Video monitoring and guards on bicycles. Inspection of your van when you let it at office situated on level -1 row G. (open H24). 8000 col./24h. Not the cheapest but safe and sheltered. And shopping mall just over with taxi station to go to airport (2000 col.)

name: Water in the park
description: Water spigot in the park - right in front of the church. We asked locals and they said it was potable.

name: Auto Transmissiones San Francisco
description:
Specialist in auto transmissions, including for north American vehicles - I went in when mine got too stiff to use; they were busy (generally a good sign) but made a date for a couple of days later - took it apart, identified a rusted cable as the culprit, and had it greased up and back to fully functional in a matter of minutes, for 20,000 colones. Happy to recommend them. 
Access is a right angle turn into quite a narrow and partly obscured passageway, and the sign is only visible from the same side of the road, so not easy to find if coming the other way. 

Call Mauricio on 8772 1149; details in the photo.

name: Beside the road
description: This dirt pull off worked in a pinch when our truck broke down. We stayed overnight and no one said a thing, only friendly toots. It has a beautiful view actually even if close to the road. We've had worse places and there many other spots along this stretch for a quick overnight.

name: Soda y Restaurante La Cosecha
description: Wow! So delicious and affordable. Typical Tico food with lots of options, vegetarian options, good service, English menu. 3800C for all types of Casado plates that include real fruit juice drinks. Big portions. Parking on street easy by using app on signs and paying 340C per half hour. Also paid parking lots around.

name: Mirador El Miro
description:
Short trail of 800m or so to an interesting ruined building covered in paintings, with a view out over the coast. Takes you through the jungle; I went for sunset and saw lizards, monkeys, motmots, lots of toucans.. A few other people mooching around taking in the view and walking dogs.

This point is a hotel at the start of the trail; drivable to here but there's nowhere really to park and turning is tricky. Instead park at the little shady carpark by the main road, or on a side street below. You may or may not be asked for 2000 colones to enter, depending on whether there's anybody around. Watch out for mountain bikers descending at speed.  Nice little excursion!

name: Finca Los Cerros
description:
Finca Los Cerros is a box glamping located on the route through Monteverde. 
The property is very private and secure. The view to the hills San Jose and Pelado is amazing. There is also enough space for camping. CR number: +50687075755

name: BIN B&B
description: Nice and clean Hostel, also private rooms available. Oscar is a very nice guy trying to help out. Paid 27$ for a double bed room (only available at that moment). Shared kitchen and shared bathroom. Has a garage for 2 cars but no rigs. Also let me park my bike there for my 2 weeks absence. No hostal vibes but clean and good Wi-Fi. Recommended

name: Coloña Palmareña
description: Only camping acces for explorador and observation fona naturales

name: Taller LM
description:
Super friendly guy who took hours out of his day for a nominal fee to sort out a faulty window mechanism for me. General mechanic who works fast, and has lots of kit lots of ingenuity for solving awkward problems in innovative ways. Recommended! 

Call Luís on 6489 7296. 1.5 kms of so-so road to get here.

name: Pullout Beside the Road
description:
Not really a destination, but we camped here after attempting to drive 408 east to west. We turned around a few KM to the west of here. It was getting late so we camped in this nice little spot on a switch back. 

Beware, the road to the west of here is only for small, serious 4WD rigs. Much more a 4WD trail than an overland route.

name: Ximena's Place
description:
A 10 min drive from the beach and the main road, Ximena's place is surrounded with nature and animals. We live off-grid. It's peaceful, quiet and safe and we want to keep it this way. :) 

Check-in before 2pm. 

Access can be a bit tricky for 2WD cars, there is no problem for 4WD.  

The price depends on amenities you want to use (wifi, kitchen, bathroom, laundry etc.)
Contact us on WhatsApp if you have questions or want to stay at our place +41 76 404 42 66

name: El Cantano Falls
description: Great little spot on the river with 9m waterfall. Swim if you want to. Secure parking at the restaurant for $4 per person. Steep climb down to get here and up to get out, but not far.  Water was pretty muddy when we were here because of heavy rain last night.

name: Hike to La Leona Ranger Station
description: This is the actual spot where you should park and pay 3000col to the guy to watch your car for the day to hike to La Leona Ranger Station (BY DONATION). A few palapas and hammocks, drive across the airstrip to get there. He is also selling coconuts and cold drinks sometimes.

name: Cabinas Vista lago
description: It is a place where there are rooms for rent but allow parking and offer laundry services Community kitchen

name: Panama to Costa Rica
description:
After stamping out in Panama I had to walk around to the Costa Rica immigration marked here (I’m travelling on foot). 

The time in Costa Rica is 1hr behind Panama so I had to wait half an hour for them to open at 9am(p):8am(cr). 

They only asked for: my passport, reason for travel, entended time in Costa Rica, and first known address. 

I’m travelling with a dog so I then went to the next building, customs, where they also asked about fruits etc. They didn’t worry about going through my pack. 

DOGS: I gave them photocopies of the health certificate and MIDA form (mida.gob.pa - siterpa) that I had filled out online and went to receive in David. I wasn’t charged any money here. The online application for the MIDA form is $10. For that I had to upload the certificate of salud, passport etc. 

I crossed on a Tuesday morning and there was no one else here. For both exit and entry, waiting and lots of chatting on either side, it took less than 90mins.

name: Parking behind Patagonia Del Mar Restaurant
description:
Another traveler friend of ours recommended this place. They asked to sleep in the parking lot next to Patagonia Del Mar Restaurant. We did the same and it worked. They didn't charge anything. But out of courtesy we had dinner there. Delicious food, best Poke I've ever had in my life. And their empanada looks like pastel de boteco Brasil. delight. Expensive like everything else in Costa Rica but wonderful! The next day, the motorhome was parked there and we went to Concha beach a short walk away. we recommend No water, electricity or other facilities.

Outro viajante amigo nosso indicou esse local. Eles pediram pra dormir no estacionamento ao lado do Restaurante Patagônia Del Mar. Nós fizemos o mesmo e deu certo. Não cobraram nada. Mas por cortesia nós jantamos lá. Uma comida deliciosa melhor Poke que já comi na vida. E a empanada deles parece o pastel de boteco Brasil. delícia. Caro como tudo na Costa Rica mas maravilhoso! No dia seguinte, o motorhome ficou estacionado lá e fomos à praia conchal a uma curta caminhada. recomendamos Sem água, eletricidade ou outras facilidades.

name: Iglesia de Jabillos
description:
CYCLISTS: the people who run the church are very happy to allow campers to set up their tent under the roof of their communal area. 

There is a toilet, running water lights and power points. It’s elevated off the street and there are no street lights beaming in or barking dogs so you can sleep well here. 

If you ask at the first shop as you approach this location (the smaller shop), Iris will be able to call her friend to ask permission for you. 

Kitchen: there is a kitchen but it was locked while I was here. If you ask they might open it for you. 

CARS: There is a lot of flat space near by this town is chill and very friendly.

name: Do not stay here!
description: Attention, people grab through the window here at night and valuables are stolen.  They even stole all the stickers on our car.

name: Basketball Field
description: Spigot with potable water next to the basketball field. Could probably attach a hose with the right adapter.

name: Oban Service
description:
Allan is a General Mechanic and above all he likes to receive and meet travelers. very good person and professional in his service.
Contact +506 87604630 (WhatsApp)

_______________________

Allan es Mecánico general y sobre todo le gusta recibir y conocer viajeros. muy buena persona y profesional en su servicio. 
Contacto +506 87604630(WhatsApp)

name: Liberia Library
description: Shaded street parking, library open M-F, 1000-1800, has free fast WIFI, network is Zii_para_todos, no password need, on 24/7.  Park on side street for best outside signal.  Very little traffic after 1900.  Library has free outside water tap.  Public gym next door has free water and showers.  3 large food stores within several blocks.  2 block west and 2 blocks north is JSM fuel station, which has cheap diesel, gasoline, and propane.

name: Mi Ranchito
description: A very well put together soda with with very cheap meals. 2000 for breakfast and 3000 for lunch. Food was very good and staff was kind. Located just out of Tamorindo off the side of the road.

name: Little Paradise
description: Great place, we stayed here 3 nights and loved it here. Great views of the lake, beautiful birds, and howler monkeys. Very nice Germán owners and their son Pepe.

name: El Jardin
description: Cafe, gift (40+ Costa Rica stickers), mini mart, and free showers (at rear of plaza).  Park over night near road.

name: La Isla Restaurante
description: Very tasty restaurant. We tried pescado casado and chuleta casado. Very good for 4000 colones each. Good quantity and quality. Quiet spot.

name: Beach - Robbery
description: We slept here one night without problems. The second night, when we put our kids to sleep, two armed men with manchetes robbed us. They used the manchetes to threaten us and demanded money. We gave them what we had and they left. Because of the hard noises of the crashing waves, we were completely surprised by them. Please be cautious and do not camp here.

name: Zoo centro de rescate la marina
description:
We stayed in the parking lot of the rescue center. We asked the zoo manager for permission, the super friendly and attentive girl. Safe place is in front of the service station. I felt very safe. Little bit of road noise, but nothing over the top.
----------
Nos quemos en el estacionamiento del centro de rescate. Pedimos permiso a la encargada del zoo, la chica super amable y atenta. Lugar seguro queda frente a la estación de servicio.  Me sentí muy segura. poco de ruido de la carretera, pero nada exagerado.

name: Roadside
description: Free, next to T-Intersection, little traffic after 7 pm, no services, view of Arenal volcano, next to blue abandoned building, flat parking for any size rig.

name: Green View Restaurant
description: Great restaurant coming from the boarder with Panama. White towels on the tables say everything. Great food. Very clean toilets.

name: Rancho Camurí
description:
It is a very nice and safe place managed by Lía, she is an excellent person. It has beautiful views of San José and Cartago
Whatsapp: +506 8315-0375

name: Dogmatico Boutique Hotel & Spa
description: We were in an emergency situation and needed to find a place to stay for our dog. The dog hotel proved to be very professional and caring. The dogs are thoroughly checked for all vaccinations and their behavior before acceptance. During the accommodation, we received photos and videos of her every few hours with short rapports, and you also get access to the camera from the playground and room. They also have a vet on site. There are different rooms and no kennels as you know it from animal shelters. Would give our dog again anytime.

name: Road pull out
description:
Rooad pull out, flat area with nice view.
fit 2 small camper or one medium big

name: La Uruca Sports Square
description: Free, quiet, safe, well lit, flat, shaded, street parking.  Very few vehicles use this looped street around the park.  Toilets, trash can, and water faucets available during unique schedule.  Location is half way between airport and downtown, with easy access to freeways.  Area is packed with over 40 new vehicle dealers (motorcycles, autos, and trucks).  Got same day service for my Ford Transit, front brake job and full vehicle inspection for $176 USD!

name: Maxi Palí
description: Grocery store, sells food, dog food, and random goods including clothes and a small camping supply section.

name: Costanera 27 gas station
description: Gas station and truck stop near Caldera. Attendant said we could park here overnight and pointed out marked spaces in corner of lot. Water,  bathrooms, minimart restaurant. we didn't stay but kept as plan B. Noisy as is along main hwy.

name: Clinica Dr. Traube
description: We‘ve got here the export paper for our dog for the flight. It only tooks two days. Paid almost $200  (with pills for the antiparasitante). They also speak english and were very friendly.

name: Paso Canoas for cheap vehicle stuff
description: This border town is where to come for Panamanian prices in Costa Rica. They can order things through from David (place not person!) for the next day if you order it by midday (for Monday if you order on Saturday). Engine battery, for eg, was about $60 USD cheaper here than elsewhere in the country. Cheaper fuel too.

name: Se Alquila Cabaña
description:
Cabin off main road near Catarata del Toro. $35000 colones per night. We planned to inquire about camping in the parking lot of the waterfall but it is closed on Sundays. Came across this place while driving past. Has secure parking behind a gate, smaller rigs could fit. Has kitchen, 4 beds, pet friendly, wifi, and warm showers, good views, unfortunately it is also quite buggy. Best to call Melvin ahead of time on WhatsApp +50688448959
IG: MoraVentures

name: Armed Robbery at Volio Waterfall
description: WARNING. Armed Robbery at the top of the waterfall!!!

name: Punta Uva - Arrecifes
description:
Attention reporting zone of many robberies, in the days that we were here they robbed a motorhome of a Dutch boys at night (they were there and they beat them) and 10 days after that in broad daylight with people they robbed a family in a car they broke the glass. To be careful park close to other travelers and take all the precautions you
---
Atención zona de reporte de muchos robos, en los días que estuvimos acá robaron a un motorhome de un chicos holandeses por la noche (estando ellos y los golpearon) y a los 10 días de eso en pleno día con gente robaron a una familia en un auto les rompieron el vidrio. Para tener cuidado estacionarse cerca de otros viajeros y tener todas las precauciones q

name: Green Macaw Sanctuary
description:
Daily tours at 3pm (to 4pm). 
Best to arrive at 2.30pm. 

10.000C or 20 USD per person in cash. 

They prefer that you have a reservation before, telephone: 8971-1436  
But we just arrived at 2.30pm and could join the tour. 

Before they started the sanctuary, there was only one Macaw left that lived in that area. Now it's around 150 Macaws. 

They live freely and spread out, mostly you just see around 15 Macaws here who like to get some extra food. 

It’s really amazing to see them flying around the jungle. We also were lucky to see Tucans, frogs and a sloth.

name: Gasotica Fonseca Hnos
description:
Lovely cool showers at a service station, hurrah. Friendly staff. No charge. Need to be taller than me to reach the tap, but there's a little wall you can stand on (and we didn't get this far without being able to problem-solve, did we?!). 

No croc-infested rivers for me tonight!

name: overview of the bay
description: On a road to a lodge is a flat enough patch of gravel with a bench. View over the bay and jungle at your back. Other than the lodge no one really uses the road so really quiet and peaceful place. No facilities near, 4x4 required.

name: Chimirol feria
description: Weekly market - fresh local fruit and veg, but also a tonne of homemade goods - amazing cheese, sourdough bread, cinnamon rolls, pizza, kombucha etc etc, plus jewellery and such - big ex-pat community but also locals - and a comedor that looks like it does a cracking local breakfast for 3 or 4k colones. Wednesdays only. Yum!

name: Mirador de Ujurraz
description:
It is a viewpoint where you have, apart from an incredible view, grills, tables, bathroom, games for children and drinking water.
super clean and safely until the closure of the place.
It is open from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. You can't sleep in the parking lot because they put chains on it. But it is an excellent place to spend the day.
A luxury in the middle of the mountain.
Free.
Es un mirador donde tenés, aparte de una vista increíble, parrillas, mesas, baño, juegos para niños y agua potable.
súper limpio y con seguridad hasta el cierre del lugar.
está abierto de 8 a 16hs. No se puede dormir e el estacionamiento xq le ponen cadenas. Pero es un lugar excelente para pasar el día.
Un lujo en el medio de la montaña. 
Gratis.

name: Blackall (for licence plates)
description:
This is the company who print high-quality replicas of licence plates on hard plastic (they're really photographers) - see other point marked with the same name. The company left their original location during the pandemic and now operate from their house, at this location - Residencial Lomas de Curridabat, Curridabat. 

They need advance notice to make up the plates for cost-efficiency reasons, and were unable·to do mine on the same day. Call +506 8375 4873 or email blackallfotografiacr@gmail.com to arrange - I spoke to Miguel's wife, who seemed super friendly (and had excellent English, if required)

It's number 5-A (within a gated community) - no sign ot bell; I stood outside and phone them to get them to open up!

name: Carate
description:
Beautiful spot right along the river with views on the valley and of the ocean.
River is perfect to cool off. Macaws are abundant.
 Drive at the end of the airstrip left onto the riverbed/beach. Turn right upstream (on left river bank) along the vegetation for about 50 meters where you will see the flat spot. Enjoy!

name: Total Laundry
description: Very friendly lady, intrigued by the whole overlanding thing - charged me 6000 colones for around 5kg of laundry (including bedclothes and towel) - and made an exception when I looked slightly desperate and said she'd have it back to me by closing on the same day (I was there at 11am), which she did, folded and all. Would recommend (though parking outside if the 2 parking spots are in use is challenging on the busy road, especially at rush hour!).

name: Victors Turtle Release
description:
Victor Carmora (you can find him on facebook) rescues turtle eggs to release them here. 

We got to know about him at the Campground Swiss Palmgarden nearby. Maybe you can check with them, if there will be a turtle release when you are there. You can also ask Mario at the small kiosk a little up the street (you pass it when you drive here) 

When we were here he released them at 7.40am in the morning.

name: Rio Nuevo river crossing
description:
Open place next to the river in the middle of grazing land with forest nearby.
On a big pebble beach 30 m away from the river crossing. 
No shade.
Before the river crossing coming from Puerto Jiminez.
Good for bird watching.

name: McDonald's
description: Adding as a WiFi spot as clearly they're an awful company with awful morals and don't sell real food or deserve to be called a restaurant.. But they do have free, strong, open-access WiFi that extends to the car park - so hurrah for that!

name: El Pretal
description:
Hostel with both dorm and private rooms. Double private room with AC 35USD. 
Have a secure double garage with entry into hostel, with ample room for 2 cars. Very clean and great communication from owner.

name: Mirador Bahia Salinas
description:
Very big flat parking. Any size vehicle can enter. Just few hundred meters from La Cruz. 
Nice view over the bay. Garbage cans all around. Some people came to watch sunset. Came on a Monday, nobody with loud music or making noise. Pretty quiet, felt safe.

name: Water Supply
description:
Free potable water tap, it is part of a small project that Acueductos y Alcantarillados (national water supply company) locates in rural towns to be freely used.
you might need pliers.

name: Water Supply
description: this is a free and potable water tap, it is part of a small monuments that Acueductos y Alcantarillados (national water supply company) locates in rural towns to be freely used

description: this is a free and potable water tap, it is part of a small monuments that Acueductos y Alcantarillados (national water supply company) locates in rural towns to be freely used

name: Soda Curubanda restaurant
description: Flat sizeable hard compact gravel carpark of a restaurant. Permitted to stay here after eating at restaurant. Restaurant food is below average but reasonably priced. No trees. Wifi available depending where in carpark you are. Toilet available when restaurant is open. reasonably quiet at night except a few dogs barking intermittently.

name: Playa Esterillo Este
description:
quiet spot on the beach,
drive to the end of the road and turn onto the beach.
small stream nearby to cool off.
all along the dirt road are houses and accommodation.

name: Agua Ultra Purificada @ Walmart
description: Purified water refill station inside Walmart. It isn’t super cheap, but if you’re someone who is careful about the water quality, then this is the place to go. See picture for prices.

name: Hotel Díria
description:
Perfect hotel in Santa Cruz. Clean, spacious rooms and a nice garden with huge iguanas and a swimmingpool. Wifi is very good. Two big supermarkets next door and some restaurants. We paid $44 for a double room including breakfast. 
Our bikes got their own room for free. ;-)

name: river cross
description:
Flat place near the river. wonderful for one or two vehicles.
---
Endroit plat près de la rivière. magnifique pour un ou deux véhicules.

name: right in front of Playa
description:
small access to the beach for a vehicle near the road but not too noisy. quiet, uncrowded beach.
---
petite accès vers la plage pour un véhicule près de la route mais pas trop bruillant. plage tranquille, non achalandée.

name: Street parking near Pricesmart
description:
We pulled in to one of the parking spaces along this quiet ( after 6 pm ) and well manicured road after being asked to leave the Hilton Hotel parking lot just up the street. The Hilton was going to let us stay only if we paid $45 USD for the privilege. 
We had a quiet and safe night but traffic does start up again very early. (6 am) It’s good for one night especially if you are putting your vehicle into storage at the Almacén Fiscal just up the road a short ways. Perhaps we could have parked at the Pricemart as well but this spot was nicer. 
The cutaway spots along this road are fairly long  so a larger than 25 ft rig might be able to fit but it’s really more suitable for a van sized rig.

name: Clínica Veterinaria Fortuna
description:
Place to get your pets health certificate stamped by SENASA. Can take a few hours or days because the paperwork is delivered to the SENASA office near San Jose and returned. $60 for health certificate + $40 for delivery fee for a total of $100. I came on a Friday afternoon and it got sent out the morning the next work day (Tuesday due to a holiday) and I picked it up Tuesday at 1. The veterinarian Gabriella is very nice and speaks good English.

Unfortunately, my health certificate was not stamped due to the destination being Nicaragua and presently there is a ban on animals entering Nicaragua. I was refunded my $60 for the certificate but was not refunded the delivery fee.

name: park entrance
description:
shaded place at the park entrance
in the forest
good cellular reception

note: currently the park is closed on Wednesday
entrance only with reservation

name: Airbnb Tropical comfort tours
description:
This was a great stop for us to rest while we packed up our van to get it ready for storage at the Almacén Fiscal which is just up the road. 
There’s A/C a small kitchen and room for 3 people to sleep. It’s right on the highway so a little noisy but very convenient and very very clean. There’s room to park our front and area is secured by a gate. 
Look for on Airbnb

name: Jardin De Permacultura Aguila
description:
Cabins surrounded by green jungle, here you can see sloths, tucans and many other birds.
The wonder has a bigger cabin for families and a smaller one for a couple. The beds have mosquito nets.

name: Rocky Beach wildcamp
description: nice spot on rocky beach. there is enough space to park for several cars. we stayed one night and felt safe. some locals were here at night but did not bother. there was a lot of birds and we woke up to a monkey concert in the morning. it's a bit of a rocky, dirty road to get there. so maybe check first if doable with your car.

name: Polideportivo de Cartago
description: free shower at Polideportivo de Cartago in the Piscina (swimming pool). Large room with 6 showers (mens) so no privacy and freezing cold water but free (; opens 8am Sunday not sure other days, toilet available too

name: Santa Maria Nightwalk Camping
description: There ia a campground next to the night walk reception. you can get one free night of camping if you do the night tour. tour costs 30 dollara p.p. only camping is 10 dollar p.p. per night. the night tour was pretty cool. also perfect with the tent, so we were ready to sleep after the tour. it has a shower and two toilets on site. also an area where you can cook and eat. you can park under a roof. quite helpful if it rains.

name: Parqueo publico
description:
quiet place, around 100 meters from the beach. only 2000 colones per day ( 4 usd) 
super secure, super family, good spot for surfing.

name: Theft civic centre de la paz
description: We were parked near the civic centre de la paz and briefly left our car unlocked while we were inside our truck camper, we felt the car move and as we go out he was already on his bike speeding away with a backpack of mine with my gopro inside and other things :( tried to chase but he was too quick.. watch out!

name: Limonal Gas Station
description: this is a parking lot behind the gas station where you can stay a night, there are restrooms and small coffee shop.

name: Rivercamp
description: Very scenic spot next to a river. In two days staying here, saw two fisherman. Absolutely peaceful next to a clean river. Its a 15 meter gravel road leading to the river, driveable for any type of vehicle. Good cell reception with claro.

name: Pollo Frito La Casona
description: Best Fried Chicken Restaurant around, french fries, cold beer and more,  restrooms and showers, prices around $10 - $15

name: La Casona Camping
description: Parking lot with restrooms, showers and next to a small fried chicken restaurant, you can also rent showers or restrooms.

name: Rio Montaña (Ostional)
description:
nice open areas near the river crossing
Immediately south of the river crossing is a dirt road to the west that brings you to higher ground.
Alternatively when water level allows, nice areas in the riverbed itself.
Intermediate cellular reception.

name: Punta Bejuco
description:
Place for 2 véhicules
Shaded place.
Difficult for big rigs

name: BM Supermarket
description: We asked the staff and we're allowed to fill our tank at the tap next to the bathroom.

name: Water Supply
description: this is a free and potable water tap, it is part of a small monuments that Acueductos y Alcantarillados (national water supply company) locates in rural towns to be freely used

name: Camping y piscina donde Fran
description:
Nice place with pool, with small car you can enter their place and stay next to the pool. Bigger cars as ours can park outside with direct Connection to the gardenwith a lot of Fruit trees, Pool, Kirchen, bathroom, WiFi etc

Check on google

name: BCR - US Dollar and colones
description:
BCR (no fees) with a parking lot in front. 
We got our US Dollars here for the shipping in Panama.

name: Zona Zen
description:
What a beauty! Although not really organised to receive rooftop campers. But ... there are options. First of all there is space for one car at the end of the track to the campsite. Along this track in s bend about 80 m down from the facilities is another her possible area to put your car. Second the owner can lend you a small tent to use under one of the covered platforms.

There are 2 small pools (2 shallow, one deeper), cooking area (no gas), basic but clean shower and toilet, pick nick tables, sockets to charge, view point.

It's a bit difficult to find since there are no signs. Check Google Maps for directions ,(and more pictures) or give Miguel a call 72900790

Good cellular reception.

name: Very steep decline!
description: This is the road coming from the south to get to the bajos del toro waterfalls.. very steep decline!! make sure you have a vehicle with very good brakes.. ours were smoking once we got to the bottom and managed to pull over .. eeek! go from the north its much easier!!

name: San Ramon
description:
Wash all the clothes for $10.
Washer and dryer.
Contact by WhatsApp +506 87269290
.....
Lavar toda la ropa de las personas y la ropa de la motorhome por $10
Lavadora y secadora
Contacto por WhatsApp +506 87269290

name: Cabinas Buenos Aires
description: This place is like a budget hotel that allows overlanders too. We stayed in our truck camper 3.4m high, probably 4m height limit. we are 7.5m long, not much longer will fit. Louis the owner opened up a vacant cabana right next to where we parked for us to use toilet and shower. It seemed a quiet night for his business. there's wifi as well. gravel parking no grass. told we can pay "poco dinero". louis has very limited english but friendly man. we gave 6000 colones for 2 people. scenery is not great but secure and good for 1 night. little bit noisy at night but nothing too unbearable. owner has 3 Chihuahuas.

name: Big Strawberry water tap
description: Behind the big strawberry sculpture there is a water tap with potable water. Easy to park, it’s in front of a small stadium.

name: Tiquisia Lodge Curubande
description: Hotel $43/night for double room. Hot water, no a/c, fan, common area with fridge. They have a huge grassy space in the back and said they do offer camping but I’m not sure how much it cost.

name: Soda Shey Restaurant
description: The best Tortillas of Paso Canoas! Good regional food! Good prices!

name: Air Time Zip-line adventure
description: Zipline on 9 cables, English and Spanish spoken, very safe and professional guides

name: Alojamiento Don Gabriel
description:
Very nice campsite run by very nice people. You will find a large space to put your tent/van. Showers, toilets, spaces for cooking. But also 2 large swimming pools. On weekends you can enjoy the bar and meal service. night: 10,000 columns (for 2 and a tent car) beer: 1200 columns breakfast: 2500 columns. The road to get here is ok. We saw lots of macaws and squirrel monkeys. There is a great terrace to enjoy the view of the jungle.
.....
Tres joli camping tenu par  des tres belles personnes. Vous y trouverez un grand espace pour poser votre tente/van.. Des douches, toilettes, espaces pour cuisiner. Mais aussi 2 grandes piscines. Le weekend vous pourrez profiter du service de bar et de repas.
nuit : 10000 colonnes (pour 2 et une voiture tente) 
bière : 1200 colonnes 
petit déjeuner : 2500 colonnes. 
La route pour venir est plutôt ok. 
Nous avons vu beaucoup d' aras et des singes écureuils.
Il y a une super terrasse pour profiter de la vue sur la jungle.

name: Servicentro Cerro Cortes
description:
We parked here to cook our lunch; didn’t sleep here, but I think it’s a good option. Looks safe and a lot of trucks are here.
.....
Paramos acá para cocinar. No dormimos acá, pero se ve un buen lugar para dormir; parece seguro, con muchos camiones.

name: Montana Rio Camping
description:
These private campsites are river side.  They offer star tents (clear inflatable tents for star gazing) for an additional fee. Campers will have access to a shower, toilet, and camp kitchen situated in a 100 year-old cabin.  The riverfront beach access features a large fire pit and deep swimming hole. There are trails throughout the property and easy access to a local trout restaurant. The river offers excellent fishing opportunities.
There is wi-fi access and excellent cell signal at most of the sites. This is hike-in camping, but not far. Maximum hike in is 100 yards.

name: Hush Valley Lodge
description:
Six amazing houses for rent on 38 acres bordered by the Rio Blanco river. Seven trout ponds, organic gardens, hot water, showers, kitchens, and intense beauty Hush Valley has to offer. 
Upon checking in you're given fresh baked bread, jam, butter, coffee, tea, and eggs. There's also organic body wash, and shampoo in the bathrooms. 
Meal delivery is available to each casita. 
Cell phone signal is good. Starlink sattelite wi-fi.

name: Wild camp
description: Perfect spot for sleeping. Alone. Hiking trails

name: Tropical Paradise
description: By driving north from Pavones I found this gem. Definetely the best spot of all the region, we spent 3 days and there were just 3 people walking by in total. It has a fire pit, palm trees for shade but able to get solar, a river without crocs and a wave to surf from mid to high tide. The entry is by the bridge. 9 out of 10 because it has  a limitation of ~2.5m due branches. Enioy this little paradise!

name: Soda Y Rancho Doña Irma
description: Down to earth place to grab something to eat. Very reasonable prices and good food. We would recommend the Casado de pescado. Payment by card is possible.

name: Gasolinera Katira
description:
One of the few gas stations in this area. Has Diesel and gasoline.

They can also do an oil change or fix a flat.

name: Relax house Potrero/ Casa Relax
description:
Economic basic small hostel and definitely the cheapest place to stay in town. It has a dorm with 3 bunkbeds and a sufficient equipped kitchen to use. The owner lives in the next room. Not the cleanest place ever, but a good place to stay and check out the beautiful beaches. 

There is big lawn, so you can camp there. I would call or text first for that.

The owner Walter is a nice guy, his number is +50683371472

I booked via airbnb for 17/18 dollars a night.

name: La Montañita
description:
No frills buffet-style restaurant. Very popular with locals/truckers. 

Quick service and very affordable. Paid 5000 for two without drinks.

name: Hotel and mini super Guacamayas
description:
Apparently this is the cheapest hotel in town, room without air conditioning. It was full so I couldn’t stay here.

I don’t know the actual price. But someone told me it is around 8000 or 9000.

name: Exchange Colons - Dollars
description:
Exchange on the same small building where you pay the taxes to exit Panama. 

Easy to find because of the big Claro sign on top of it.

Not a great exchange rate.

name: EMESA gas station
description:
We stayed here for one night after crossing the border. We asked and they let us stay without paying any, and use their bathrooms. They just told us to leave early in the morning because a store in the parking opens between 6 a 7am. We woke up an leave 6:30 but the store was still close. Felt safe and could sleep week, but a noisy night. 
You can connect to WiFi crossing the street on the McDonald's, it is an open wifi

name: El mercadito
description:
We park on the street, in front of El Mercadito, it’s a huge market with a lot of restaurants from different countries and also have Wi-Fi.
It’s a good option to leave the car and go to the beach; because there is movement all the day.
We slept one night here, was quiet, the street was empty but with light.

Paramos en la calle, enfrente de El Mercadito, un lugar que tiene muchos restaurantes de diferentes países y también tiene wifi.
Es una buena opción para dejar el vehículo e ir a la playa, porque hay mucho movimiento todo el día.
Dormimos una noche acá, estuvo tranquilo, aunque la calle quedó completamente vacía, pero iluminada.

name: Maxi Pali agua purificada
description:
potable water in maxi pali
1L - 650 C
2L - 850C
6L - 1400C
20L - 2700C

name: Intervet
description:
We filled out the documents for our dog to cross the border into Nicaragua at this vet, they took care of everything, checking and writing down the vaccine and deworming data and they themselves did the process at Senasa on the same day
Super recommended, super friendly. The process cost us 60 thousand colones
opening hours from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m.
--
Hicimos en esta veterinaria los documentos para cruzar la frontera a Nicaragua de nuestra perrita, ellos se encargaron de todo de chequear y anotar los datos de vacunas y desparacitacion y ellos mismos hicieron el tramite en Senasa en el mismo día 
super recomendables, super amigables. el tramite nos costó 60mil colones 
horario de atención de 8 am a 7 pm

name: Pochote beach
description: wild camping, some shade, no facilities, beautiful place. The beach not the best to swim... rocky bottom. Space for some cars and tents, easy aces

name: Rafting Adrenalina + Camping
description: We came across this guy on the street, we were looking for a rafting company and he offered us his place where we could sleep a day before and after. They have better prices than other companies and camping was totally free. Has toilets, showers and kitchen and tons of fireflies! Great place, very nice people, pure pura vida here.

name: Posada del Mar (Puntarenas)
description:
The cheapest place I found online. It’s very simple and basic and not the best maintained place. But just if you need an economic place to stay for a night. 

The Spanish owner is kind and helpful.

It’s not well isolated but I was the only guest and slept well here. The room had a ventilator. The WiFi was pretty decent, enough to work or watch Netflix.

It has private rooms for around 20dollar, 12.000 colones. Probably I could save a dollar if I had booked online.

There’s is a communal kitchen, but no stove. But some electrical devices you could use for cooking. The kitchen had a washing machine you can use for free.

Street parking for cars. I put my bicycle in the room upstairs. But there was a option available downstairs.

name: Hostel Luminosa Uvita
description:
Nice surf hostel with great atmosphere and big jungle garden. You might camp here, but I didn’t ask about it. It’s clean and they offer activities like yoga.

Dorms cost  10 dollars a night (August 2023), but they might do discounts online trough Hostelworld or Booking. The dorm had several ventilators.

I parked my bicycle outside under a roof and locked it to something. There was a security camera there.

WhatsApp of the hostel: +50683140690

name: Next to the Church
description: Big roof with water acces and electricity. The church has a fence but few gaps to go in. good for one night for cyclist.

name: Sloths tour
description: A really nice place to learn more about sloths but also frogs, plants and much more ! José is a really nice person, very interesting and he know a lot about plants and animals ! We did a tour with him during 2h30 in the forest and we saw 5 sloths, Toucans, frogs, monkeys…It’s 5000 COL per person. Very worth it ! We saw a large variety of birds in his garden, very beautiful. We saw a lot of animals in 2 days !  We recommend !

name: Amelias hotel
description:
$50 per a room with 2 double beds and one single (we are a family of 4) very clean with private bathroom (hot water), AC, fan, fridge and sea views! 
also they have a shared kitchen, swimming pool and parking that allows entry any truck (not sure the high restriction but something around 3,5 meters). Good value for the price. awesome sunsets

name: Baldo Resort
description: We get a special price with a tour agency for a day pass with one food (all you can eat), we spent the hole day in the resort, it is so beautiful and relaxing, they have a lot of hot springs with different temperatures, water slides and even a kids area,  and they let us stay the night for no extra money, in their parking just across the road, we felt super safe as we park in front of the guard, they let us use the toilets at night and in the morning. We pay 50USD per person, regular price is 44 without food, but you can go to a tout agency and they will give you a discount, yes, it is a little expensive but just as all the place. And if you are looking to have a luxury hotsprings experience this is an amazing option, you stay all day in the resort (day pass is from 9am to 10pm), you can go in and out with no problem, you have a really good/big meal, you take a shower at the end and you spend a safe night. Totally worth it.

name: Sunset Inn Arenal Park
description: Great, great view of the volcano Arenal and the lake, in a small hill in the jungle. The owner is the man who gave the name to El Castillo. Good place with basic ammenities

name: Water Supply
description: this is a free and potable water tap, it is part of a small monuments that Acueductos y Alcantarillados (national water supply company) locates in rural towns to be used no charge

name: Water Supply
description: this is a free and potable water tap, it is part of a small monuments that Acueductos y Alcantarillados (national water supply company) locates in rural towns to be used no charge

name: Don Juan
description:
Big parking lot for trucks. 
We stayed here a few nights because of visa issues. We could park our van under a big roof right in front of the security. We felt very welcoming and safe. There is basic toilets and showers + wifi. 
Nice and friendly owner and staff. 
Paid 4$ for 24 hour parking. 
It’s a little bit outside of the busy border. 
Can still get sometimes noisy because of the big trucks moving in and out.

name: Expert Crossing Rivers
description: tourist information center for all routes of the Nicoya peninsula, free information and assistance for tourists.tourt guide: Erickson Daiz

name: Rolling Waves Coffee
description:
An amazing specialty coffee shop with 8-11 different varieties of beans to choose from. A 'must' stop if you need some more high-quality beans. Jesús is one of the most knowledgeable baristas I have ever met and really cares about growing the specialty movement in Costa Rica. 
Hours: 7am-1pm, 4pm-7:30pm, not open on Mondays

name: Ruinas Iglesia NS de Ujarras
description: Came from park of Quetzals to North and avoiding San José. I slept here.  Very quiet and safe place with night guard. The park is small but is beautiful with flowers, birds (early) and butterflies. FREE. Pets only outside the park. Slept outside in a parking lot.

name: police station
description: in front Police Station. After 22:00 very quiet. Safe

name: Bajos Del Toro
description: had to stop because heavy rain. Very quiet night and safe.

name: Camping El Cerro
description:
Camping El Cerro is located in the Mountains South/Central of Costa Rica 400mts off the Panamerican highway. This is a family and locally owned business and we live on the property to assure a personalized service.

Please contact us by phone or WhatsApp +(506)8831-9669 before arrival. Our place is accessible with 4x4 vehicles only. From the main road is a green gate that is often closed but not locked, then 400mts gravel road to a wooden gate at the campsite.

The Campside contains a B&Q with picnic tables and cooking area and a flushing toilet available to use for all guests, the ranch has lights and electricity 120v. The campsite has beautiful gardens and small trails to walk around the 1.5 hectares. We are located near various hidden tourist attractions. Perfect for photography and birdwatching.

There is capacity for 6 4x4 vehicles and 2 campers Vans or a total of 10 Full SUV size vehicles. We have two friendly dogs.

We have good cellphone signal from Kolby which is the main comunication provider in CR.

name: Free Wifi
description: Free fast wifi

name: Zoe Libreria
description:
to do copies. link to get TIP. closes at 12:00 til 13:00
 https://aduanas.hacienda.go.cr/tica/web/hdsconvehds.aspx

name: Lancha from Puerto Jiménez to Golfito
description:
Small lancha that can take passengers and bicycles to Golfito. Price was 5500 total (3500 for passenger, 2000 for bicycle). 37 seats on the boat and it could get full so recommend arriving a bit early. Probably can take up to 2 bicycles at once. 
Departure time from Puerto Jiménez is as below.

2:00pm

The road to Carate is rough but it is a stunning area! Worth the ride!

description:
Small lancha that can take passengers and bicycles to Puerto Jiménez. Price is 5500 total (3500 for passenger, 2000 for bicycle). 37 seats on the boat and it could get full so recommend arriving a bit early. Probably can take up to 2 bicycles at once.

name: Free Water At Anatot Servicentro
description: Spigot with potable water in the corner of anatot Servicentro. Standard hose connection. We filled up 80L no questions asked. Free!

name: Soldadura Gustavo
description: Gustavo has a welding shop here. I needed my aluminum ladder fixed and he did an amazing job. I highly recommend him if you need some work done. Very fair prices and extremely helpful guy, especially with my limited Spanish vocabulary for tools and construction.

name: Overland Camping At El Nido Lodge
description: El Nido Lodge have a big parking lot where you can camp in your car tent. They have wifi, bathroom, shower and a shared kitchen you can use.

name: River crossing
description: Today (Raining Season) there was 70cm with a little current. Nevertheless the ground is hard. We crossed with a Defender. However, the Calle Paraíso track continuing to the southeast was flooded with large muddy ruts filled with 70 m of water, we did not try and joined route 160.

name: Tertulia de los Roble camping
description: Great place en Naranjo Alajuela , 25 mins del international airport de Santamaría, road to volcano la fortuna , very safe place inside to a coffee Lànd . The place have very good drinking water , toilet and shower and the free Wifi, They have  a little chalet in case it s raining a lot with 4 Tables to sit and 10 chairs . It s Flat land with a  excelente view of the central vállee . 1 hour to Puntarenas , 1,30 hour to Jaco . It s very quiet place , contact 0050686619853 o 0050689191312 juan . 4 000 colones por persona

name: In front of Isla Cabuya
description: Beautiful and quiet location for one night. We were greeted by a group of fifteen macaws, they were superb! They were still there in the morning so there is a good chance that they will nest here. The sunrise is magnificent! We parked behind the parking lot in a small recess close to the sea. There is a fishing hut, so there is a slight smell of fish.

name: Café Haug
description:
Amazing specialty coffee roaster with a restaurant/café on site. Lighter roasts. Different pourover methods. The whole shabang. Smell of coffee roasting fills the beautiful yard as you eat.

The restaurant is really good and has a few vegan options. Price is fair for Costa Rica, about 4000-4500 CRC per meal. The Sat/Sun breakfast options don’t include anything vegan, but the chef made something special for the same price as the other options. 

Walking distance from Finca Las Mercedes… where you should DEFINITELY stay. 

Note: the entry is kind of tight with a height restriction. Not sure how tall exactly.

name: La Ruka Hostel
description:
Nice hostel with a big and secure parking lot for bikes and rigs of any size.

Nice big garden with poison dart frogs and, if you're lucky, sloths, a well stocked kitchen, communal area, ice bath and yoga. place is clean and really friendly, hot and cold showers in the dorms. dorm beds are 13 usd per person during the week and 15 usd on the weekend. (october, prices vary over the year a bit they said)

when we asked, we could have also camped in the backyard in our tent, but as it was really hot we chickened out and splurged on a dorm. We were also told, that camping in the rig might be possible, just depends on the circumstances at the time if it works out or not. So best to just ask ahead of time.

name: Hostel Las Mariposas
description:
Great affordable hostel ($12 pp now for dorm in the off season, may be more expensive peak season). Clean, good wifi, shower, hose for cleaning off bike (we are traveling by bike), kitchen, secure place to put a bicycle, some room for parking medium to small rigs. Board games and nice areas to eat and many hammocks. Easy walk to the beautiful beach and really friendly owners and staff. Highly recommend staying here, they have a laundry service but a cheaper option is right down the street. Walking distance to a Pali and the rest of town. 

I was allowed to tent camp in their garden for $8 pp with access to all amenities in the past, but would be muddy during the rainy season.

name: Catarata Herradura
description: This is the access point to the FREE Waterfall. Really beautiful spot down by the river. We had to kill an afternoon before hiking Chirripo and this was a perfect spot. Best place to park is by the pasture 100m before this point. We made it up in our 2wd sprinter but it was a little sketchy and the turn around was tight.

name: Road by Bodhi Tree
description: this Road right by the Bodhi Tree Yoga Resort is patrolled by guards with Dogs 24/7. The guards rotate in 3 shifts - we talked to a group of guards and they said it’s okay to park here on the road near their parking lot - and that it is safe since they’re walking up and down the road with their guard dogs. MotorbikesAmd quads start passing by as soon as 5:30 am. [.................... Content deleted by admin ....................]

name: Relax Monkey Camping
description:
There are camping tents for rent, showers, restrooms and a parking lot for any truck/car size. The place is quiet and in front of the main road.
The last time I was there, they charged us around 7USD per person per night for camping in our car.

name: Sylvia’s Place
description: One of the few times I had food I genuinely enjoyed in CR. Surprised. it was good and cheapish considering it’s right in front of a popular surf spot. Plates are about 3500.

name: Beachfront. Ostional
description: This little house / advertises “camping” -. The lady running the place works for the national park. The place has room for 3 cars, maybe. We spent the night here sleeping in our 4x4…price for the night was 6000 CRC - for the Car. And you can use the shower and toilet. Wi-Fi is not included in the service- but I am sure for a few extra bucks they’d be happy to share their Wi-Fi.

name: Friendly Mechanic
description:
Friendly mechanic (+friendly family), who repaired our car instantly and for a suprisingly cheap price! He offered us a bedrom, kitchen and bathroom and gave us food and beer as we stayed the night at his Workshop… highly recommended 

Unfortunately forgot to ask for his number..

name: Río Blanco
description: After a few days on the Caribbean coast, this river is very pleasant for desalting and desanding. The water is fresh and transparent and on the right side there is a beautiful natural "pool". Be careful, however, if it rains on the mountains, the level of this river can rise by 1m in 20 minutes (information given by locals). For our part, we parked next to the river during the day and at night we parked safely in a small recess between banana trees 50m after the river. The place is very quiet!

name: police checkpoint
description: they stopped us & just wanted us to open our camper to quickly look inside

name: Meca Rover - Land Rover experts
description:
Family garage specializing in Land Rovers. We spent 4 days with Aarón, José and Kike to completely overhaul the transfer case of our Defender, replacing the ball joint above the rear differential, replacing the drive flanges and replacing the front shock absorber bushings. The whole team is very pleasant, José and Kike speak English very well. They offered us to sleep in the garage, which was very practical for us (there is water, toilets, a fridge, electricity) and bonus being at 1500m it is cool. They are true enthusiasts, very competent and who own a Defender themselves. The huge advantage of Costa Rica is that you can find all the parts you want there, there is no need to order them from the UK and wait 1/2 weeks. For sure the price of parts is higher than in the UK (at least twice as expensive). In terms of labor costs, it is more expensive than in Honduras or Guatemala but it remains reasonable. We highly recommend this great team!

Here are their WhatsApp numbers: +50683467483, +50684270493, +50685285580.
Their Instagram is @meca_rover_cr.

name: Rio grande gas station
description: Not ideal but you can ask and park here 24/7 Gaurd here and bathrooms on site.

name: Combi viajeros
description:
This is the house of Alvarito, he's passionate with the Combi's VW so he can help you with every problems whatever in mechanics or organization, camperization...
He doesn't ask for any money, he's just enjoying meeting people and helping them
This is a great to stay !

name: Last pullout before muddy road
description: We came here with our Defender in the rainy season. The track is very steep but it is covered with pebbles so far. In first low gear and differential blocked it does. After the track is no longer covered with pebbles, and in the rainy season it is too dangerous to continue, we saw a pick-up go down and it slipped. There are several pullout here, so we stopped here and we continued by foot to join the Cerro Amigos trail. We slept here, we are at the edge of the track but there is no traffic at night. If the road is dry and no rain are coming I recommend you to go to the next point, the pullout are better.

name: Cafe Colibri - Hummingbirds watching (FREE)
description: Here is a café and a souvenir shop that have obtained authorization to install feeders for hummingbirds for scientific purposes. Entrance is FREE, there is no obligation to consume (it is written, and nobody will ask you something). You can see 8 different species of hummingbirds, it is a paradise for photographers and bird watchers. Many guides stop here before or after going to the reserve but they stay 10 minutes maximum, finally the place to observe the hummingbirds is not overloaded with people. It is possible to park for free by the roadside, even if places can be scarce because it is also used by visitors to the reserve. I really recommend to come here, I stayed 2h and took lot of pictures!

name: Terra Viva Restaurant
description:
We needed a good lunch after driving the terrible section of highway #4 between La Cruz to La Fortuna. 
We stopped in at Terra Viva and had Osso Bucco! And it was less than $10! The Casado with chicken was delicious too. 
They left a carafe of chilled and filtered water at the table and had lovely piano music playing while we were in the totally open-air space. 
Lots of parking and a nice bathroom as well. 
We won’t need dinner tonight!

name: AYA - Free potable water with hose
description: Here is a public potable water from AYA with an hose. The flow is fast.

name: Planeta Sano Finca Ecológica
description:
Explore the pleasure of traveling and camping at our Planeta Sano Ecological Farm and Educational Center for your stay we bring you a 30%OFF disccount.

We offer you a camping space with secure parking, wifi, bathrooms, immersion in the jungle and the serene river on the property. Live the experience of learning with us in sustainability courses and consider staying longer by participating in our volunteering!

The price to enjoy the campsite is 5,000 colones per night and person if you bring your tent, if you travel by van, the price for sleeping in a safe place is 15.000 colones, (but if you say I´m coming from iOverlander we bring you an offer, 5.000 colones person). For those looking for more comfort, we have two charming fully equipped houses.

We have some activities to learn about permaculture and wellness. 

We look forward to your visit! Contact us at +506.7213.9326 or visit our website www.planetasanocr.org for more details. We'd love to have you!
Instagram: @planetasanocr

If you come at night... PLEASE CALL US BEFORE YOU ARRIVE HERE . THANK YOU, +506.7213.9326. 

Opening: from 7 am to 5 pm.
.....
POR FAVOR, LLÁMANOS ANTES DE VENIR PARA AVISARNOS sobre todo si viene de noche! GRACIAS. +506.7213.9326
Explora el placer de viajar y hacer camping en nuestra Finca Ecológica y Centro Educativo Planeta Sano, le ofrecemos un 30% descuento si pasa la noche aqui.
Te ofrecemos un espacio para acampar con estacionamiento seguro, wifi, baños , inmersión en la selva y el sereno río de la propiedad. ¡Vive la experiencia de aprender con nosotros en cursos de sostenibilidad y considera quedarte más tiempo participando en nuestro voluntariado!

El precio para disfrutar del camping es de 5.000 colones por noche y persona si trae su tienda, y si viaja en vehículo serían 15.000 colones por coche (al dormir entro de él de manera segura) y tenemos una oferta para usted, si nos dice que viene desde iOverlander le dejamos la noche a 5.000 por persona :). Para aquellos que buscan mayor comodidad, contamos con dos encantadoras casitas totalmente equipadas.

Si quiere aprender sobre permacultura y bienestar tenemos cursos para usted!

¡Esperamos tu visita con entusiasmo! Comunícate con nosotros al +506.7213.9326 o visita nuestra página web www.planetasanocr.org para más detalles. ¡Nos encantaría recibirte!
Instagram: @planetasanocr

Nuestro horario es de 7 am a 5 pm

name: official camping by park entrance
description:
nice place. there are toilets and showers. you have to make a reservation at the website:http://serviciosenlineasa.sinac.go.cr
it is the same site where you have to make a reservation for the entrance for the park.

name: Camping Babsita
description: Fantastic campground owned by an amazing host, Barbara. She also has incredible people working for her, and everyone is super inviting and helpful. There are many different options to choose from for camping. Vehicles can park beachfront and there are a few outlets to plug into (extension cords recommended). Tables and hammocks throughout the beachfront side of the property. (5000pp). The main property has a variety of camping options (Ranging from tents to single dwellings that have electricity range from 5000-20,000 /night). Barbara also rents out her very welcoming home for $100US dollars/night. There is a community outdoor kitchen on property with everything you need that is donation based off of what you use. Toilets and showers are cleaned daily and the whole property is well taken care of. Dogs on site that live on property, all of them SUPER friendly and got along with my pup. I usually only stay places one night and move on but I just loved the atmosphere, people, amenities so much that I stayed longer!

name: Living Forest lodge
description:
Came here cycling (3 ppl + dog). Was told that there was nobody since it was low season. We could camp in the garden for 20USD/night for the 3 of us. Stayed 2 nights. Fuuully equiped kitchen+WiFi+clean restrooms+tables+chairs. There was indeed nobody.

Place is beautiful with quiet garden and river surrounding the place. Interesting animals.

The young volunteer lady was helpful.

We enjoyed the place.

name: Close to Rió Savegre
description: There is no great location to sleep in San Gerardo.  We parked here, on the side of the road not far from the Savegre hotel and next to the Rio Savegre. The road being a dead end, there is not much traffic. The night was calm and we were lulled by the river. As a bonus we can capture the WiFi network which is not protected from the hotel! Parking is not level.

name: Trailhead to the waterfalls (FREE)
description: Beautiful walk, FREE, in the middle of the cloud forest to see 2 waterfalls. The walk is on the edge of Los Quetzales National Park. The path is well marked and even in the rainy season it is not too muddy. There are a few places to park (not great for spending the night). The entrance is behind the gate, you have to walk to the fish farm and take the path on the right which follows the river. The path is on Maps.me.
