There are some infrastructures, stairs, ropes and bridges but they date from another period and are in poor condition. The walk is around 4km, it took us around 2 hours. The forest is absolutely superb, and the 2nd waterfall is pretty even if you come out wet.  The rope bridge to access the 2nd waterfall is funny.

name: Lavandería Pura Vida
description:
Open 9 am - 3 pm. Lots of machines but the price is the same for service or self service. 
We paid $9,000 colonies for 5 kg. It’s not cheap but it’s competitive and they had it done in less than 90 minutes.

name: Manix Estancia
description: It is a place with a beautiful view, surrounded by forests, very quiet and safe. It has a cabin that you can rent, with two bedrooms.

name: Transporte Nanito
description:
Very close to the Almacen Fiscal El Coco and the airport. Melissa and Andres allow travelers  to camp in front  of their house. You cross first the transport company Nanito which belongs to the same family.
You can wash your vehicle there an do some little repair. You can borrow tools and scales.
Air for your tires is available .
Price is 10 000crc per vehicle per night.
including électricité, water and Wi-Fi.
no toilets or showers at this place.
there is enough place for 3 vehicles, 28/29 feet long.
Melissa speaks english and is often at home.
The first plane takes off around 5am. The trucks also leave early. Afterwards, it is calmer.
You can contact Melissa Salas +506 71 07 04 09.   whatsApp. sinestriboscr@gmail.com

name: Linda Vista - Schnitzelhaus by Pappiulf
description: Restaurant by a German guy offering delicious and authentic Schnitzel! Very nice location. Beautiful view. Perfect and pleasant climate. You can sleep in front of the place (after eating his schnitzel).

name: Marino Ballena NP - Playa Piñuelaya
description: If you have paid the entrance to Marino Ballena National Park, I advise you to come and walk on this beautiful beach. With the same ticket you can visit 3 places including this one. The ticket costs US $ 6.78 for adults and it's free for children. This pebble beach is bordered by coconut palms, we saw a possum, a coatis and several howler monkeys.

name: Eden Corcovado
description:
Casa Bromelia is a beach-front villa for renting inside Eden Corcovado, it includes the following:
-4x4 car access with parking
-Satelital internet, free wifi
-Equipped kitchen
-1 king-sized bed and 1 queen-sized bed
-Spacious bathroom
-Ample balcony with ocean view

name: Río Nuevo crossing
description: During raining season, you have to cross this river, the only one without bridge. After a lot of rains, today it was around 30cm deep.

name: Río Riyito crossing
description: During raining season it was impossible today to cross this river. To go to Bahía Drake I recommend to take the "Calle Bahía Drake" a little bit more in North. This road has bridges.

name: Villa la costa
description:
Cabins & parking spots for RV (informal hookups up to 30amp). Gated, 30 meters from the beach and walking distance to supermarkets. Lots of nature, birds & shadow.
Info & reservations:
Yair +506 6047 6055

name: Van Love
description:
A pit stop for every traveler. 
We will get your RV, camper, equipment or vehicle professionally serviced, fixed or upgraded. 
The property is small but you can camp here if needed, and there are a few cheap cabins for rent right around the corner if you need a real shower and bed for once.
Our goal is to provide the services every traveler needs but are hard to find in Central and South America.
The area is very quiet, calm and safe. 
The place is currently being developed so some services might be rustic.
English, Spanish & Hebrew spoken.
Please contact in advance
Whatsapp +506 6004 2055

name: Van Love - Mechanic Services
description:
Professional campervan builders and RV repairs.
+10 years of experience, working on American standards and able to source/fix/build whatever your rig needs.
We also do vehicle electronics and accurate mechanic diagnostics pluswe  source the right mechanic.
Also campground, dump station and any help travelers might need

name: Hotel Jucahuje
description:
Amazing place to stay ! 15$US/ Pers ! Optional breakfast for only 4$US. Nice room with private bathroom. Towels and shampoo. Supermarket ~800m.
Beautiful view on volcanoes and mountains on the rooftop. Safe place to park. Bicycles inside. Place to cook and big shared space with authentic decorations. Lovely owners. Highly recommend on the way to La Fortuna / San Jose.

name: Jaco Pets Vet & Vet Supply
description: This is the place to go to get all your paperwork done to export your Pet! Arrived at 9:30am a day prior to flight and had everything done by vet and SENSA/stamped by 1:30pm SAME DAY. $154 total. Every other vet said it would take 5 days to get this all processed. They were so sweet, helpful, and productive.

name: Parque nacional Piedras Blancas - Sendero Ocelote
description: Here is a circular hike of around 3 km in the Piedras Blancas NP. The track is not on Maps.me, but there are some signs to guide you. Before I came here I have been at the ranger station of Gamba. The ranger said to me, it was ok to do this hike without paying the $10 US fees. This is a hike in the rainforest, ground is wet and steep.

name: Finca Mei Tai Cacao Lodge
description:
Absolutely STUNNING place with incredible belgian hosts that know everything of the neighbourhood. They will lead you to the best places and serve you the best food (they are amazing cooks !). The rooms, the jacuzzi, the pool, the living rooms are beautiful, super well done and thought.

Can you tell how much I loved it here ?

name: Bridge broken
description: The road is currently closed for car (may be possible for bike and moto). The bridge is broken. Work is underway.

name: Impassable road
description: Don't try to take this road, it is impassable. No bridge and no river crossing possible.

name: Parque Internacional de La Amistad - Sector Pittier
description:
Here is an access to the international park La Amistad. There are 3 walks possible: 
- one loop of around 3-4km to walk in the forest and see a waterfall 
- one round trip of 6km that runs along the park
- one round trip of 13km (need to ask more information about it to the rangers)

The entry cost is 10$US + tax for adults and free for children.
Near the ranger station there are toilets and showers.

The road (612) to come here is very steep but it is gravel road. We have tried to come here by some other roads but there were impassable (see the warning).

name: Poponjoche
description:
A place for the fmily to enjoy, and get to know the nature and marvels of Cano Negro.
.....
Un lugar donde disfrutar en familia, conocer las maravillas de la naturaleza en Caño Negro

name: Benedicion de Jehova
description:
Nice, clean, tidy and quite camping in front of the ocean.
It is owned by a very religious family so they do not allow alcohol, drugs and smoke in their premises but other than that they are very friendly and shared fruits and coconuts.
The site is suitable also for big rigs. 
Kids and pets are welcomed (the owners have a sweet medium size dog).
The family offers also restaurant service with local food provided that you ask them in advance.
Cost per night is 5000 colones pp. For 3 nights we paid 4000 colones pp.
Contact +506 64455353. 
The neighbor sell delicious cacao seeds coated with sugar for 1500 colons/bag.

name: Salamandra
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: This place was added by the owner or manager. It has not been overlander verified.

Nature and art in full harmony where unique atmosphere is created. A little paradise behind the door. We offer private accommodations and parking, tours in our magic place with coffee/tea and snacks. Delicious homemade breakfast and dinner are offered. Reach out to get more info via WhatsApp +506 88782899 or email josecardenas1710@gmail.com

name: Salamandra parking
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: This place was added by the owner or manager. It has not been overlander verified.

Wonderful and helping people José and Silvia let you park your vehicle on the flat, solid ground behind the gate with security camera. No toilets for now, but 100+Mbsp Wi-Fi. It is also possible to refill the water tank. You have to ring at main entrance of Salamandra, and the parking gate is behind.  We don't charge, however, any gratitude is welcome, with a smile. Height 3m and Width 3m. Reach out on: josecardenas1710@gmail.com or +506 88782899 (also Whattsapp)

name: Spa XIO
description:
Xiomara does therapeutic massage while her husband is chiropractor.
I had a bad pain at my right leg and they were able to relieve it. I totally recommend them. Not expensive.
Ph/WA +19166700186
Email: lloydmpeters@gmail.com

name: Step dirt road
description: I took this dirt road from Rivas to the Carretera Interamericana Sur, moreover, this is the route that Maps.me suggests. It's a very beautiful road which crosses the coffee plantations, but from Alaska, the track becomes very very steep and even in Defender I struggled to climb it, the stones slipped under the wheels. Definitely ONLY for 4wd and be careful!

name: Old soccer field
description: Old football field, part of it is used to store stones.  The night is cool and very quiet. There is short grass on the side. To get here it's steep, it's not for the big rigs. On the left side we receive a little 4G Liberty.

name: Juan and his family
description:
Juan is a lovely retired bicycle lover. He lives in a rancho with his wife and 3 kiddies. The ranch has a lot of fruit trees (good coconuts!!).and animals. You could enter with big rig. We (2 cyclers) camped under an apart mini kitchen with WC, power outlets and water.

Juan told me I could add his place on iO. He loves meeting other cultures. He's a lifelover. He offered us dinner, breakfast, shower.
Really lovely family

SEND HIM A WHATSAPP BEFORE COMING +506 8602 1368

name: Walmart parking lot
description: We ask the security guy and told us no problem we can fill our tank at the corner of the parking there is a water sink.

name: Free parking close to El Choyin hot springs
description: We parked here for free and walked 1km along the road (about 1/3 of the distance has a sidewalk) to the El Choyin hot springs. With our big rig we couldn't park directly at the street next to El Choyin.

name: Parking lot next to BCR (Bank)
description:
We stayed in the parking lot of the bank for one night. Nobody disturbed us. From here you can walk to the town center. We experienced a little noise from motorcycles passing to the buildings behind the bank. I guess big rigs fit here too. We even used the open WiFi from the bank during the opening hours. No amenities. 
Best free place we could find with our truck camper.

name: Taller mechanico Jose Chinchilla
description: Great garage but 30k colones or 60 usd for 2,5 hours. Seems all mechanic in Costa Rica are not really cheap. Look for card in photos

name: Gas Express del Sur
description: This guy delivers propane tanks (different sizes) with his truck. There is no physical shop but he operates around Uvita. You can call or write to him using this number: +506 8421 3333. He is very responsive and friendly. We exchanged our 15 lbs tank for 6000 colones. He said he could refill our existing tank but he would need 3 to 4 days. So we simply exchanged the tank.

name: Mundo Milo
description: We were absolutely thrilled with this restaurant. A Dutch couple runs a lodge with 7 rooms and a restaurant. The cevice was the best ever. The Thai curry was also outstanding and the selection of vegetarian and gluten-free dishes is huge. Absolute recommendation (not really cheap, but worth every cent!)

name: Jack street camping
description: Nice spot to spend the night street with cameras and security guys from hotels make you f lo safe

name: ATV Rental
description:
ask them for the (potable) water tap- it is sloow but hej it’s free
you need your equipment

name: Playa Hermosa hidden beach spot
description: small place to camp with a tent or a small camper.  very calm & private.  very nice ocean front beach spot.

name: Pozo los Coyotes Entrance
description: This the entrance to Pozo Los Coyotes waterfalls. You pay 2000C or $5 for the day. You need to go past here another 500m to park the car.

name: Hacienda Guachipelin entrada
description:
This is the entry point of property where you have to pay 800C to get to Ricon de la Vieja National  Park.  This is the cost to cross the property. If you make a  past this gate, you have access to all the activities that are offered in Hacienda  Guachipelin and Rincón  De La Vieja National Park. Here is a summary of all the things you can do:
1. Hike La Leona waterfall. Your best option is Don Rafa Tours. They charge $20/person. In Curubande, there are also La Leona tours that charge $45/person. At Don Rafa, you can camp overnight too. La Leona Waterfall tours also have a parking lot where you may be able to stay overnight. I did not ask them. 
2. You can visit Hacienda Guachipelin and get a tour at the gift shop. There are various tour options available. I have added a pin in ioverlander. I got the all-day adventure pass. It was worth every penny. It was one of the best things I did. please check the Hacienda  Guachipelin pin that I have added for details.
3. You can visit the Simbiosis spa. It costs $39/person for spa treatment. If you can spare some change, that may be worth trying. A pin has been added. They also offer favial and massages. They are costly, though. 
4. Hike and swim in the Las Chorreras waterfall. You can park and do the 1 km one-day-adventure-pass hike and dip in the pool. Vost is $17/person
5. You can hike the trails at Rincón  De La Vieja National Park. There is the Pailas sector and the Santa Maria sector. In the Pailas sector, you can visit Cangrejal Waterfall (2.5 hrs hike one way) or the shorter Mud Pots trail (2 hrs total). 
You can also drive to the Santa Maria Sector and hike a couple of trails there. The cost to hike is $17/person. Please make sure to make your NP reservation  electronically at the SINAC website. They do not sccept cash. They do have a terminal where you may be able to acces tge site, its  touch, and go, though.
5. By the NP you have the beautiful Oropendola waterfall that you can hike (15 min) and visit on your own, it cost $23/person. 
6. You can also visit Rio Negro hot water pools. It costs $34/person. You can go on your own. in the afternoon it really gets busy. All the tours which there are many end up here before they head back to San Jose, La Fortuna and Tamarindo. 
A spent a week here and stayed mostly at the Riverside wildcamping spot. You can also stay in the Hacienda Guachipelin private property. There are few pins listed. You will basically save 800c entrance fee but will have no cell signal or wifi. To me that was important to have so I was willing to pay the 800c entry fee everyday. Also, keep in mind tou can jump in the river and take a shower everyday too. 
This is a great are, enjoy to its fullest.

name: Canopy Tour Rincon de la vieja
description: This is the entrance to the canopy tour. The tour cost $45.

name: Simbosis Spa
description:
Natural spa where you go through  sauna(15 min), cold dip (15 min), mud application and drying (30 min) and volcanic hot water dip ( however long you want to stay). It's  an experience. The serene natural environment while going through the treatment is expensive, though. Cost $39/person.

They also offer facial and massages which are quite expensive.

name: Pozo de Rojo parking lot
description: This is where you park to hike to Pozo de Rojo. Tgere are quite a few bike trails here too. Just go straight if you want to go to Pozo Rojo

name: Los Chorreras Waterfall start
description: This is where the hike starts. You can leave your car by the roadside. The waterfall is 1km from this point. When you get to the fall the ranger will charge you $17. I was not planning to swim so he let me take photo without any charge

name: La Hacienda Gift shop
description:
Free internet at the gift shop and where you make reservations for the tubing. Nice facility and ambiance while you download your data.
They do offer an all-day adventure pass that includes horseback riding and swimming in Catarata Chorreras. river tubing, canyon ziplining and visiting the Rio Negro hot pools. The all-day activities cost is $123/person. Just the tubing is $63/person. It is one of the best things I did in Costa Rica. 
While you go on adventure, you can park the rig at the front and have them safely store the keys.

name: La Gamba
description: Nice and very quiet peebles beach. The river is clear and it is nice to take a bath. There a lot of place to park. Just be careful if it is raining, the water level can rise. Accessible for all kind of vehiculs. No 4G with Liberty.

name: optional river xing
description:
if you haven’t had enough of action than skip the bridge and cross through the water (:
have fun!

name: faucets at the parking
description: There are faucets with seems like drinking water. Ask for permission before filling. Water is mainly used for grass watering. Every row of parking have 1 faucet.

name: llantos de cortez waterfall entrada
description: This is the entry to the waterfall. They charge $7/person. There is another entry option doen the road. please see ioverandet pin. They charge $4/ person.

name: Hotel Riviera
description: Moto friendly budget hotel near the Panama border. The town of Sabalito is very pretty and it is much cooler up here than along the coast. Basic, clean nice restaurant. Very friendly and helpful staff. Would recommend.

name: Hostel Pura Vida
description: awesome dorm style with some private rooms with air conditioning and private bathroom. $20 USD for private room.   off street parking  fast wifi.   one staff speaks perfect English   friendly lady owner very cheerful.  recommend

name: Caribbean Hotel
description: Budget hotel with free secure parking (see picture) (around 3m height limit) free WiFi (better in some rooms than others) and hot showers.  Close to city centre and although not in the best of areas, I felt OK after dark.  Friendly staff.  12,000 1 person, 14,000 2 people.  See picture.

name: on the river
description:
we came through from San Jose on this beautiful scenic road- only for this could make a 4x4 route entry!- then after a small (30-60cm) water xing on the right we found this island on the middle of the river 
safe to park in dry season, the sand is packed and the best thing is: no one around - not even a light! (ok maybe at night some passing cars enough far from you but that’s it)
Just beautiful mountains, jungle everywhere, full day sun, cool water and enough drift wood to make a fire 
woowie

name: Robbery / tourist killed
description: According to local news reports, a German tourist was recently killed at Dominical Beach while camping in a vehicle. The incident occurred late at night on November 30, 2023. The assailants demanded money and belongings, and during the confrontation,  one of the tourists who resisted the robbery attempt was unfortunately fatally shot.

name: Mobil station
description:
Ask the guys serving gasoline if you can fill your tank . They authorised me to connect my hose to the faucets in between gasoline pumps (they are plenty)
They told it was drinkable water… I filtered anyway…

name: Public Beach for Arenal Lake
description:
This is the public beach entrance to the Arenal Lake from Nuevo Arenal Town. You can park on the side of the small road next to the lake and swim in it without a problem

Attaching a picture of a map of all things in Nuevo Arenal we received from our hotel.

name: MAXIPALI CHEAP SUPERMARKET
description:
Cheap supermarket to buy all your groceries, even fruits and vegs. Large parking lot outside. 
~ 
Supermercado barato para hacer las compras, incluso frutas y verduras. Estacionamiento grande afuera.

name: Beautiful waterfall for FREE
description:
Beautiful natural pool and waterfall, it's called "Poza azul". There is also a rope attached to a tree to jump into the water! So refreshing. Parking lot in front even for big rigs. FREE. 
 ~ 
Hermosa cascada y pozon natural de agua, se llama "Poza azul". Hay una soga atada a un arbol para saltar al agua! Super refrescante. Estacionamiento en frente, incluso para motorhomes grandes. GRATIS.

name: whats the catch
description:
during the xmas week we found this „shelter“
Couple of cars/ motos at day- nobody at night 
(…still don’t get it what is the catch here :D maybe the ants? pls send us a message if you found it out >> further up on the Rajada tons of people and here? Nothing- So peaceful!)
Good and calm waves, in the corner of the beach is nice breeze, really friendly locals, no crocodiles (?), infinite driftwood, minimal bugs and lots of places to camp with the view of Nicaragua & the mountains 
* urban legend says there is a cocodrillo in the mangroves but he is small and there are an other one on the „eco-resort“ side and he is 4meter but the tail is chopped off > anyway the fishermen were standing in the „river“ water up to the mangroves idk

name: Ranchitos Campo Verde
description: Small campsite and restaurant at the owner’s residence. We payed 7000 col to camp on our bike trip. Included use of shade/rain structure, sink, table, showers, bathroom

name: Great place for snorkel
description: Great place for snorkeling and also for some adventures on your kayak and paddleboard. I've seen 3 octopus close to the beach, some turtles more further. Crystal clear water between low tide and high tide.

name: Water at Golfito Airport
description:
At the airport, you can find drinking water as well as a water tap to refill your tanks but it must be during business hours.

À l'aéroport, vous pouvez trouver de l'eau potable ainsi qu'un robinet d'eau pour refaire le plein de vos réservoirs mais il faut que ce soit pendant les heures ouvrables.

name: Parking airport Golfito
description:
Juste à côté de l'aéroport golfito, vous pouvez vous stationner gratuitement sur une bande goudronnée. L'endroit est très calme (aucun avion la nuit), juste à côté de l'entrée du parc national. On a passé une bonne nuit. Pendant les horaires d'ouverture du petit aéroport, vous pouvez accéder aux toilettes et refaire le plein d'eau potable.

Right next to Golfito airport, you can park for free on an asphalt strip.  The place is very quiet (no planes at night), right next to the entrance to the national park.  We had a good night.  During the opening hours of the small airport, you can access the toilets and refill your drinking water.

name: Osa surf camp
description:
This camp site is amazing. You are on the beach in the jungle. We stayed here for 2 nights. We were supposed to stay three but because of the amount of rain we disided to go to the hostel of the owner of the campsite.
The second night we had hauler monkeys spending the night sin the threes above us.

There is a shower a toilet running water.
There is also a cooking area but you need your own gear.
We had a pickup with two roof tents there is enough space for that.

name: Refugio Ecológico Mosqueritos
description: A place with several activities such as: trails, boat ride, slide to the lake and horseback riding. The price is 6000 per person. Access for any vehicle

name: front row
description:
(not) only in dry season is a good spot for camp with starlight, jungle sounds and sunny front row seats to the action at the cool river 
the xing gets chilled after dark - couple locals during the day but everybody is friendly 
only kölbi signal but clear sky to the north iykyk

name: MMH Customs
description: Very competent and honest family run shop that specializes in overlanders.  They did great work on my Land Cruiser but work on many brands.  Call Marco Mendez.

name: Cocoa Beach Camping
description:
Nice spacious campsite at the beach. Campground is owned by the family that lives just opposite the campsite and are very friendly and welcoming.
The site is beautifully situated between palm trees but still lots of space to find the right spot.
It’s a simple camp and you can use the Baños of the family house.
Herrera Rojas is a friendly host and will connect your rig to electricity if needed.
Beach is very clean!
Site accessible also for big rigs.
We paid 2500C / pp / night
The entrance is just 70M beyond The Benedicion Jehova.

name: Playa Hermosa wild camping
description: Site in front of the ocean, you can park under the trees.

name: Quebrada Grande view
description: very nice safety lonely place. We spend one night there, because IT was very late and we want top find a place with a nice view. We arrived at Sunset and there is such an amazing View with the fog, sunlight,....when you Drive along the Road, there is a little Sharp Turn 5m uphill und than about 50m Downhill till it's nearly flat. the road end in range land for cows- so now Traffic the hole night and you cant see this spot from the regular road-perfecto. In the night it was very windy foggy and wet. Maybe you need a 4wd to get uphill in the morning.

name: Free shower at Gas Station
description: Free shower and bathrooms at the gas station. No hot water, but the water isn‘t too cold to get a nice shower.

name: No river cross possible
description:
We took this road because of our navigation system. Crossing the river, there is no solid ground. We did stuck and locals helped us to free ourselves. They told us that the road does not continue.
Check your navigation system not passing this point.

name: La Comarca Glamping
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.

This is a glamping place but also do wild camping. The basic ammenities are for the guests and the volunteers that work in site. WiFi available.

Entrance is 2.500 colones with parking and river entrance. Toilet and shower just an extra 500 colones.

name: crab pot
description:
popular fishing spot 
caught a lot crab with a crab trap .
this is one of the 50 or so spots between limon and Puerto Viejo

name: Camping Allalu
description:
really great place, just in front of the sea. 
And Roberto is really a nice guy, allways a nice weird when you cross him, and he'll do whatever he can to please you

Don't be surprised, it's right next to the airport, the airplanes are very little bit the first one to land can be surprising ! 

he ask 8000c, I was sleeping in my van, using his brand new shower and toilets ! 

highly recommendable. It's in the center of everything, so you can find restaurants, tours, whatever you want

name: Rio Blanco Lugar de Paz
description:
a very quiet place in the middle of nature, in the beautiful mountains of nandayure. suitable for recreation. no neighbors. pleasantly cool temperature at night. 
accessible for vehicles with 4x4. 

there are 3 very nice dogs and a sweet cat on the property. it is not possible to bring your own pets.

washing machine and tumble dryer available. 

no check-in without registration via whats app before! +506 6007 5201

name: Poco a poco
description: Nice beach side restaurant. Amazing food.

name: Taller Gabriel
description:
An allround mechanic. Fixed our Problem with the v belt, alternator and more. Even came to the camping we stayed, because we were not able to drive. 
So if you have any problem around this area, they can help you :)! 
A bit pricey, but I think it is normal for Costa Rica. 
Recommended! 
+50689355055 / +50627568005

name: Paved Area Side of Road
description: Flat paved area off the side of highway, informal truck stop? Restaurant next to it with friendly staff and good food.

name: Under the trees at Playa Platanares
description: Quiet, shady spot in the tree line. It’s sand underfoot, but firm enough to drive on without switching to 4WD, and far enough back from the beach to ensure any wildlife (e.g. turtles) remains undisturbed. Follow the road down past AguaDulce and the other resorts, and you’ll find a spot. Had the place to ourselves, other than a few pairs of macaws.

name: pizzeria Las Perlas
description:
What a great place! Just in front of one entry for the Nauyaca waterfalls.
The two owners are very welcoming. I could start in their backyard for the night for free, I just went to eat a very good pizza in the evening
I didn't ask if I could use the shower because I took it in the waterfalls but they're so nice that I'm sure they'll accept

The food is also very good and with a conscious of what is a good product!

name: Hotel Don Robert
description: Little family run hotel, clean, AC, Wi-Fi, breakfast included, own shower and bathroom, basic and okay, 50 USD, secure parking and enough space for my bicycle in the room, English speaking, close to the sea, supermarkets and other shops in the neighborhood

name: Parqueo Poza El Salto
description:
Small restaurant with ample parking.
toilet, shower and electricity.
price 10$ for the night.
possibility of accessing the river on foot and hiking.
________________________

Petit restaurant avec un grand parking. 
toilette, douche et électricité. 
prix 10$ pour la nuit.
possibilité d'accéder à la rivière à pied et faire de la randonnée.

name: Playa Bejuco - Multiple Robberies
description:
Again a violent robbery at this beach, a Dutch couple with a rental 4x4 rooftop tent were robbed violently from their money and some possessions.
This is one of many robberies at the mainland Pacific coast this season, seems that the local police and politics aren’t doing much about it.

name: The Donblock.
description: Great spot located east of the Rafiki beach company. We showed up just before dark and had the place to ourselves.  There is a car path which ends overlooking the beach. We had a 4x4 roof top tent and enough room for about 2. It’s kind of an isolated spot, Felt safe, it was very nice.

name: Near Lola’s.
description:
It’s the second time I camped here with zero issues.  Great little shaded spot enough for about 5 autos. Locals here during day everyone clears out as it’s getting dark.  Good for roof top tent to the right as soon as you get to end if “driveway” watch for overhanging branch’s , but enough space. It’s a little walk north up the beach to Lola’s and the surf , maybe 200 m. 
Police came by on motorcycle about 830 pm said something ( not angry) but my Spanish is not great, so said “ lo siento, no entiendo” he said something again in a nice tone and left.  He came back a few times drove down, turned around and left again… it was like he was checking on the place.

name: Natural Camping Arenal Volcano
description: Picturesque site overlooking Arenal volcano. Near a river with great birding. Cold water pool available, cold water showers, potable water and sink. No electricity in the bathroom but lights above pitches. Battery powered lamp available to borrow. Animal friendly. Family friendly. LGBTQ+ friendly. Situated on a family farm near tourist attractions, but away from busy areas. 10 USD per person/per night - Jan 2024.

name: Yethan House
description: This was the cheapest accommidation we could find in Uvita (we didn’t want to camp as my partner was unwell) and it was a decent find compared to other prices in the town. The rooms were super clean, the location is decent (15 minute was down to a lovely beach) and the owners could not be more helpful. Also, the owner takes security super seriously after some crime in the town so we felt safe with our bikes.

name: Canyon river swim Donnie
description: You can park on the side of the road and follow the path along side the canon. The path goes down until you can get in a swim.  Beautiful area locals use. !!!!

name: LOCAL MARKET HANDCRAFTS
description:
​Local fair on the beach every Saturday from the morning. If you sell crafts, food, etc. You can put your position here, as many days as you want, you don't have to pay anything. and there are very nice things to buy (bikini, necklaces, clothes, etc.)


Feria local en la playa todos los sabados desde la mañana. Si vendes artesanias, comida, etc. podes poner tu puesto aca, los dias q quieras, no hay q pagar nada. y hay muy lindas cosas para comprar (bikini, collares, ropa, etc.)

name: MP distribuidora.
description:
This is a great shop that can fix from tires to electrical to transmission and I’m being told they can fix anything.  I can’t speak Spanish very well at all and they can’t speak english however a person who was there helped.  I got towed there and they let me slept in the van under the garages shelter with the gates locked and they had the transmission out but 9 am the next morning. They got delivered the wrong part and once got the right part it was still only 1 pm that it was completed (150 usd for labour, 230 usd for part) They also fixed my indicators that stopped working the previous day.  

Great bunch !!!!

name: Camping at Río Abrojo
description:
[cyclists & probably dry season only] Crossing the bridge in direction Panama, take the first road to the right and follow the (dirt) road for a bit along the river. 

At some point the bushes open up and the river lays in front of you. There are some very shallow parts of the river where a crossing is fairly easy. On the other side you’ll find a beautiful sandy area to pitch your tent, or tents - there’s space for a big group of cyclist. 

Water is clear and somewhat refreshing, I would probably not drink it. Highly recommended spot! Do groceries in Ciudad Neily or the small tienda in the village close to the spot. Enjoy!

name: VerdiAzul - Turtle Rescuecenter
description:
Really nice place. They are protecting different kinds of turtles here (their eggs and cleaning the place and stuff like that).

You can just come any time and get informations about what they are doing here. You can also help for a night patrol to protect the beach, or for watching when they have babies to release in the ocean, or even do a longer volunteering. 

Just come and talk to them to get all the informations. There is always somebody around 24/7. 

Great place.

name: Tony' restaurant
description: Great restaurant with local prices. I would come back again. The owner speaks English too.

name: FIARU EMPANADAS
description:
Really tasty and good filled argentinian empanadas, original flavors and also vegan option. 1.500 (3usd) each. Very practical lunch and not expensive at all. Outdoor tables . Very nice place, friendly owners and great food. 
~
Buenisimas empanadas argentinas. Super bien rellenas y sabores originales, y hay opcion vegana. 3usd o 1500 colones cada una. Super practico para el almuerzo o cena, podes comer en las mesitas al aire libre o llevarlas a la playa, no es caro, los dueños re copados y las empanadas riquisimas.

name: Michel place.
description: Great mechanic amazing English. Use to work and own a shop in USA, he is a local.

name: Kapaliz
description: Two complete apartments with kitchen and bathroom. There is Wifi, towels and secured parking. Pablo, the owner speaks very good English. In the center of the town is a small supermarket where you find meat and some fresh vegetables and other things. Paid 35$

name: Fuel Station - Park & Sleep
description:
New fuel station with big parking area, asked to park and stay for the night. Was no problem and station is open and guarded 24/7. Staff is very friendly. Some other local trucks park here for the night also, very quiet after 8 pm and hardly any road noise. Bathroom is open all night.
Very good spot if you cross the border next morning early.

name: Toro Amarillo Restaurante & Bar
description:
WOW WOW WOW! Best local and typical food! Also veggie options. The Casados are AMAZING! You really need to try it!
One Casado is 4.000Colones. Great prices for CR and a really big portions. 

Enjoy this place :) 

(It‘s the blue house, not the orange one ;) )

You can park at the side of the road without any problems. And the staff is also very nice, helpful and friendly.

name: Free showers
description:
Free showers at the end of the the complex „El Jardin“. The showers were clean and had good water pressure. There are also free toilets between the restaurant and souvenir shop. 
Gate is open from 05:30am - 7:00pm

name: view of Samara beach
description: incredible spot with ocean view.  Access is recommended for 4WD because there is a small, very damaged part.  (view the photo).  Access is via a small dirt path to the right of the main road going up.  For the courageous with a little willpower it can possibly work if you are neither too heavy nor too big.  The night was hot because we are not very high.  Young people came by motorbike in the night to enjoy a little evening with their friends.  They just laughed among themselves for a long time.  The land is almost flat.

name: Quiet street beside a park
description:
Walmart and the End of the Road near the Walmart were not options so we came here as it was too dark to go anywhere else. 
It was quiet and safe and flat. There are lots of amenities in the mall next door but we left early before they were open. There’s lots of restaurants though if you arrive late. 
Not a great spot for days but perfect for an overnight.

name: San Luis Adventure Center (Canopy etc)
description:
Great place for beginners to try canopy (Zip Line). First they said 75$, but in the end they did it for 50$pP and the best: I (Merle) was allowed to try 2 lines for free and decide after, if I would like to go on and pay for the whole thing! Very nice guides! And really beautiful and stunning forest! 8 lines in total. The best: Tarzan Swing and Superman! 

Highly recommended :) 

Look for the office, which is signed as the ,reception‘.

name: Veterinario animal care
description: Came here to do the papers for the border crossing to Nicaragua. Costs: C 70‘000.— for one dog incl. the costs for Senasa. Came in the morning and the documents were ready in the late afternoon. So plan enough time for it. I checked the price at 5 different vets in Liberia and this was the cheapest one.

name: Nice Coffee Tour ,CAFÉ EL TOLEDO‘
description:
Very honest coffeetour! We already did one in Colombia for less money, but here we had the much better experience, because we were explained so many more backround informations and really really honest :) 

2h for 25$ pP - I know it sounds much but in our opinion worth it.

Tours every day at 10am and 2pm. Text them in WhatsApp before for a reservation to make sure they have space: ‪+506 8711 1221‬

Enjoy :) 

(Maybe you even could stay in your camper here… but we did not ask for that…)

name: Very good Tico food ,Vista del Valle‘
description:
Really, really good Casado for 4500! Amazing view from the balcony and nice staff! 

Enjoy :)

name: Finca Ecológica San Luis
description:
Nice and interesting place for night tours and day hikes. Perfect pizza on the site as well. We had 4x4 and made our way easily! 
Nice and clean toilets and grassy ground for all kinds of campers (price 10$pnpp)

name: Mechanic
description: I had a dead battery. I went to a battery shop and we learned my battery was not charging. The shop called this place … he came boosted my van and I followed him to the shop. Great place and very friendly guy. They got to work right away on my van and found out it was a faulty cable coming from alternator, Fixed right away.  30,000c. Great guy.

name: Best western El Sitio Hotel and Casino
description: Great spot. Great breakfast room about 106 usd and nice pool setting.

name: Marbella Surf Camp
description: Nice spacious campground with toilets, showers, wifi. Right on the beach surrounded by beautiful palm trees. Restaurant nearby too!

name: Al grano micro bakery campsite
description: Cris and Stefan have a small bakery in their house and host a small farm in their yard with plants and goats. If your lucky, they have amazing fresh bread in the morning. Currently they have one spot in their yard which is level, excellent for a rooftoptent. They plan to add shower and toilet next to the campsite, but in the meantime you can use their toilet and hot shower in their house. Please contact Cris at +506 8812 7349 beforehand to ask if the spot is available and instructions on how to get there from the road.

name: ROBBERY at park camp
description: Spent two nights here and in the second night at 4am two guys broke the lockers of our rear gear boxes and stole some outdoor stuff like table and hammocks. We woke up but just saw them running away so be careful! Although this place seems to be safe and also well light up during night time.

name: Playa Esterillos Centro
description: Long Beach front area. Very low key. Plenty of shade and sand. Completely private and on a road that has a lot of higher end homes on it I assume expat retirees rent. So feels very safe and very calm. Would be an excellent spot to tuck away in private.

name: SENASA
description: It's in the same fenced space with security as Aduana. Just follow the yellow stripe in the middle, on the right. Senasa just need the bank receipt + vaccination copy and the IPSA Papers from Nicaragua. They will hand you out one stamped import paper. Feliz Viaje!

name: Parque Truck Stop
description: Just a massive gravel lot and I thought that I had parked well away from the road.  However during the evening, lots of big rigs filled the space, some with engines running all night.  Ear plugs required.  But OK for one night at 2000 colones.  I asume that there are restrooms by the restaurant but I didn't check.

name: Water Supply
description: This is a free and potable water tap, it is part of a small monuments that Acueductos y Alcantarillados (national water supply company) locates in rural towns to be used no charge

name: Hostel Coati
description: Real good and cheap hostel with breakfast. Owners are very friendly. Wifi, hot shower, tours and parking with camera

name: Hotel Fortuna Verde
description:
Hotel Fortuna Verde

Nice hotel on the Pan-American highway & located only 12 miles from Paso Canoas border. 

Owner gave us a tour of hotel & beautiful grounds with lots of trees on the property. They have standard & premium rooms and both are nice, comfy & very clean. Premium rooms are a little bigger & have 2-3 beds. Gated & locked parking lot is secure at night. We stayed here the night before our border crossing into Panama. 

Owners live on site & are super helpful. We got restaurant recommendation for Ciudad Neily nearby.

WhatsApp owner Miriam at  +506 2783 9292 for reservations & let her know when you are arriving so they can open the gate. Spanish & English spoken here. 

Future plans: 
This would be a great place for overlanders to camp the night before or after crossing the border at Paso Canoas. I spoke to the owner & told her about iOverlander & how we all use it during our travels. They have nice flat parking areas, banos, outdoor hangout area & place for kids to play. So check with owner as this might be an option in near future.

name: Cocorico Delicias de Francia
description: Delicious French restaurant - and I am French (where almost everything is home made). You can park your Van here for the night, free if you eat. Lovely couple who are going to welcome you here.

name: Camping DomMar
description: Little nice Campground at the beach. Room for 3 or 4 rigs.Clean restrooms, nice and private cold shower and wifi. Hook up also possible, potable water to refill your camper tank(good for dishes and teeth brushing,maybe not to drink). Marvin the owner is kind and welcoming and lives across the street. We paid 2500 CRC pp.(Including everything).

name: Cabinas Rosita
description: Private rooms for $25, includes private bathroom and shower. Nice room. Shared kitchen is nice and has a lot of utilities. I was able to park my motorcycle right in front of the window and door to my room, which was nice even though it was outside. Also a roof over it.

name: Jungle Life
description:
This place organizes tours in a small forest with lots of animals. We did a night tour and could stay the night for free at their parking lot. Toilets and water are available and also a shelter with lights. Even a coffee when the staff arrived around 7.30am. 
Would recommend if you want to do a night walk around this area, it was much better than ours in Santa Maria’s, Monteverde (the one which has also free camping with a night walk)

name: BCR, ATM for USD
description:
ATM for withdrawal of larger amounts in USD (for shipping etc.) 

Only 20 USD bills at one of the ATM (so make sure to enter an amount that can be divided by 20) 

BCR doesn't charge additional fees for withdrawal.

Located on the upper level of the shopping mall. Free parking, no problems for smaller rigs.

name: Hotel & Camping Luna del Llano
description: Campground with cold shower, clean toilets with seats and toilet paper. 4,000 Colones per person. We didn't try the restaurant which wasn't open.

name: Rua sem saída
description:
Parking at the end of the street, very close to the central square, flat and quiet place.
We spoke to nearby residents and they said it was safe and we could stay. best place in the region to spend a night and it's free.

Estacionamento no final da rua, muito próximo da praça central, Lugar plano e silencioso. 
Conversamos com moradores próximos e disseram que é seguro e que podíamos ficar. melhor local da região para passar uma noite e é gratuito.

name: Tulin River Camp
description:
after several (small and not so deep) river xing you can reach this spot and many many opportunities to get a cool down and a decent goodnight camp
In the village Tulin after the bridge is an option to turn to the water and drive it (as locals do) up & down in the river bed
could be available only in dry season idk but the entry is all year round open to camp 
no nothing only chill vibes and cows/horses 

ᕙʕಠᴥಠʔᕗ

name: Quiet street close to police station
description: Next to Delegación de Policia(24 hrs), we asked the cops, they said that is ok to overnight in the street, 50 m away from the police station.We parked in front of Clinica del Dolor. The street is steep, so no ideal but with levelers can be ok. Friendly and curious neighbors, totally safe.

name: Passenger Bridge to Orosi
description: you can park your vehicle at the street while walking to Orosi, simple, easy, free, end of the road Bridge 4t and 2,4m high restriction

name: Boquerones
description:
Nice place in the mountains. Bajo. Caliente. Cool and interesting. Toilet, showers, restorant.
Interesting tours in the mountains. Montes the ORO. Elisabeth will take care of things. Guide is Lorenzo. Phone: +506 87329754 Top.

name: Mia's Restaurant & Pizzeria's Overnight Parking
description: After we had dinner here, the owner offered us his customer parking space in front of his restaurant to stay overnight.  We were happy to accept this.  The restaurant closes at 8 pm.

name: Indreni Miko
description:
Hello, I´m living in a beautiful place in the deepest Costa Rica. I offer my services and you can sleep here in your car, camper, or in a room with fan. ) not AC.

 I offer you yoga and meditation classes, Zen Massage, Conscious Tattoos and Retreats. A break in your busy holidays.

I have two dogs inside the house, nice dogs, but I don´t accept more animals inside... sorry. 

If you come here to healing yourself really welcome.

Only let me know in advance to prepare the space and be more confortable. 
Please, send me a WhatsApp to +506.7278.0050 
And lovely to meet you.
Check my website with the prices and the accomodation is included.

name: Agua potable
description:
Ask for “Chepon” (José Bustamante), we refill our big tank with drinking water for 1,500 colones. 

There are no public taps in the area.

name: Super Economico Palmares
description: cheap Supermarket, less choice, looks like mostly lokal products, no big water canisters, but tap with 100 % drinkable water (they said...) in front.

name: Camping Volcán Viejo
description: A few level campsites at the top of Embalse Hidroeléctrico just beyond Estación Biológica Volcán Viejo. No cell service or facilities. Very secluded, sound of cascading water through the night. A Bajos del Toro local directed us here as the views over Poas and the mountains are stunning on a clear day when you drive back into town.

name: Tenorios Treasure Camping
description:
We have four sites available with private access to Rio Celeste walking distance from the Tenorio volcano park entrance Trail network, power, water, and firewood
Self check-in 5000 colones per person per night just pick a spot and someone will be around to collect

name: Rancho Amalia
description: Ranch with Horses, Cabanas, Restaurant, Trails. huge grassy area for parking, we ask for staying overnight with the camper 28ft, 10TCol per Truck, Wifi, good views

name: Taller RM Automotriz
description: This mechanic (Roy) is a very skilled and nice general mechanic, who helped us with some trouble we were having with our engine and gas throttle. Roy did great work for us and is very enthusiastic about 4x4 camping vehicles and will definitely be happy and able to help any overlander coming his way.

name: Rincón de la Fiera Camping
description: Rincón de la Fiera campground is so beautiful. It’s a beachfront property right on Playa Marbella. There are bathrooms and showers. It has a communal area where you can cook. To cook you have to use wood and make a fire in this grill type area. It’s a beautiful place with good surf and good people.

name: care4pets - Dog Sitting short and long term
description: Dorothe and her husband living with their 6 dogs and a cat in a beautiful house with fenced garden in San Jose. She is from the Netherlands and loves to take part in Dog Agility competitions. We left our dog with them for 2 weeks while travelling to Panama and had areally good experience with them. As we flying home to Germany soon, Dorothe also Kennel trained our dog and arranged an appointment with a vet who knows the flying out process. she takes 4000 $C a day, but you have to bring your own food. The dog has to be vaccinated, potty trained, up-to-date on parasites and needs to be OK with other dogs. We can highly recommend her! You can check Dorothe on Facebook as well: care4pets  //  +506 8822 9020 on WhatsApp

name: Rua sem saída
description:
Dead end street 20 meters from the beach, quiet, wide and flat location, with good shade under the trees. We stayed here for two nights, very peaceful and quiet. We feel safe. As it is access to the beach, many people pass by during the day and they are very friendly.

Rua sem saída a 20metros da praia, local tranquilo, amplo e plano, com boa sombra embaixo das árvores. Ficamos duas noites aqui, muito tranquilo e silencioso. Nos sentimos seguros. Como é acesso para a praia, durante o dia passa muitas pessoas e são muito cordiais.

name: Gasolinera Delta Guacimo
description: Good option for filing water, dump porta potty and filling fuel.

name: Taller A/C Automotriz
description: we got a refill for our aircondition without any problems, paid 15 000 c. they also offer more service, reparacion etc....

name: Acrossing River
description: All the engine of my moto was underwater, I could across, but not easy.

name: Great area only for 2 wheels
description:
Only for motos or bikes(with heavy bike you'll have to push it a bit): at the really end of the road, after a narrow and sandy km, you'll arrive to a wild area, full of old wood and leaves. but under the bended tree, there is a really good spot for camping, just clean a bit the floor. The beach is full sand, no rocks.

Only a few fisherman came in the evening, but the told me that here is perfect, quite and safe.

Not a strong shadow is the only cons.

No flies or mosquitos, so I enjoyed a lot the sun set and the stars. 

Claro signal very very bad, the others I think are okay here.

@vicbybike

name: Camping Río Corobici
description:
Nice camping, a bit isolated but really quiet. nice river, not to deep but ok, good shadows, wood for fire, electricity, toilets and water. The owner is very friendly but he isn't all the time there, so call him before to go. +506 8380 1427
The road is gravel, but very good, just is not possible to across the the river near by, you have to arrive from Canas, I leave a photo about.
Only 5$ night.

name: hostel del pacifico
description:
good for motorcycle : 1 spot behind closed gate, very secure.
$30 on booking.com for 1/2/3 people room
clean, good

name: Near Mirador
description:
This is a open spot by the roadside where I camped out. Nice and safe. Talked to couple of people they said no problem. All other spots adjacent to this location listed on ioverlander charge 5000C. This was free.
Only suitable  spot for a van or a RTT vehicle. It  is a road turnout.

name: Labyrinth big one and small
description: A good labyrinth, option of a smaller one( not easy) and a bigger one. We did the smaller one, it took at least 30 min so we choose not to do the big one. Cost is 3000 …. It was worth it.

name: Empanadas Argentinas
description: Very yummy empanadas and alfajores right along Routa 34. Owned by a nice young couple from Argentina.

name: Water tap
description: Water tap, We asked and they told us that the water is drinkable, the tap at the full station did not have water.

name: Water tap
description: Drinking water tap, it is next to the soccer field office. Ask and you can drink.

name: Casa Del Viento
description: Internet, Cell, rooms, or camping. Well run. Secure parking. Big enough for RVs, but not specifically setup for RVs.

name: Blue Falls (6 waterfalls)
description: A sequence of 6 waterfalls, they are all real blue color, beautiful! a bit expensive,  $17, but worth it, it has a good structure built to get in the waterfalls, and still it is a very natural place. There are guides at each waterfall for safety, it is all included in the price.

name: Locos Cocos
description: What a beautiful, nice, cozy place on the beautiful beach of San Miguel. The owner is extremely friendly and fun to chat with. Everything is possible, nothing is too much. Toilets and showers available. Delicious food. They don't have a menu, but they make what is available, we had chops and fries. In the evening we drank beers, watched a beautiful sunset and had great stories. The owner loves children, so again everything is possible. Really worth a visit. Surfing lessons and board rental are also possible, as is horse riding, etc.

name: Centro parking
description: Secure car park to visit the centre. It's fenced

name: servicentro Sabanilla
description:
I had an issue with car missing so checked in here and to see if I can be immediately taken care off. William the head honcho was right on the car. He is very knowledgeable and his daughter who runs the shop knows English. 
Outstanding family business. Very professional. You cannot go wrong here

name: Green gas station
description: This is a large truck stop, so if you making your way somewhere this is a great one night stay area… bathrooms available and  a safe area too.  It’s good for vehicle camping… be it RV , van , car… it’s no good for tenting.

name: Mirador Bosque Alegrie Restaurant
description:
Great restaurant with Laguna view. You can hike down from restaurant 2500C and rent the kayak. Hike may not be good for folks with mobility issues. They also rent cabins and you can campout. 

They also allow car RTT and van camping. They charge 10,000C a night. You have access to Banos and wifi.

name: Finca Punta Mala
description: Amazing camping spot, shower toilet and kitchen available. Contact the owner first as you have to get through a get (it is secured)  +50688445023

name: Restaurant Rio Agrio parking lot.
description:
Stayed here for the night as other nearby options fizzled out. They allow people to camp. Tge cist is 4000c/person. They have couple of restrictions:
1. The restaurant front door gets locked at 6 pm. You can not enter after that.
2. The RTT should not be pop opened before 4 pm their are restaurant goers. They do not want to spoil the image. 
3. In the .morning the RTT should be popped down around 8-830 pm. 

The pro's:
You have access to bathroom and showers all night. 
Tge wifi is available but you must walk ose to the restaurant you be accessible.

name: Rio Agrio waterfall and Dinoland
description:
Great waterfall and Dinosaur park for the kids. The waterfall and Mirador are beautiful. Photos will attest to the beauty. 
Also, you can camp here 4000C per person per night. Access to wifi and bathroom

name: Tesoro Escondido waterfall
description:
Nice hike to the waterfall. There is a secure parking where you park the car
 The hike is 5km RT to the waterfall.

name: JSM gas station
description: Big green JSM gas station. To the left it seems like trucks stop here to rest or sleep. I asked the gas attendant if I could camp here tonight. He said sure and showed me were to go….ending it with a fist pump and a pura  vida.   Great place for a one night stop with bathrooms right there.  I believe this station is open 24 hr.

name: Los Lotes Salazar
description: family camping area project, there are fruit trees, drinking water, shower, wifi and vegetable area, private parking for 4 medium-sized caravan vehicles

name: Rio Marta Bridge
description: Nice Place to stay for a night. there a big flat ground where you can see old fire pits if you go a little further. Due to the rain we camped next to the bridge to sit under it. River is clean and ready to take a bath. If you are travelling by car, you can just park next to the bridge on the pathway.

name: Rachel and Dwight reserve
description:
A lovely place where scientific research is done. They offer a lovely 2.5km hike through the jungle for free (donation based). We met some researchers along the way and told us about their hummingbird research. 

You can park at facility or at bottom near the entrance to Curi Cancha and take the stairs up

name: Road for 4x4 vehicles only
description:
We saw on our navigation map that this was a paved road but not at all, it started bad but ended up almost imposible, had 3 river crossing in dry season, and foot deep potholes. We drove from monetzuma to malpais with our front wheel drive van, and managed to do it, but in the other direction there are super steep and bad condition, going up the mountain.
.
Creímos que este camino estaría asfaltado por lo que decía nuestra app de mapas, pero todo lo contrario. Fue de empeorando con el camino, cruzamos 3 ríos en temporada seca. Fuimos con una van tracción delantera desde Montezuma a mal país, pero en la otra dirección es más difícil debido al estado de las subidas, muy empinadas y en malas condiciones.

name: Costa Rica Custom Liberia Airport
description:
As Argentinan we were allowed to stay 6 months in Costa Rica, but our car only 3. Could renew the TIP in here in an hour or so. Very competent custom oficer. Came here by bus from Tamarindo, it's 2000 colones each trip, about 3 hours long. Also free wifi in here.

Cómo argentino nos dieron 6 meses para estar en Costa Rica, pero 3 a la camioneta. Pude renovar el TIP acá en una hora y algo. El oficial era muy competente. Vine en bus desde Tamarindo, 2000 colones cada viaje, 3 horas. Wifi gratis en el aeropuerto.

name: INS Liberia Insurance
description:
Bought my insurance in here to renew my TIP. 50 for three months dólars or so. Took 30 minutes, place was almost full. Got bathrooms and wifi. Two blocks walking downtown you got a bus stop to go to the airport for 600 colones.

Compré el seguro para renovar mi TIP. 50 por 3 meses dólares más o menos. Tardo 30 minutos, el lugar estaba casi lleno. Hay baños y wifi. Dos cuadras yendo al centro de Liberia se toma el bus al aeropuerto por 600 colones.

name: Whale bones on cemetery island
description: Well - as written as titel; whale bones from a big whale

name: super nosara
description: we got here a 10 pounds gas, only the gas as we had the cylinder,  3000 colones , for a new one this size would be  34250 col

name: san juanillo wild
description: Great place in front of the island, we loved this beach, cristal water, like Caribbean. We slept here 1 night, and asked some locals if it was safe, they confirmed that this is a  safe place but just said that we shouldn't leave our stuff outside, just for precaution as many fisherman come at night. we didn't here anything, it was a calm night. this beach is better at high tide,  in low tide the rocks appear and it's not good for swimming.  There are toilets close by for 500 toilet and 1000 shower, didn't use it.

name: puntarenas
description:
It is an open-air parking lot. gratuitous. next to silver. near public toilets
--------
es un parqueo al aire libre. gratuito. al lado de la plata. cerca de los baños publicos

name: Potable Water - Fuel station
description: There is drinking water at the fuel station. It has good pressure. In the main square there is also water but the water pressure is not very good

name: Tochi’s Bar
description: very nice place to spend the night for free, and to be able to eat at the Tochi’s bar restaurant, specialty of Churasco and Lomo de Beef 350 gr. 5G wifi, very good reception. we recommend this place with pleasure!

name: End of bejuco beach
description: We stayed here for the first night in our rented crafter sized camper. Had no problem getting to the spot and it has a turning circle at the end of the road. The parking bay was opposite a building and a campsite entrance. We felt safe knowing we were a couple of 10s of meters away from other campers. Really quiet wild camping with no facilities. The building at the end offers ice and snow cones. Little to no signal on claro

name: free parking lot to peninsula papagayo
description: I can't belive this place is not here yet, this is a free parking lot where you can get a free bus to the beaches in Península Papagayo, it is very safe and organized. We parked here early morning and took the bus which leaves from here also, there are 4 beaches that you can go (Nascolo, Playa Blanca, Piedra and Virador) we went to all of them, each beach has a good structure at the beginning, shower and toilets, the access to it is well constructed, for Nascolo is only 100 meters, so it is the crowded one, the others there are many steps to reach the beach, more than 500 steps, it is worth it! No restaurant at the beach so bring your on food and water.

name: kocorica
description:
Moderator note - Place added by Owner/ Manager

kocorica camping and cabañas, we are locales in Parrita. safety and relaxing place. near pacific beaches  (10 min with car) good place to stop between Manuel Antonio y Jaco. we propose toilet,shower,firecamp,barbecue, cumun rancho, ranchitos,and 2 rooms for 2 People for a good price. good acces, bus stop near the place.

name: Pura Vitality Retreat
description: Water, Power, Shower house, Wifi, river access, volunteer work, and farming

name: Cold Nights, Epic Sunsets
description:
Cold, cold, cold nights. End of March dropping to 42 F or 6 Celsius. Here is a spot will of flat ground and fire pits. 

Multiple rigs can fit — easily 8-10. Big rigs, easily with level ground. There are a few trails you can drive 30 meters back to be out of sight and have more privacy. 

Camped 4 nights. Little to no visitors. Locals come up with their motos or dogs and walk up to see both the pacific and Caribbean ocean. 

Road up is doable in 2WD, there was a Toyota Corolla here when I arrived. There are a few ruts that require navigating but manageable in any vehicle. Not steeper than any other road in Central America. There is an advisory sign as the road is not regularly maintained. 

There are two additional locations on the map, one lower just off the side road with more traffic and then up higher is the summit where the ground is not level, the road up is for 4WD and only one rig potentially two could fit. It’s also surrounded by small electric buildings and a lot of antennas. Good to walk up for sunset but not to camp

Wind picks up at night.

name: AYA
description: Free potable water. Very fast tap. Located outside the doors so it’s available 24/7

name: Water Supply
description: This is a free and potable water tap, it is part of a small monuments that Acueductos y Alcantarillados (national water supply company) locates in rural towns to be used no charge

name: Cabins Corobicí
description:
About 20 rooms available. Some with A/C others with a ceiling fan only. We paid 12000 for a room with a fan.
There is a small kitchen which has a gas hob and microwave but not much else (bring your own pans and plates!)
Lovely staff. Everything very clean. 
Secure parking off road.

name: esterillo este
description:
In front of the beach! Nobody is around except fancy hotels in the back ;) you can ask them the WiFi ;) and the range is quite big 
Be careful for coconut trees and ants 
A water tank on the main road is available, you will see it going to the spot!

name: Mirador
description: Little space besides the road, very little transit, very quiet, great view. Very chill place to spend the night. Careful, very steep road coming here, only 4x4

name: Acuario Quepos
description: Local pet shop with plenty dog supplies. Vendors are kind and will provide directions if needed.

name: Street Camping
description: Street campspot with walking distance to everything in town. We slept here one on a saturday and it was quiet.

name: Wilson Hotel
description: Great budget hotel with free breakfast. Good size rooms with lots of parking

name: Water Supply

name: Villa del Sol
description:
We could stay in that parking area from the hotel with our Sprinter and using the pool area. 
E really nice and safe spot to stay.
Super friendly people and close to the beach
They asked 10$/p
And they also offering laundry

name: Garden Grecia B&B
description:
This place is an absolute (Moto) overlanding gem. Of course, it's on Google and Booking.com. It's got over 9.0/10. 
We called Ronaldo on +506 83214745 and reserved over the phone. 

Here's the deal:
- No A/C but you don't need it, you're on a hill with a lovely breeze, it's cool at night.
- Secure parking. Locked gate. Then a motion detector at 10pm for the accommodation. You can park your motorcycle right outside your room, well away from the road. 
- Pool. 
- He let us use the large washing machine free of charge. 
- Great restaurant on site, reasonable priced. served by owner with a free liquor and great food. 
- Comfortable, large bed. 
- Breakfast included.
- Sunset view. 
- 50USD if paid cash/card. 

Lovely staff. 
Try and beat that.

name: Multigas Express Z Sardinal
description: This shop can change or fill up your US propane bottle. Ours was a 20 pounds one. They gave us the posibility to change it, but their bottles were a little old, so we decided to ask them to fill it, it took from thursday to saturday, cause its sent to a neerby city for the filling. Price was 6020 Colones, so 12 dolars. Open from mon-sat: 7am to 7pm, sun: 8am to 5pm. WhatsApp: +506 8324 9595. Answer right away.

name: LA LEONA WATERFALL FOR FREE
description:
You can park your camper at the ioverlander pin "riverside" and walk to this waterfall always following the river!! You have to cross it a few times and the last part you have to swim 10 meters to see the waterfall, there is a rope to grab from anyway. We recommend to bring a waterproof bag to put cellphones, cameras, etc. and good shoes! (It's a medium-dificult trek). There are a lot of deep pools in the way to refresh, the waterfall is very nice and the color of the water is a beautiful blue! 
As argentinians is very expensive for us to pay a guide, and no one owns the waterfall, so we went by ourselves being cautious and could enjoy anyway!! 3.5 hs there and back! 

Podes estacionar tu camper en el punto ioverlander "riverside" y caminar hasta esta cascada siempre siguiendo el río! hay que cruzarlo un par de veces y la última parte para poder ver la cascada hay que nadar unos metros, igualmente hay una soga para agarrarse. Recomendamos llevar una bolsa o mochila impermeable para el celu, la cámara, etc. Y buen calzado!! Es un trekking de dificultad media. En el camino hay varios pozones para refrescarse, la cascada está muy buena y el color del agua es un azul hermoso! 
Como argentinos un guía nos resulta carísimo, y la cascada no es propiedad de nadie, así que fuimos con cuidado x nuestra cuenta y lo super disfrutamos! 3.5hs ida y vuelta! 
~

name: Laboratorio Diesel - Digasa
description:
Diesel Injection Laboratory. Highly recommended, solved my problem on the same day, Diesel injection pump specialists. Fair and reasonable price.
---
Laboratorio de Inyección Diesel. Muy recomendado, me solucionaron el problema en el mismo día, especialistas en bomba de inyección Diesel. Precio justo y razonable.

name: Proyecto de Abejas
description:
Paraiso en El Campo 

We just ended up at this place, because they have a metal bee and a sign at the entrance, wich says, that they sell honey. Since we’re beekeepers ourselves, we just drove in there and after a nice chat we eventually got stuck for four days & nights. Rafael and his family are gorgeous and friendly people and before we were able to plan or think, we were in somehow part of this nice group of people. We made tours around their campo, wich includes their own piece of jungle, went to visit other family members houses, went to the hot springs at night, worked on our car together and helped them out with processing cañas into sugar. As we found out later, Rafael is a certified tour guide and in general, the whole family knows a lot about the nature of the area. And they keep something like 17 (!) different kinds of (wild)bees, wich was just crazy for us to see. Simply super interesting and kind people. 
We recommend to make a stop here if you pass by. You can get some delicious honey, some good experiences and maybe find some new friends. As well you can make guided hikes (even several day hikes to get really into it ;-) and get some good infos about Costa Rica. 

Entering the property only with small 4x4 or by feet. No big rigs possible. Not a real campground, but if you’re nice, you’re welcome to stay. Price for this is negotiable. Even a warm shower or a rentabel cabaña is accessible. Price for rooms 25-40$. National park Amistad is 15km away where also another cabaña for up to 10 persons is available. They just speak Spanish and if you want, you can eat together with them for a small price. 

If you’re a bit open minded and kind, you’ll love this far-away-from-commercial-tourism-experience. Enjoy! 

Number of Rafael: +506 86386873

name: Faldas volcán irazu
description: Big space to park and take pretty pictures besides the Irazú volcano. Very cold and strong winds - warning there is volcanic climate in here and it gets very bad after dark, also a 4x4 road and zone. Park rangers will patrol the zone at night but I would not recommend attempting to sleep here.

name: Centro Manu Night Tour
description: Night Tour with Kenneth in there beautiful reserve! You can see frogs, snakes and a lot of other night animals! Price 25$pp, but open for discounts for multiple persons/kids. Also beautiful birds: montezuma, toucans, hummingbirds, etc! We loved the place. Please contact Kenneth via website - www.centromanu.com

name: South of Avellanas over looking ocean
description: Open place over looking the ocean. Out of the way and no traffic.  I never seen anyone on a Saturday night. It’s only about 2 min south of Avellanas. Nice breeze and not to bad with bugs either.   Good for big rigs ….. not sure I would tent here.

name: Mary’s
description: It’s a lady named Mary Ellaina who sells gasoline from her house. It is Legit. Police escorted me there because I couldn’t find it haha.

description: Agua purificada station to refill bottles or garrafons inside the Maxi Pali supermarket

name: Water Fall Park los Quetzales
description: beautiful place from this point more 250 metros... there is a bridge and 2 laders. place no suitable to disable person. free

name: Poza - Tobogan
description:
Private finca... Really beautifull and you do not need to walk to much to get in the blue water. 
did not ask the price because the owners kindly let in for free. was raining. And they taught a place do sleep at Bajos del Toro...

name: Bajos Del Toro - Super El Toro
Cabañas Don Beto
description:
If you you want to stay here for volunteering, you will be staying in one of our shared wooden cabins  $10 a night by person . There is also a possibility to camp on our property for $5 a night by person 
We have an open kitchen in the garden, a washing machine and bikes for you to use and wifi 
You are close to the supermarket and the bus station and only three kilometers from the next Beach.

description: Showers located at the back of the Coco restaurant. Entrance through the mini market. Price 1000 or 2000 C (I don't remember), cold water. Well-appointed cabins with height shelf for clothes and hooks for towels. Perfectly located a few dozen meters from a magnificent spot for campervans.

name: kalambu hot spring
description:
parking of water Park Kalambu Hot spring.
They allow us to park for the nigth at thé entrance of thé parking.
we really enjoy the water Park and hot pools from the volcano. Slides for all the family.
entrance 20$/ adult around 15$) child
shower

name: Police Station
description: water tap in the Police station... ask first to the policeman and he said no problem.

name: Bio Health Diagnostik
description: We're here because of a cut finger.  Was recommended to us by our Arbnb host and he goes here too.  Were there straight away, no waiting time.  Very careful, quiet work.  The finger was stitched very well.  It's very modern.  We would come again if we have medical problems.

name: Soda lucrecia
description: Very good cheap food with large portions.  Super Service

name: Plaza Moin Parking
description:
Parking lot in front of a mall/plaza with several fast food stores.
Directly at the mainroad, it’s outside but there is an „entrance“ about 3m high max.
We asked the security if we can stay for the night and sleep inside our Van, he said no problem.
Wifi and toilets from the plaza and electric outlet at the light poles.

name: german bakery

name: soda

name: Pavones Surf Camp
description:
Oceanfront Campsites: Enjoy breathtaking ocean views from your own campsite. Our pitches are equipped with everything you need for a comfortable stay, including access to electricity and water.

Fully Equipped Communal Kitchen: Prepare your favorite meals in our communal kitchen, where you'll find everything you need, from appliances and cookware to tables and chairs. It's a perfect space to socialize with other guests and share experiences.

Clean and Modern Bathrooms: Maintain your personal hygiene in our spotless, clean and modern bathrooms. 

Electricity and Wi-Fi: Stay connected to the outside world with access to electricity at your campsite and free Wi-Fi throughout the campground.

Surf School:

Surf Lessons for All Levels: We offer surf lessons for all levels, from complete beginners who have never touched a board to seasoned surfers looking to refine their skills. Our experienced and passionate instructors will provide you with the personalized attention you need to progress at your own pace.

Access to World-Class Waves: Catch some of the best waves in Costa Rica right at our campground. We offer access to a variety of waves, perfect for surfers of all abilities.

Surfboard Rentals: No need to bring your own surfboard; we offer high-quality surfboard rentals for all experience levels.

Other Facilities:

Surfskate Area: Practice your surfing skills on land at our dedicated surfskate area. It's a great way to warm up before a surf session or practice your maneuvers without the waves.

Hiking Trails: Explore the natural beauty of the surrounding area on our hiking trails. We offer trails for all fitness levels, taking you through rainforests, to breathtaking viewpoints, and more.

Beach Access: Enjoy everything the beach has to offer with direct access from our campground. Soak up the sun, swim, play in the sand, or simply relax and listen to the waves.

Amenities:

Free Parking: Park your vehicle free of charge in our ample parking lot.

On-Site Surf Shop: Pick up everything you need for your surf session at our convenient on-site surf shop, offering a wide selection of boards, wax, and more.

Bike Rentals: Explore the surrounding area on a bicycle. 

Barbecue Area: Cook your own meals outdoors in our designated barbecue area. It's a perfect place to gather with friends and family and enjoy a meal together.

Laundry : Keep your clothes clean during your stay with our laundry service.
