description: Excelente servicio. Mecánicos especialistas en sistemas de freno. Nos rectificaron un disco de freno, nos cambiaron las 4 pastillas de freno que tuvieron que fabricar ellos por que no hay en Costa Rica de nuestro modelo. Una MB 180 D del año 1995. Hicieron el trabajo en el mismo día y nos cobraron 56mil colonos. Super recomendables.

name: zii wifi
description: free wifi on street. costa rica seems to have these all over the country. great idea. works well

name: Restaurant Paella Bar Oropendola
description: Manu, the owner will make you a crazy paella. Everything is explained, he is Spanish. The plus: you can see oropendolas birds. Their nests are right in front of you while eating. A spectacle of pendulous birds not to be missed. Manu is a kind-hearted and very warm man. A step not to be missed.

name: washboard bato
description: laundromat with cafeteria, you do it yourself.  It's great, the washing machines and dryers are super big, they fit a lot of clothes.  It takes 1 hour (30 minutes for each machine) if you bring the soap it costs 3,000 if not the soap costs 500. The truth is a very good option.  It is on the main route so you can park perfectly at the door

name: Osa surf hostel
description:
This hostel is form the same owners as Osa surf camping.
The hostel has a couple of rooms.
open kitchen and living room.
The owners are verry nice people. They helped us out a lot.

name: Golfo Dulce Aventuras Tropicales
description:
Nice place for bioluminescence tour in kayak. We were a group of 11 persons and managed to negociate a 2 hours tours for $30 per person. 
We were well welcomed by all the team. We ate at their restaurant after the tour. It was delicious. 
It’s possible to take a shower and to refill the the tank with water. You can sleep in the street, it’s a dead end street.

name: Parts store
description: Blue sign and great parts store for American and Japanese cars.

name: Colectivo to Carate
description:
Colectivo to Carate
Where: Next to „Materiales“ store
When: 6am to Carate, 4pm back from Carate
Attention: schedule depending on the season. Sometimes they bring you to Carate in the morning but there is no collectivo back at 4pm! Best would be to check with the driver on whatsapp on the day before.
Whatsapp-number: +50686442673 (Mario Marin)

name: aventuras café
description:
The best restaurant if all Costa Rica with very fair Price. 
Everything is home made even the bread for hamburger. 
All thé team is very welcoming and nice. 
They let us use shower.
They also offer bioluminescence tour.
Our best expérience in Costa Rica

name: Tour gold miner with José
description:
José is an excellent guide. we were lucky to meet him and do a tour with him.
walking through thé jungle, had Manu explanation about gol miner, looking for gold and find some. Make sugar cane with him on his property.
Amazing tour ! he also offers other tour in thé area.

name: tap of water in the road
description:
Water tap on the side of the road, at a bus stop, perfect for carrying water, very good pressure, a local just came and told us it was drinkable!  (common in costa rica)

grifo de agua en el lado de la ruta, en una parada de autobus, perfecto para cargar agua, muy buena presión , justo vino un lugareño y nos dijo que era potable!

name: veterinaria rodeo
description: Karina is very nice and helpfull. she made all papers in less than an hour to pass the border. Cost 150$

name: Mirador y Recreación Bambú
description: Nice campsite with fantastic views of Cartago. We went there yo camp at Rancho Camuri next door but found Bambú looking much more inviting. Friendly owners live in the house on the left side of the dirt road right at the beginning of the flat area with the seating areas and hammocks. Road in is a little rough but any car can make it. Yolanda speaks decent English. Charged us 5000Col/person/night. There's plenty of level parking, very nice covered seating areas with tables, chairs and sinks. Many friendly dogs and a horse roaming around. If you park close enough the house you can use the owner's WiFi. Flush toilets were good and they gave us a key to an event space with good showers. Both not the cleanest but OK. We really enjoyed our stay and recommend the place. You can contact them on 8791-1619.

name: Public Parking in Playa Grande
description:
We spent 2 nights in this parking lot. During the day several surfers come to enjoy the waves and at night it is super quiet. Next door there is a rental house that was empty and its watchman Marcos offered us water. Good Liberty signal, no wifi. Hay carteles que no se permiten mascotas aunque todo el mundo viene con ellas sin restricción. 

Pasamos 2 noches en este estacionamiento. Durante el día vienen varios surfistas a disfrutar de las olas y a la noche es súper tranquilo. Al lado hay una casa de alquiler que estaba vacía y su sereno Marcos nos ofreció agua. Buena señal de Liberty, no wifi. No pets allowed at the beach but people Bring them anyway.

name: CABINAS PIPE VARGAS
description: The owner offered us a big cabana for two people. mosquito net, kitchen, bathroom, WiFi. everything you will need. we were allowed to collect mangos from the trees on this property. we paid 40 US Dollar for two people.

name: Cerritos Vueltas Lodge
description: This is a gorgeous place to camp in our van or you can stay in their handmade lodge. Situated at nearly 10,000 ft it’s the cool temperatures we have been dreaming about since crossing into Central America. The property has many miles of hiking trails, old growth forests. There are a handful of places to park with wonderful views. The family that runs this speaks fluent English and Spanish. The road here is very well kept dirt/gravel suitable for most any 2WD.

name: Pali market
description:
In the car park of the Pali supermarket there is a tap with water, it has good pressure, we don't know if it is drinkable. We charged up without asking.
---
En el estacionamiento del supermercado Pali se encuentra una canilla con agua, tiene buena presión, no sabemos si es potable. Cargamos sin preguntar.

name: Calle Trece Free
description:
We slept one night on this street, the neighborhood looks very nice, we feel safe. The street does not have e-parking, it is free. It has a small park with trees and greenery.
----
Dormimos una noche en esta calle, el barrio se lo ve muy lindo, nos sentimos seguros. La calle no tiene e-parking, es gratuita. Tiene un pequeño parque con árboles y verdes.

name: Pequeño Estacionamiento
description:
We slept here 2 nights waiting to go to the Poas volcano, it feels safe and is not noisy despite being next to the road. Parking is free and small, it has a slight slope but nothing that is not tolerated.
‐------------
Dormiros aquí 2 noches esperando para ir al volcan poas, se siente seguro y no es ruidoso a pesar de estar al lado de la ruta. El estacionamiento es gratuito y pequeño, tiene una leve pendiente pero nada que no se tolere.

name: Coco Verde
description: A simple guesthouse, probably the cheapest in this area. I paid $20 for a private room with fan and shared shower/toilet which is clean. U can also make reservation via Booking.com (but the price is slightly higher). The lady Doña Maria is nice. She gave me drinking water. This place is very near to the beach & central. Theres a small kitchen where u can cook yr food. This place is not signed but it is right to the end of the road. Limited parking available for cars & motorcycles.

name: calle con espacio para aparcar
description:
It is not easy to find a street with parking space in this area of ​​the city, which is a good, safe and quiet neighborhood.  This street has a "dirt" area in front of an empty lot and a construction store, you do not disturb the neighbors and you are well parked.  The street is a bit hilly but it wasn't a problem for us, we didn't find anything better either.  We spent two nights here, the first everything was ok, the second the police came to see that everything was in order since the neighbors had called because there was an "unknown vehicle."  There is some noise from the road but as we say we couldn't find anything better in the area to be able to park, it worked for us.

no es fácil encontrar una calle con espacio para aparcar en esta zona de la ciudad, que a la zona buena, barrio seguro y tranquilo. esta calle tiene una zona de "tierra" frente a un terreno vacío y una tienda de construcción, no molestas a los vecinos y estás bien aparcado. la calle tiene algo de cuesta pero para nosotros no fue un problema, tampoco encontramos nada mejor. pasamos dos noches aquí, la primera todo ok, la segunda vino la policía para ver qué todo estuviera en orden ya que los vecinos habían llamado porque habia un "vehículo desconocido". hay algo de ruido de la carretera pero como decimos no encontramos nada mejor en la zona para poder estacionar, a nosotros nos sirvió.

name: House of the Macaws
description: Nice Hotel with pool an beach access. A lot of Macaws flying around. we asked for the most cheap room and got a french bed with air conditioning for 20000 Colon. beautiful spot. around 5 pm more and other parrots came around.

name: Apartamentos Tamar
description: They offer cheap and clean apartments with kitchen, wifi and AC. Very quiet and everything in walking distance. We paid 17000 Colon per night. High recommendation.

name: Hotel Roof - Dog Daycare and Kennel
description:
Great day care and overnight kennel for dogs. We left our dog here for 10 days while we left the country and he had a great time. The dogs get lots of socialization and play time. The owner lives at the kennel, so there is always someone there with the dogs. She also speaks English and is prompt to respond to WhatsApp. They also send loads of photos everyday and gave our dog a bath before we picked him up at the end of his stay. He was a happy stress free pup when we returned! We would definitely return to this doggie kennel again. 

Dogs must have all of their vaccines and be neutered, and before booking an overnight stay, they ask to do a daycare trial and will check to make sure your dog socializes well with the other dogs that stay regularly at the day care. 

Trial is 7,000CRC.
133,000CRC for 10 nights of boarding. 

WhatsApp: +506 6321 9642

Also, the Google maps location is incorrect. The Ways app is correct and GPS coordinates of this post are correct.

name: Parque del Café
description:
Street parking next to a nice park in an upscale neighborhood. Lots of people walking their dogs and enjoying the park during the day. Quiet at night. Coffee shops and restaurants nearby as well. We parked here for a few non consecutive nights and had no issues. 

If you park here, be discreet.

IG/YT: @hayleyandjake

name: Camera Equipment- Equipo Fotográfico (Foto Electrónica de Centro América Limitada)
description:
Very well stocked camera store. We went because we were looking for a UHS-2 SD card, which they have in stock. Responds to WhatsApp, some employees speak great English. 

Hours when we were here were 9am - 5pm. 

Reasonable prices 👍

The store is located in what looks like a White House with horizontal black gating, we got buzzed in as we walked up. 

https://equipofotografico.com/

name: Beach camping at end of Bay
description:
There’s a nice area for beach camping right at the end of the bay. Nearish a hotel and where the locals come to go to the beach. 

Areas for both shade and or sun. Quiet at night, no surf. Can swim to the island.  

IG & YT Hayleyandjake

name: camping on the beach
description: nice spot on the beach, in front of the restaurant. you can use the bathroom and ask for the wifi

name: Sunset waterfalls camping
description: Working farmette with 6 vehicle camper sites and 5+ tent sites.  Bathroom, shower and bbq available.   Property has trails to 10 private waterfalls.  Enjoy a day hiking the falls and an evening with an amazing sunset.

name: water tap
description:
water tap in the irrigation ditch in the square in front of the church, perfect for connecting your hose and filling the tank.  We don't know if it is drinkable.  There is another tap on this same street on the right corner in front of the church behind the trash cans and in the plaza of the large fountain there is a drinking water tap to refill bottles and drums


Grifo de agua en la acequia de la plaza frente a la iglesia, perfecto para conectar la manguera y llenar el depósito.   No sabemos si es potable.   Hay otro grifo en esta misma calle en la esquina derecha frente a la iglesia detrás de los botes de basura y en la plaza de la fuente grande hay un grifo de agua potable para rellenar botellas y bidones.

name: Servicentro El Nispero
description: Very fine and good experience! Our multi-belt from our 2013 Volkswagen Crafter had fallen off. The problem was quickly identified, and they ordered OE parts from San José. Our tensioning component had fallen off the bus because a screw had broken. They were friendly, helpful, and kept us informed about the process. We slept safely for three nights at the mechanic's site, where we could shower, had Wi-Fi, and electricity! I would definitely recommend them!

name: Water tap.
description:
water tap free. Water tap free, I asked the fishing shop next door and they told me that they did not own this tap. I was able to charge my tank without any problems. I don't know if it is potable water
---
water tap free. Canilla de agua libre, pregunte al local de pesca que esta al lado y me dijo que no tenia dueño esta canilla. Pude cargar mi tanque sin problemas. No se si es agua potable

name: MONKEY HEAD BREWERY
description: Nice brewery if you are into artisanal beer. Super nice owner too ! They opened 1 year and half so come by.

name: Paragliding Tamanique
description:
We visited Tamanique because we are paraglider pilots traveling the Panamericana. Tamanique was recommended to us by the flying community of El Salvador. We had some beautiful flights here. (when the visibility is better you can probably even see the sea)

Our contact Rafael Partillio (+503 7526 5406) was super friendly and happy to help us. If you are pilots yourself do not fly without reaching out and getting permission and Infos on the site!

Rafa also offers commercial tandem paragliding flights at this site. So if you want a truly unique experience in El Salvador contact him before via WhatsApp! 

Additional Info: as we are traveling in a van we also slept here at the flat area at the beginning of the access road after asking Rafa. It was safe and we had no issues. You could probably also camp with a tent directly at the launch site after asking Rafa.

name: Gandoca Beach
description: Nice and calm beach super close to the boarder. Just follow the dirt road until you reach the beach. No river crossings, since new bridges were build. First the path looks not so nice, because there only banana plantations, but before Gandoca it changes to forest and you even have access to the wildlife Refugio to the left side of the beach. To the right is a Laguna where Manatis live. At certain time, you should leave the beach alone at night, since there’s turtle breeding season from may-july. Nice place, quite and safe. Ocean was a bit rough that day and because of the full moon, it had a bit more of this nasty sand flies. But really ok. Nice locals, space for maybe 2-3 small rigs. Big rigs could have trouble to turn around once they reached the beach. Watch out, sand is softer than it looks. Enjoy

name: Familia Aventura CR House
description:
Cristian and Mery. They are a family of travelers and live in San Ramon. They offer accommodation, Wi-Fi, drinking water, laundry, showers and everything they can for your time in San Ramon. We sleeped in the square but we used their services. They are happy to receive travelers and share experiences. They are very nice!!

name: Poponé Farm & Lodge
description:
We came by this pleasant place with a friendly owner that has a lot of nature around and that is at the end of an easy dirt road. This place with two cabanas started only three years ago. It has a mini-farm with cows, goats and chicken and sell quesos, yoghourt, dulce de leche, helados of goats. Its most level spot is currently in the middle of the alley though.

There is also a common space where you can eat and cook and a grassy area.

Night cost us 10$ per adult with Wifi, WC and shower exterior. Breakfast is available at additional cost.

name: Metanoia Sanctuary
description:
We are open for travelers! We have 16 hectares of private land. We are a community forming with room for campers. We live here on the land in our 12m school bus home and are trying to live off-grid and we have taken charge of preserving our 12 hectares of primary forest, forest that has never been cut down, we have room for any sized 4x4 vehicles. The road into the land is currently in construction but is passable by 4x4 for now and soon by any vehicle. 
We have running spring water to fill water tanks, and solar to top off batteries if needed. There is no trash service but there is a public trash can in Bijagua next to the police station. We have projects running all the time and welcome exchange for an hour or two of work of your choice. If you prefer to just stay and pay we ask for a donation. 

We sometimes have some of the following activities that you can join our family in and are all donation based.

Reiki - Sound Bowls 
Plant medicine healing ceremonies
Campfires
Full Moon Ceremonies
Energetic cleanses 
Temazcal (Mexican sweat lodge)
 
+506-7014-8342

Continue on this road for 1.5km until the road turns to dirt and follow for another 200-300m and arrive at our bus!

name: Isla Damas
description:
Lots of spots for wild camping along the beach with gorgeous ocean views and no one else around - turtles do nest here so you might get lucky and see one and as such please do take all your rubbish with you and don’t camp beyond the tree line. We stayed by the Baby Sea Turtle Release nursery and also had a tour there and helped with relocating turtle nests. There were toilets and water (potable and beach showers) available here, please do make a donation if you’re staying. Please note the host only speaks Spanish. 

IMPORTANT NOTE ON THE ROAD IN: the road in is a bit tricky and is only 4x4 appropriate in wet season (I can’t speak for dry season, we went in June). You can either get the small ferry over from Quepos which fits one car or take the turning off the 34 road which follows the Rio Cotos. This is a narrow and unmade track that was muddy and had lots of puddles. When you get into the village you need to turn to go down one of the tracks between the houses and onto the beach, drive along the top of the beach and when you see the lake on your right, you’ll be able to spot the track that takes you the rest of the way to the island. Google maps is reasonably accurate. Watch out for the tides, the island can sometimes be cut off on very high tides.
